loans.name: Kusasira Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: Thirty-nine year old Sarah M. belongs to Kusasira Development group-Mukono. A decade is the time she has been bearing a hand in a pharmacy business in Kikoza. She joined this business with the influence of her mother. Before that she was into charcoal sales and retailing. Monthly this business generates shillings 200,000 and with this loan, the mother of 2 says she is going to purchase more stock of drugs to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of medicine to resell.

loans.name: That

texts.en: That T.  L. is 58 years old.  She is a farmer whose main activities are focused on raising cows . She has milk to sell every day.  That T.  L. earns a  stabL. income from these activities to help support her family.  She has been a SEDA client since 2004 and has used her loans very effectively in expanding her cattL. raising. Last year she borrowed 4,142,000 VND to  buy grass and baby trees for food for the cows. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 5,450,000 VND to improve housing for her cows.

loans.use: To improve housing for the cows

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man M. sells a few wares, such as soft drinks, sweets for children, various cakes and cooking supplies, in front of her house. Her husband is a furniture maker, producing beds, cupboards and tables to meet the family’s living expenses. This couple has six children; two of them are married and four are single.

Man M.'s son, who is a fisherman, wishes to buy a lot of small fish to feed and then sell in order to earn additional income. Man M. really wants to encourage her son to achieve his goal, but she doesn't have enough money to make it possible. Therefore, Man M. would like to request a Kiva loan for her son to purchase small fish in bigger amounts.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of small fish

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy T. H. was born in 1962. She lives in Kim tien village with her husband, a carpenter, and her two sons. Thuy T. H. is a farmer, breeding pigs and poultry. She is now raising 6 pigs. Thuy T. H. and her husband have a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. She wants to have a workshop in the future; therefore, she is always trying to work to save money. Thuy T. H. has participated in SEDA since 2004 and has repaid her loans punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy pig feed.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico is a widower who lives in Brgy. San Pablo, Manapla, Negros Occidental. He earns his living by operating 3 businesses: sugarcane hauling, rice retailing and dry goods sales. He has 4 children between the ages of 22 and 35. Federico joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because he hoped for something better for his family. With the help of his past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and through his own efforts, Federico has been incrementally lifting his family out of poverty.

Federico's previous loan of PHP 2,500 helped him earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for his 9th loan, he is borrowing PHP 25,000, which he intends to use to pay for spare truck parts and to fund his other businesses so that he can continue to save up for the future expansion of his rice and dry goods businesses. Federico B. is a Dungganon man who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of his dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to buy spare truck parts and to fund his businesses

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong T. N. is 30 years old and has 2 children who are in primary school and kindergarten. Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice and vegetables  to meet  family food demands. She also raises 300 chickens for eggs to earn her daily income. Phuong T. N. has borrowed loans from the Seda credit program 7 times and has successfully invested in farming. Currrently, she wants to have a loan of 4,142,000 VND to buy chicken feed.
010140070006-4783

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en:
Lieu T. N. is 37 years old and has 2 children who both attend school. Being a farmer, she grows rice, onions and potatoes in a paddy of 4,500 square meters. Her agricultural products are used to meet her family's needs and are also sold in the market for daily income. Lieu T. N. has been a SEDA client since 2004 and is always a good group leader. This year, she wants to expand her farming with more varieties of vegetables; therefore, she wants to have a loan of 6,3220,000 VND to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to produce a high yield crop.
010140070005-4784

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: El

texts.en: El M., age 28, sells new clothes at the mobile place, Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. From this she and her husband are able to earn $8 a day to support their family. They have only one child, who is studying in school. Recently, El M. sold nearly all her inventory to her buyers, and she wants to replenish her stock but she lacks capital. She is, therefore, asking for a loan in order to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Teofreda

texts.en:
Teofreda is a married woman who lives in Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a food vending business. Her husband, Rolando V., who is 58 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living.  They have four children who are 22 to  29 years old. Teofreda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teofreda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000, with which she intends to buy additional stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of her business. Teofreda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase additional stock for the general store

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam M. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old. Mirriam is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mirriam owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables in the market. Mirriam has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mirriam joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mirriam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mirriam is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Mirriam from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Marima

texts.en:
Marima O. K. is 32 years old. He is married to Ann K. and is the father of five children, all of whom attend school. Marima is a farmer. For the past eight years, he has farmed his own piece of land. 

Marima learned about KADET LTD from a colleague who is already a KADET client. This will be his first loan and he is planning to prepare his land and buy farm inputs. With the profits he hopes to make from this loan, Marima plans to reinvest in his farm and plant more acres of wheat.

Marima is an industrious man who aims to achieve his goals. In the future, his hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to prepare land and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Ma. Louella

texts.en:
Ma. Louella is a married woman who lives in Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: the selling of chicken barbeque, a general store and a pig fattening business. Her husband, Nilo, who is 31 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living.  They have two children who are 8 and 12 years old. Ma. Louella joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Louella has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,000, with which she intends to purchase additional stock for her business so that she can continue to save up for the education of her children and for home repairs. Ma. Louella is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
45-year-old Charito is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 3 children. She is engaged in farming and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for more than 20 years already. She also runs a stall where she sells vegetables and dried fish. Charito works hard to improve her business and earn more for her family.

Charito joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charito has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Charito is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: From the province of Kompong Cham, Eng C. is a single woman who was divorced from her husband many years ago. She currently lives with two children, one of whom is single and the other one married. To earn a living, Eng C. cultivates a rice crop and has been farming since 2008, while her sons work in different jobs for a profit. Eng C. is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding purposes so she can also raise its offspring.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma lives in a single-room brick house in the city of Lahore with her husband and 4 children. Lahore is the second largest city of Pakistan and famous for its history and culture. 
Najma is a 32 year-old house wife who spends most of her time at home taking care of her family. 
Her husband’s name is L. M., and he is a very hardworking person. He is involved in two types of work. In the morning, he does a government job on a monthly wage, and in the afternoon he sells iron to customers.  
Najma’s children are enrolled in a local school and are getting an education. It is a great level of satisfaction of her that she is able to provide education to her children. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy iron in a larger quantity to fulfill customer needs and to increase his sales and profits. 
Najma is hopeful that her husband will be able to earn better profits by utilizing the loan and her family will be able to live a better standard of life. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 6th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy iron for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To prepare six acres for wheat planting

loans.name: At's Group

texts.en: This group loan includes six people who are living in the village of Prey Kray in Takeo province. With their portions of the loan they will each improve their families' standard of living. The group is led by Mr. At O.. Mr. At O. is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Choem Born, is a seamstress in a garment factory. Through these activities, they support four children, two of whom are employed in garment factories; the others are attending local public schools. Mr. At O. wants to breed some pigs, but he does not have enough money to start the business. So Mr. At O. is requesting a loan to by some piglets and pig food to start this new business.

loans.use: To by some piglets and pig food for breeding to start a new business.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   soft drinks dealer, cosmetics products and transport businesses. Her husband Bamberto, who is 37 years old, works as a driver to earn his living .  They have three children who are between 12 to 14 years old. Monaliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Monaliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, with which she intends to buy stock of soft drinks and cosmetics to sell so that she can continue to save up for the education of her children. Monaliza is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more cases of soft drinks and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Boaz Ouma

texts.en:
Boaz O. is a 24-year-old man from Kisumu, a lakeside city 500 kilometers from Nairobi, the capital of Kenya. He is married to Susan and they have a three-month-old child. He is the sole breadwinner of the family.

Boaz operates a motorcycle transport business (locally known as BodaBoda) in the heart of Kisumu, a business he has been running for the last two years.  He makes a monthly income of Kshs10,000. He recently joined KADET LTD and has applied for a loan of KES 51,000 to buy another motorcycle.  

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business by buying more motorcycles. He believes that by acquiring more motorcycles, his income will increase and he will be able to provide a source of employment to other young people in his home area. He is therefore looking for Kiva lenders to help him advance this dream.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Sau

texts.en: Sau T. N. is 43 years old.  Being a farmer, she has focused on growing rice and vegetables, and raising 200 chickens for meat.  Agricultural products are used for her family's food and are also sold to have income for daily use. In regard to her participation in our credit program, she is a good cluster leader. Currently, she wants a loan of 8,502,000VND to buy food and to improve the chicken coops.

loans.use: To buy food and to improve the chicken house.

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en: Fishing is the most essential part of Mrs. Hieng P.’s daily work. She and her husband have been in the fishing business on the river for more than ten years. This couple wakes up every morning, drives their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fishes. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market and sell to their regular buyers. Hieng P. and her husband also support their two children who are enrolled in school. Recently, this family couldn't catch as many fish as before because their boat is often broken. Therefore, Hieng P. is applying for a loan to buy a new boat to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To buy a new boat to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 49-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a business buying and selling vegetables and spices. She lives in Narra, Palawan. Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and through her own efforts, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty.

Teresita's previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,600, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she will use to buy stocks of vegetables and spices to sell so that she can continue to save up for future business improvements. Teresita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of spices and vegetables

loans.name: Ba

texts.en: Ba T. N. is 47 years old and has 2 children, one of whom is attending a  training course on driving. Ba T. N. is a farmer. Her main activities focus on growing rice, corn and vegetables and raising pigs for meat. She has operated this business for ages and it provides food to support herself and her family. She also sells her products in order to have cash to pay for daily expenses. Ba T. N. has been a client of our credit program since 2006 and has been a good group leader. She now wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy pig feed.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Mr. Vey Saut Village Bank Group

texts.en: In the village of Prey Kray in Takeo province, fifteen people have made up a village bank loan. Mr. Vey S. is the village bank president, who has been selected by the other members.  The members will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living situations. Mr. Vey S. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where he cultivates rice to sell to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Sok Koev Loem, is a seamstress in a garment factory. This couple supports four children: two are enrolled in the local public schoO., but the others are too young to work or study. Although they work hard, they earn only a small income. So Mr. Vey S. is asking for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business.  With the rest of the loan he will fix his motorbike and rebuild his kitchen.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.fr: Aphonsine W. est  née  en RDC, elle a 45 ans, et elle est veuve.   Elle a 5 enfants, entre 24  et 12ans  les 5 de ces enfants vont à l’école.  Son niveau d’éducation est secondaire, et elle a une expérience  de remboursement des prêts, car le prêt qu’elle sollicite est le cinquième prêt.  Elle va acheter 5 fenêtres métalliques ,4 portes de planches et 1 porte métallique ,6sacs de ciments et main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire de finissage de sa maison en vue de faire la location de sa maison d’habitation.  Elle voudrait aider ses enfants à terminer ses études, et assurer le bien être de sa famille dans les temps à venir.
texts.en:
Aphonsine W. is a 45 years old widow who was born in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. She has five children, aged 12 to 24. All five attend school. She herself studied up to middle school.

She's now seeking her fifth loan, to buy 5 metal windows, 4 wooden doors, one metal door, 6 sacks of cement, and to pay for the labor. He strategy for growth is to finish building her house, in order to rent it. She would like to help her children complete their studies, and ensure the well-being of her family for the future.

loans.use: To buy 5 metal windows, 4 wooden doors, one metal door, 6 sacks of cement, and to pay for the labor

loans.name: Luu

texts.en: Luu T. N. is 51 years old and has 2 children who attend high school . She is a very hardworking farmer. She is currently growing rice, beans and corn in a paddy of 3,600 square meters. Her agricultural  products are used to support her family's food demands and some is also sold  to earn daily income. Luu T. N. joined the Seda credit program  in 2007. She has used her loans very effectively and has always repaid them well. Luu T. N. wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy seeds and fertilizer for her next crop.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lai

texts.en: Lai T. N. is 53 years old and has 2 children who attend high school. She is  a very hardworking farmer. She is currently growing rice, beans and corn in a paddy of 4,200 square meters. Her agricultural products are used to support her family's food demands and some is also sold  to earn daily income. Lai T. N. joined the Seda credit program in 2007. She has used the loans very effectively and has always repaid them well. Lai T. N. wants a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy seeds and fertilizer for her next crop,

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura B. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tup, a small village in the Isykul region. She is 25 and married to a builder. Together they are bringing up a son and a daughter, both of preschool age.

In order to earn additional money to meet their family needs, Ainura breeds livestock and sells milk products, earning an additional 1,000 KGS per month. She applied for this loan because she needs money to purchase sheep to resell at a higher price after fattening. In the future, Ainura wants to increase her number of livestock and enlarge a shed to keep more farm animals. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Tin

texts.en: Tin T. N. was born in 1959. She lives in Ha Lam 2 village and has two sons. Tin T. N. is a farmer who breeds pigs and cows. She is now raising 6 pigs  and two  cows.  Every 3 months, she earns 4,000,000 VND  profit from selling cattle. Tin T. N. intends to raise a large quantity of cows so she needs to increase her experience. She has participated in SEDA since 2004 and has always repaid her loans punctually. Tin T. N. would like to borrow 4,142,000 VND for pig feed.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
Nagina lives in Lahore, a historic city in Pakistan. She has spent all her married life in the area of Yadgar, one of the historic places in Lahore. Nagina is a 46-year-old housewife, who prefers to stay at home and do her household work. She has 3 sons; her 2 elder sons are electricians by profession and her youngest one is studying in 9th grade.

Nagina’s husband has a business producing shoe buckles. He makes deals with different shoe companies and provides them with buckles on order. Nagina has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy iron in larger quantities to help him produce buckles in bulk and to fulfill customer demands on time.

Nagina wants to marry her eldest son who is now 26 years old. She is hopeful that an increased profit will help her save money for that purpose. Nagina is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: to buy iron to make shoe buckles

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 28-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 businesses: meat vending and livestock trading She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.

Analyn now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 in order to help fund business operations. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Analyn hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to theNWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund business operations

loans.name: Dorcas Saetua

texts.en:
Dorcas saetua K. is 24 years old. She is married to Julius and she is the mother of two school-aged children. She farms her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last three years.

She learned about KADET LTD through an awareness program done by KADET staff in her area of residence. This will be her first loan from KADET, which she plans to use to buy farm supplies. With the profits she hopes to make, she intends to plant wheat on a bigger piece of land and save to educate her children.

Her future dream is that she will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where she will be able to do commercial farming. Dorcas works hard and she only needs the resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a married woman who lives in Puerto Princesa City, Palawan. She earns her living by operating 2 businesses: a butcher shop and a mini-pharmacy. Her husband, Jerry, 45 years old, earns his living as a vendor. This couple has 3 children who are between 12 and 23 years old.

Diana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and through her own efforts, Diana has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy various meats, sausages and chicken so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her children's education. Diana is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase various meats, sausages and chicken

loans.name: Mwanyangiri Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en: M. Sezalia, 48 years old, started off in farming before she embarked on retailing as her main source of livelihood 6 years ago in Mwanyangiri-Mukono. The happily married mother of 2 says she mostly sells sugar, soft drinks, salt, soap, etc. Sezalia still does farming, though on a much lower scale. Her business generates 70,000 UGX weekly. Sezalia will use this loan to purchase more general merchandise commodities to resell. She belongs to the Mwanyangiri Women's group-Mukono.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities

loans.name: Hezron Onyango

texts.en:
Hezron W. is a 40-year-old Kenyan entrepreneur from Kisumu, a city along the shores of Lake Victoria. He is married to Grace who operates a retail shop and they have three children aged 16,14 and 12 years.

For the last three years, Hezron has successfully operated a motorcycle transport business within Kisumu town. He makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES. When he desired to expand his business, he immediately joined KADET LTD to gain access to micro credit. Hezron has applied for a loan of 81,000 KES to buy another motorbike.

Hezron will save his future profits to buy another motorbike and provide for his family's basic needs. His desire is to own more than five motorcycles and to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  a rice distribution business and a pig fattening business.  Her husband Ricardo B., who is 47 years old, works as an engineer to earn his living.  He also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 15 to 26 years old. 

Marieta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15th loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marieta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 60,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 16th cycle loan, Marieta s borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to buy stocks of rice and feeds to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education. Marieta is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her rice business

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura O. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 22 and is married to a taxi driver. 

This young family earns money to cover their personal expenses by reselling coal. They started this activity two years ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms and now they earn 12000 soms per month. 

With the money received from the loan, Ainura wants to increase the turnover of her business and purchase more coal for sale. In the future, she wants to save money to purchase a big house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To buy coal to resell

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Lon S., 27 years old, owns a kiosk in front of her house where she sells a variety of Khmer cakes. She typically makes around US$ 2 in profit each day to use for the family. She has a life partner in her husband, who works as a motor taxi driver and earns an average income $3 per day. Lon has one child who does not yet go to school. 

Lon S. says that husband always helps her buy products to sell before beginning his workday as a motor taxi driver.  Unfortunately, his existing motorbike often breaks down during use. Because of that, Lon S. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva, which she will use to replace the broken motorcycle for her husband.

loans.use: To replace broken motorcycle for her husband's taxi business

loans.name: Mariyln

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Vista Alegre, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: buying and selling nipa, running a general store, and operating a fish pond business. Her husband Francisco, who is 61 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 3 children who are between 31 to 36 years old. 

Marilyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marilyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7000, uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29500, which she intends to use to purchase raw materials and stock her general store so that she can continue to save to repair her fish pond and operate that business. Marilyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To stock general store

loans.name: Ruthse

texts.en:
Ruthse is a 36-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and an electronic re-loading business. She lives in Sta. Catalina, Negros Oriental. 

Ruthse has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and electronic re-loading business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly profit of PHP 3,000. 

Ruthse is borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Ruthse aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To use as working capital for business

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a 60-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 businesses: buying and selling charcoal and firewood and a peanut butter business. She lives in Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. 

Pacita has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her charcoal and firewood and peanut butter businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12000. 

Pacita is  borrowing PHP 10000 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 20 cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Pacita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

"

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 40 years old.  She is a resident of Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 26 years. She is the mother of 2 daughters, both are studying in a local school. 

Mariam's husband operates a grocery store in the community. He sells daily use items such as cooking oil, rice, sugar and spices, etc. at cheap rates.  Mariam supports her husband financially by doing sewing work.  She takes orders from her neighboring clients and completes them on time to earn income.   

Mariam's husband wants to add more groceries to his store to increase his business.  For this purpose, Mariam has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. A larger stock of groceries will help her husband offer more range of products to his clients and make more sales.  She is hopeful that her husband will be able to improve his business after this loan investment, and as a result her family will be able to enjoy better facilities in life. 

Mariam is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 6th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and had never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy larger stock of groceries for grocery store

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has been operating a goat fattening business for the past two years, selling the fattened goats at the market to her neighbours.  In her business, Magdaline faces a major challenge in the high cost of transporting her goats to the market. She hopes to expand and start a cow selling business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase goats to fatten and sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for sale

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Corte, Carmen, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store business.  Her husband Roque, who is 37 years old, works as a painter to earn his living.  They have four children from 5 to 11 years old. 

Eliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Eliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,100, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use to add more stocks for her customers so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. 

Eliza is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase shoes and belts to resell

loans.name: Monica Owino

texts.en:
Monica Owino is 46 years old and a modest lady from the County of Migori, a town along the shores of Lake Victoria, Kenya. Monica is widowed and takes care of six children single handedly.

Monica operates a clothes-selling business in Migori town where she stocks new clothing only. She has run her business for the last 24 years and has been very successful. She makes a monthly income of 94,000 KES. Monica joined KADET LTD a long time ago and is requesting her sixth loan, which she will use to buy new clothing to sell. 

Monica is optimistic that she will reap good profits with her new stock. She will put her profit back into her business well as use some funds to support her family. Being a single mother, her hope and dream is to help her daughter open a retail shop to increase the family income.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Koul

texts.en:
Koul K. lives in the province of Kompong Tom.  She earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offsprings and for slaughter. In addition, she also assists her husband in cultivating crops on her own farmland. This couple has one child, who is a fisherman. 

Koul K. will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of a farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming.  She will use this land to do farming. The loan will provide her with an additional new asset.

loans.use: To buy land to farm

loans.name: Terbish

texts.en: Terbish is 52 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live together in small house on their plot of land. His daughter attends university. His wife is retired. Terbish has operated a taxi service in city for the past ten years. He has gained a lot of experience over the years, and is a trusted driver for many customers, saying, "My family’s living conditions have improved a lot since I started running the taxi service and I provide a good education for my daughter until she graduates from university." He is requesting a loan to increasing his business capital and purchase some spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To increase working capital and purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Lemeria Ole

texts.en:
Lemeria Ole K. is 55 years old. He is married and the father of nine children who attend school. K. is a farmer who works on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last five years.

He learned about KADET LTD from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan. He is planning to buy farm supplies and prepare the land for planting. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to buy more land for farming to increase his wheat output.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land so that he can plant wheat on a large scale. Despite his age, K. is hardworking, and, with the right resources at his disposal, he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and prepare land for planting

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman who lives in Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a fishing and fish selling business. Her husband Felipe, who is 52 years old, works as a fisherman to support his family. They have 8 children who are between 14 and 28 years old. 

Josephine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Josephine has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3000, uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 14th loan, Josephine is borrowing PHP 10000, which she intends to use to purchase fishing materials and to maintain fishing equipment, so that she can continue to save up for future needs and for her children’s education. Josephine is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials and maintain equipment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jinifer

texts.en:
Jinifer is a 30-year-old married who supports her family by operating general store, a carinderia (eatery), and a ready-to-wear clothes business.  She lives in Compostela, Cebu. 

Jinifer has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,400. 

Jinifer is borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell.   This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Jinifer aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Kennedy Ole

texts.en:
Kennedy Ole T. is 35 years old, married to Naimodu T. and the father of four children. Kennedy is a farmer and he works on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last four years.

He learned about KADET LTD from a campaign done by the KADET staff. This will be his second loan and he is planning to buy farm supplies. Wheat has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climate conditions. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more wheat for commercial use and to buy his own farm machinery. He is a hardworking man who is focused to his set goals.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en:
Consolee is 28 years old, married, and has one child who is three years old. Consolee sells clothes for a living.  She has been in this business for the past five years. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. 

Consolee will use this loan to purchase more women's clothes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Consolee plans to renovate and expand her current house. She dreams of importing the clothes herself in order to make more profits.

loans.use: To purchase women's clothes to resell

loans.name: Tharcis

texts.en: Tharcis owns a hardware shop. He is 43 years old, married, and has four children. He works together with his wife. Tharcis has been selling metals and other plumbing supplies for eleven years. His loan will be used to add more metals to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to increase the volume of his business. In the future, he wishes to own a big shop which supplies different kinds of metals.

loans.use: To buy metals for his hardware store

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

He has been operating a bicycle repairs shop for the last ten years.  His potential customers are local neighbours. Patrick faces a major challenge in delayed payments by debtors and the high cost of transportation. He hopes to become a dealer of motorcycle spare parts and sell as a wholesaler in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan, he wants to purchase bicycle spare parts, tires, brake hoods, spokes and chain wheels. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bicycle parts

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Chhay Y. is a 56-year-old farmer and single mother who lives in Kompong Cham province. She was blessed with six children, three of whom are single and the other three are married.  

One of Chhay Y.'s sons is a leader in the construction business. He has a few physical laborers to help him provide his service. He has received a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses.  However, he lacked the construction materials needed to support his business. Therefore, Chhay Y. will use her loan for her son to purchase the necessary construction equipment so he can run his business smoothly.

loans.use: To purchase construction equipment for her son's business

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a married woman who lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: a rice retailing business, farming, and a food vending business.  Her husband Herman, who is 52 years old, works as a farmer and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 5 children who are between 5 and 17 years old. 

Christina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Christina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 1500,  uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 4 cycle loan, Christina is borrowing PHP 12000, which she intends to use as working capital for her businesses, so that she can continue to save up for future business improvements. Christina V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as working capital for businesses

loans.name: Innoncent

texts.en:
Innoncent is 35 years old.  He is married and has two children between 12 months and 3.5 years old. He sells different goods such as lotions, biscuits, sugar, etc. He has been in this business for about ten years.  His shop is open from 8am until 7pm every day except on weekends. His business is well-organized and he employs one other person.

Innoncent has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through adding a variety of goods to sell.

With this loan, Innoncent has a vision of growing his business to the level where he can even start wholesaling. If he starts wholesaling, he hopes to earn more profits than before, which in turn will be used to further reinvest in his business and save for the future.

loans.use: To expand his boutique

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two businesses: furniture making and an eatery. Her husband, Decembert, 36 years old, earns his living as a carpenter and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children, aged 10 months to 12 years old, 3 of whom currently attend school.

Edna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 2 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and through her own efforts, Edna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 3rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to purchase more materials so that she can continue to save up for the future. Edna is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.
