loans.name: Ndie Ole

texts.en:
Ndie Ole N. is 52 years old. He is married and is the father of nine children. He has been growing wheat in Narok for 11 years with good income. 

He learned about KADET LTD from a member of a group who is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan, and he plans to buy chemicals to spray wheat and also buy fertilizer. Wheat has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climate conditions. 

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and practice large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy chemicals to spray wheat and also buy fertilizer

loans.name: Never Fail Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Never Fail” group. They are small scale businesswomen in the northern city of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and earn better profit. 

Abibatu J. is the leader of this group. Abibatu was born in one of the several villages that make up Sanda. She is 22 years of age and married to a student. The couple has 1 child who is attending primary school. Abibatu has been producing and selling soap and palm oil for 2 years. With the help of this loan, Abibatu will buy gallons of palm oil and soap-making materials in order to produce a larger quantity of soaps for sale.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil and soap-making materials

loans.name: Bora Group

texts.fr: Eliza K.  est entrepreneur, membre du groupe d’affaire bora, âgée de 55 ans, veuve, mère de 4 enfants parmi les quels 3 étudient et l’autre n’étudie pas faute de moyens. Eliza K.  est  vendeuse des habits pagnes pour dames. Elle s’installe au marché central de Virunga. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu de sa fille ainée. Il ya 10 ans qu’elle est en activité. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises (4 doubles des pagnes).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, passer le reste de sa V. en paix selon L. volonté de Dieu. L. cliente Eliza K. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe bora est constitué de 29 membres.
texts.en: Eliza K. is an entrepreneur. She is a member of the Bora business group, aged 55 years, widowed, and the mother of four children, three of whom are students.  The fourth is not able to study due to lack of money.  Eliza K. sells pagnes (lengths of colored cloth used for clothing) for women.  She sets up at the central market in Virunga. She was able to start her business with money received from her oldest daughter.  She has been in business for ten years. This new loan will allow her to stock up on new merchandise (four bundles of pagnes).  In addition, she aspires to grow her business and spend the rest of her life in peace according to the will of God.  Eliza K. thanks Hekima for their work dedicated to poor women who are excluded from the traditional banking system.  The Bora group is made up of 29 members.

loans.use: 4 bundles of pagnes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kymbat's Group

texts.en:
Kymbat R. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tup, a small village in the Isykul region. She is 59 and married. She and her husband have raised three daughters and two sons, all now married. In order to earn money to cover their personal expenses, Kymbat breeds cattle and sells milk. Her husband works as a driver. With money received from this loan, the family wants to purchase a bull calf to resell at a higher price after fattening. In the future, Kymbat dreams of building a big house for her family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf

loans.name: Sikyomu Group-Mukono

texts.en: N. Harriet was inspired by a close acquaintance to start up a retail shop in Katosi-Mukono a decade ago. The friend had observed that a retail shop stocked with a variety of general merchandise in the Katosi trading center would be a lucrative venture. Before that, 45-year-old N. Harriet, a happy-go-lucky single mother of 3, was banking on profits from a banana sales business. She now sells essential commodities such as sugar, maize flour and rice and the business generates 200,000 UGX monthly. Harriet plans to use this loan to purchase more retail commodities to resell. Harriet belongs to the Sikyomu group-Mukono.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities

loans.name: Ita

texts.en:
Ita K. is 34 years old. He is married to Nalamae K. and is the father of three children. He operates a Kiosk in a rental premise, which he has been doing for the last seven years.
  
He learned about KADET LTD from a member of a group within his locality who is registered with KADET. This will be his first loan and he plans to buy more stock of goods for the shop, e.g., rice, wheat flour, tea leaves, cooking fat, etc. 

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest and educate his children. His hope and dream is to become a prominent businessman.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goods for the shop, such as rice, wheat flour, tea leaves and cooking fat

loans.name: Silivan

texts.en: Silivan is 29 years old and he has two children, 3 and 5 years old. His wife is a tailor and one of their children goes to school. Silivan has been a motorcycle taxi driver for 8 years. Because of his business, he has been able to afford to buy all home necessities such as chairs. Silivan is requesting a loan to top up his savings in order to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Ganchuluun

texts.en:
Ganchuluun is a 45-year-old single mother who lives with her son and mom in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, on her brother’s plot of land. Her son Tsogbadrakh is 22 and currently employed at Ochir Aldar LLC as a sales manager. Her mother is retired. 

Ganchuluun has been running a retail clothing business for many years. She rents a stall at Narantuul market, the biggest market in Ulaanbaatar. Ganchuluun buys her products from wholesalers who import them from China. She is a very hardworking and persistent person. 

Ganchuluun is requesting a loan to increase her working capital. In the future, she hopes to improve her family’s living conditions by expanding her business.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 30 years old and married to Caroline Auko, who is a businesswoman, and they are blessed with two children who both go to school. Michael is a carpenter and has been in business for the past ten years. His current monthly income is 20,000 KES.

Michael is requesting a loan of 22,000 KES to buy timber of different sizes. He plans to use the profit from his loan to expand his wife’s business and help educate his children. This will be his second loan and he successfully repaid his previous one. 

Michael’s dreams and hopes are to purchase a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase timber

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en: Samrith O. has been spending his life with cultivating crops in the province of Kompong Cham. He learned this skill from his grandparent when he was young. Samrith O. is now married and has four kids, two of whom are single, and two are married. His wife works in the farm fields frequently alongside him. Besides of farming business, Samrith O. and his wife also grow a few molds for making additional profit behind his house. Soon they will start a new step of planting mold, but they lack some material to do it. In order to solve this problem, Samrith O. would like a loan to buy raw material, and other equipments for growing small mold.

loans.use: To purchase raw material, and other equipments for growing small mold.

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en: Marianne has a 9 year old child, and she is married. She sells adult secondhand clothing and she works with her husband. Her business is doing well. She has done it for six years. Marianne is requesting a loan in order to buy more clothing to make more profits and expand her business.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a retail business for the last seven years, selling to her neighbours. Sidi faces a major challenge of seasonality. Sidi hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, litres of cooking oil and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, litres of cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Here is Sarah F., a small scale businesswoman in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. A native of Kabala town, Sarah sells market food – rice, palm-oil and groundnuts. She has been doing this business for ten years now. With a loan of SLL 1,000,000, she will buy bags of rice and groundnuts and gallons of palm-oil to add to her business. This will eventually lead to an increase in sales and profit for Sarah F.. Consequently, the 41 year old Sarah will be in a better position to look after her three children who are attending primary and secondary schools.

loans.use: Buys bags of rice and groundnuts and gallons of palm-oil to add to her business

loans.name: Makimbilio Group

texts.fr: Ntabanyere Joséphine  est entrepreneur, conseillère du groupe d’affaire Makimbilio, âgée de 60 ans, veuve, mère de 12 enfants. Grand mère de plusieurs fistons. Son fils ainé et cadet ont respectivement 45 et 22 ans. Tous ont leurs propres foyers. Ntabanyere Joséphine est  vendeuse de boissons (Primus et Fanta, Aigle). Elle s’installe à son domicile. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu de son mari dans leur jeunesse. vers les années 2010, elle  bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Il ya 30 ans qu’elle est en action. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits (5 casiers de Primus, 3 casiers de Fanta, 2 casiers d’Aigle).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, passer le reste de sa vie en paix avec ses fils, filles et ses petits fils. La cliente Ntabanyere Joséphine  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Makimbilio est constitué de 24 membres. les deux membres furent absents lors de prise de photo du groupe
texts.en:
Joséphine Ntabanyere is an entrepreneur and advisor of the business group Makimbilio.  She is 60 years old, widowed, the mother of 12 children and grandmother of several grandsons.  Her sons range in age from 22 to 45.  They all have their own homes. 
Joséphine Ntabanyere sells drinks (Primus, Fanta, and Aigle). She sells from her home.  She was able to start her business with money received from her husband when they were young. Around 2010, she received a loan of $50 from IMF Hekima.  She has been in business for 30 years.  This new loan will help her to stock up on new products (5 cases of Primus, 3 cases of Fanta and 2 cases of Aigle).  In addition, she aspires to grow her business and spend the rest of her life in peace with her sons, daughters and grandsons.  Joséphine Ntabanyere Katungu thanks Hekima for their work dedicated to poor women who are excluded from the traditional banking system. The Makimbilio group is made up of 24 members.  Two members were absent when the picture was taken.

loans.use: To buy drinks: 5 cases of Primus, 3 cases of  Fanta, 2 cases of Aigle

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mpalanyi

texts.en: 40 year old Mpalanyi I. is involved in a taxi transportation trade in Jinja. He has been a driver for almost 20 years now. Besides driving, the father of 4 also does some poultry farming. Weekly, he gets shillings 150,000. With this loan, I. says he is going to improve his taxi. He says he is going to purchase new tyres and also do servicing on his taxi.

loans.use: The purchase of new tyres and the servicing of his taxi

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe JIGUISSEME (5 mariées et 1 veuve) ont une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans, et ont en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait la vente de pomme de terre à travers  de MARIAM D. . 
MARIAM D.  compte acheter avec son  prêt  450 Kg de pomme de terre. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de SIKASSO auprès des grossistes. La pomme de terre est revendue en famille et au marché de HAMDALLAYE à Sikasso à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The six members of the Jiguisseme group (five are married, one is widowed) are on average 42 years old and have two children.  They live mostly in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a district of the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their second joint loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso because they want to be able to meet the demand of their clients. This group of women sells potatoes, as does Mariam D..

With her loan, Mariam D. plans to buy 450 kg of potatoes.  She gets her supplies at the main market in Sikasso from wholesalers.  The potatoes are resold within the family and at the market in Hamdallaye in Sikasso, to a clientele of men and women.

She foresees making an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will be used to meet daily family expenses.  

She aspires to increase her turnover to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman with four children, one of whom attends high school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For over thirty years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling as retail to her local neighbours. Teresa faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to become a big supplier of vegetables in the future.

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables and expand her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and expand her business.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en: Mustapha M. is a 40-year-old husband. He was born in the village of Sockolia, in northern Sierra Leone. Currently, he lives in Kabala town with his wife and two children. Mustapha has been a businessman for five years. He produces and sells balusters. Mustapha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 SLL from Kiva field partner Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) in order to expand his business. He will use the loan to buy cement, iron rods, and sand in order to produce a larger quantity of balusters for sale.

loans.use: To buy materials to make balusters

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA sont toutes mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans  et  en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de bois de chauffe à travers MARIAM T.. 
MARIAM T. compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1 chargement de camion 20 tonnes en bois de chauffe auprès des organisations paysannes agréées au niveau des marchés de bois des villages voisins .
Le bois est revendu en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant, en détail et souvent à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65.000FCFA utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the KOTOGNOGOTALA solidarity group are all married women who average 40 years of age and two children each. They live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This is their sixth collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to meet the needs of their customers. They sell firewood through Mariam T..

With her loan, Mariam T. plans to buy one 20-ton truckload of firewood from accredited rural organizations at the lumber markets in nearby villages. The wood will then be sold to family, to a clientele of both men and women, at retail, for cash and often on credit.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA, which will be used for the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SABALI sont toutes  mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  de fruits et légumes tels les oranges à travers de SITAN M.. 
SITAN M. compte acheter avec son  prêt, 25 sacs de  d’oranges. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de SIKASSO. La vente est faite en famille et au marché de HAMDALLAYE à Sikasso à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes? au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the SABALI group are all married women, averaging 35 years of age and 2 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in HAMDALLAYE, a neighborhood in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their second loan from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. This group of women sells fruits and vegetables, such as oranges, as does SITAN M..

SITAN M. intends to use her loan to buy 25 sacks of oranges. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Sikasso. She sells for cash, at her home and at the HAMDALLAYE market in Sikasso, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 70'000 (ca US$ 140), to be used to pay for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy oranges

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling products to her neighbours. Umazi faces a major challenge of high competition from other retail shop operators. 

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase two bundles of maize flour and a sack of sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont toutes mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de de riz  à travers MARIAM K.. 
MARIAM K.  compte acheter avec son  prêt  10 sacs de 100 kg de riz. Elle s’approvisionne à Ségou et Niono. Le riz est revendu au  marché de  HAMDALLAYE  et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the SABOUGNOUMA group are all married women, averaging 37 years of age and 3 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in HAMDALLAYE, a neighborhood in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their sixth loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. This group of women sells rice, through MARIAM K..

MARIAM K. intends to use her loan to buy ten sacks of 100 kg of rice. She gets her supplies in Ségou and Niono. She resells the rice for cash, at the HAMDALLAYE market, and at her home, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 80'000 (ca US$ 160), to be used to pay for the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Bulxar

texts.ru:
Bulxar M. 55 let. Ona ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. Bulxar yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Kalbadjar regiona, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione  vmeste so svoyey sestroy. Bulxar uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji raznix tovarov( naski, belyo, palotecno, platki i t.d).
Seychas ona nujdayetsa v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye svoyeqo magazina. Bulxar ranshe rabotala prodavshiccey v produktovom magazine a seychas ona imeyet svoy magazin dlya prodaji raznix tovarov.
texts.en: Bulxar M. is 55 years old.  She is not married and has no children.  Bulxar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and relocated from the Kalbadjar region.  She currently lives in the Fuzuli region together with her sister.  Bulxar has been involved in the business of selling various goods (socks, bedding, towels, scarves, etc.) for two years.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN in order to expand her store space.  Bulxar previously worked as a salesperson at a food market and now owns a store with various merchandise for sale.

loans.use: Expansion of store space

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI est constitué de 7  mariées et 3 veuves ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46  ans et  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULABA un des villages de la sous préfecture de NIENA  région de Sikasso (3e région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels le beurre de karité  avec KOROTOUMOU D.. 
KOROTOUMOU D.  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 50kg de beurre de karité.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de BOUGOULABA. Le beurre est  revendu au  marché de de BOUGOULABA et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant et en détail. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA utilise  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of ten members; 7 are married women and three are widows. They are all around 46 years old and have six children each. They generally live in polygamous families in Bougoulaba, a village in the Niena municipality in the Sikasso region (the third largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They are on their third loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance association, with the aim of better satisfying their customers' demands. They have successfully repaid all of their previous loans. These ladies are led by group leader Korotoumou D. and sell various products, such as shea butter. Korotoumou D. aims to use her loan to purchase 50kg of shea butter which she will source from the Bougoulaba market. She re-sells this butter by retail or wholesale at the Bougoulaba market, to her family members, and to a customer base made up of women and men. 
She aims to generate an average monthly wage of 40,000 FCFA which she will use to meet her family's everyday needs. She aims to boost her revenue in order to better meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: Purchasing shea butter

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Isatu B.. Born in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone, the wife and mother of three children is a small-scale businesswoman in Kabala town. Her husband is a businessman, and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Isatu wants a loan of 5,000,000 SLL in order to invest in her business. She sells dishes, pans, buckets, bowls, baskets, spoons, flasks, etc. Isatu has been a businesswoman for 22 years now. However, her business has been growing at a very slow pace due to the lack of sufficient capital. Thus she has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan in order to expand her business. With this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: Buys dishes, pans, buckets, bowls, baskets, spoons, flasks, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI sont toutes mariés à N’TDJILLA  avec une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans et en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à N’TDJILLA un des villages de la commune rurale de NIENA sous préfecture de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les deux prêts passés ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. 
DJENEBA D., qui est un membre de ce groupe, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 150kg de riz  et des condiments pour faire de  la restauration. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de N’TDJILLA. Elle fait la restauration à N’TDJILLA les jours de foire hebdomadaire à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes  généralement au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90.000FCFA  qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille .
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi solidarity group are all married women who average 40 years of age and five children each. They mostly live in polygamous families in N'TDJILLA, one of the villages of the rural community of Niena, a sub-prefecture of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).
This is their third collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. Both previous loans have been repaid in full.

Djeneba D., a member of the group, intends to use her loan to buy 150 kg of rice and some condiments for her restaurant activity. She buys her supplies at the N'TDJILLA market. She prepares and serves food at the weekly fair of N'TDJILLA to a clientele composed of both men and women, usually for cash.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA to be used for the daily expenses of the family.

loans.use: To buy rice and condiments

loans.name: Akmaljon

texts.en:
Akmaljon is married with two children. He sells women's clothing at two places. He takes all his inventory with him by car and provides local clients with the clothing they need. Akmaljon has been in this business for 11 years. He sells women's clothing because women buy new clothing more often. Akmaljon is a hardworking person. His goal is to fix his house and take good care of his children. He wants to borrow 3000 USD to purchase seasonal inventory. The loan would help Akmaljon to increase his sales and reach his goals faster.  
                                                          
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothing for resale

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA sont toutes  mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans et en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des  familles monogames à N’TDJILLA un des villages de la sous préfecture de NIENA  région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passé ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les calebasse avec  DJENEBOU D.. 
DJENEBOU D.  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  80 calebasses aux  marchés des villages voisins. Les calebasses sont revendus au  marché de T’DJILLA et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et en détails. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Dembagnouma group are all married women, on the average 32 years old, with four children. They live mostly in monogamous families in N’tdjilla, a village in the Sub-prefecture of Niena, Region of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).
They are on their third loan cycle with the microfinance institution Soro Yriwaso, with the goal of being able to meet customer demand. The previous loans have been properly repaid. This women’s group sells various items, for example, gourds, as Djenebou D. does. 

Djenebou D. plans to use her loan to purchase 80 gourds ast the nearby markets. She retails her gourds at the N’tdjilla market and out of her home to a customer base composed of both women and men, for cash. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 15,000 West African Francs, which will be used for everyday family expenses. Her goal is to increase her sales volume by better meeting her customers’ needs.

loans.use: Purchasing gourds

loans.name: C1906 Abahurijehamwe Group

texts.en:
Ferdinand is 32 years old and is single. He is pictured here on the right, wearing a white and blue T-shirt. For two years, he has owned a small boutique which sells various products such as rice, sugar, cosmetics, and so on. His business is open from 8am until 6pm every day.  His business is well known in the region.  

Ferdinand is the leader of the group called “Abahurijehamwe” in the local language, which means “to have the same target” in English.  His group has three women and five men.

Ferdinand has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business. If this satisfaction is reached, Ferdinand hopes to earn more profits and investment,do savings for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more products for his boutique such as rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mirzodavron

texts.en:
M. Mirzodavron is 29 years old. He is married with three children. Since he was young, Mirzodavron has been working as a cook. After he had gained much experience, Mirzodavron decided to run his own café. Certainly, he does not have sufficient funds for a private café, so he is renting one located in the central market of the city. In the café, he provides various meals of the national cuisine. The business is profitable and Mirzodavron hopes to open his private café when he has generated enough money for this. However, today he needs to expand his business and wants to purchase additional tables, chairs and dishes. For this purpose, he requests $2,000 US Dollars. This is the first loan for Mirzodavron and he thanks everyone trusting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase tables, chairs and dishes

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN sont des femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne 26 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à TIOLA un des villages  de la sous préfecture de NIENA région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
NIADIOUGOU D., qui est un des membres du groupe, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10kg de poissons. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de NIENA. Les poissons sont revendus en famille à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes au comptant et en détail. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Fotemogoban group are married and on average 26 years old with four children. They live primarily in polygamous families in Tiola, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Niena, Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

In order to meet the demands of their customers, they are working for the first time with the microfinace institution Soro Yiriwaso.

Niadiougou D., one of the group's members, plans to buy ten kilos of fish with her loan. She gets her fish at the big market in Niena. The fish are then sold retail for cash to family members, primarily women.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA, which will be used for daily family expenses. She would like to increase her sales to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Allah Walie Ii Group

texts.en:
In this photo are members of the “Allah Walie II” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT and Kiva lenders, and with it, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profits, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu C.. Kadiatu is age 35; she was born in the town of Kabala, where she currently resides with her husband and 3 children. For twenty years now,  Kadiatu has been a businesswoman. Currently, she sells cooked rice, shoes, cosmetics, etc. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her stock.

loans.use: to buy uncooked rice, cooking ingredients, shoes, cosmetics, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuwa is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

He has operated a tailoring business for the past two years, selling to his neighbors in the community. Tsuwa faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand and sell wholesale items in the future.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase cloth for his tailoring business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for tailoring business.

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
Naimjon sells headdresses and other types of clothing at the market. He is a young married man with two children. Naimjon has been in this business for 5 years. During this time he has learned that having a large assortment of goods on display all the time is the key to success in this kind of business. Naimjon's prices are not high, making the goods more attractive to his customers. He would like to borrow $1500 USD to increase his inventory. He hopes to develop this business further and to increase his sales.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Towards purchasing new goods for selling.

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe FOTEMOGOBAN est constitué de 5 mariées et 1 veuve qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à BOUGOULABA un des villages de la sous préfecture de NIENA région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et les deux prêts passés ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de savons à travers SAFOURA D.. 
SAFOURA D.  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 7 cartons de savons de ménager ‘’ KOULIKORO’’. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de NIENA.
Les savons sont revendus au  marché de NIENA et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et en détail. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Fotemogoban group is made up of five married women and one widow. On average they are 42 years old with four children and living primarily in polygamous families in Bougoulaba, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Niena, Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

They are on their third collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and the two previous loans have been fully repaid. The group of women do business selling soap, in the manner of Safoura D..

With her loan, Safoura D. plans to buy seven cartons of « Koulikoro » household soap. She gets her supplies at the big market in Niena. The soaps are then sold at the Niena market and to family members, both men and women, for cash and credit.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA, which will be used for daily family expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of soap

loans.name: Tolibboy

texts.en:
Farming requires a lot of effort, which is why Tolibboy, from a young age, has dedicated himself to his business. Today, he is seeking a way to expand his farming efforts in order to support his family, which consists of his wife and 5 children. Tilibboy faces lack of capital financing for the production of potatoes, wheat and oats. For this reason, he trustfully approached IMON to ask for a loan for that activity. In this way, he can continue supporting his humble home and develop his business economically.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: Towards the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à N’TDJILLA un des villages de la sous préfecture de NIENA région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Tous les deux prêts passés ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les condiments alimentaires avec  AMINATA M.. 
AMINATA M.   compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 paquets de cube maggi et 10 paniers de tomates fraiches. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de NIENA. Les condiments sont revendus au  marché de N’TDJILLA et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille .
texts.en:
The ten members of the JIGUISSEME group are all married women, averaging 30 years of age and 3 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in N’TDJILLA, a village in the NIENA prefecture in Sikasso Region, third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their third loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. Both previous loans were repaid without problems. This group of women sells various items such as food condiments, as does AMINATA M..


AMINATA M. intends to use her loan to buy 2 packs of "Maggi" bouillon cubes and 10 baskets of fresh tomatoes. She gets her supplies at the grand market in NIENA. She resells the condiments for cash, at her home and at the N’TDJILLA market, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 35'000 (ca US$ 70), to be used to pay for the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: To buy and resell food condiments

loans.name: Ne'matullo

texts.ru: Хакимов Неъматулло проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 43 года. Он женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Неъматулло имеет высшее образование, педагог. Он более 15 лет проработал в средней школе. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей на рынке Саховат. У него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Он хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Ne'matullo H. lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 43 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Ne'matullo has a higher education as a teacher.  He spent 15 years working at a secondary school.  Today, he is involved in retail sales at the Sahovat market.  He has a store, where he sells food products.  He has been in this business for 5 years.  Ne'matullo is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.  He wants to expand his business.

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.en:
M. Ahmadjon is 60 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children. Ahmadjon is an animal farmer. He owns sheep and breeds them together with the help of his wife. In order to further develop his business, Ahmadjon wants to take out a loan to buy one or two more sheep and the feed for them. After fattening them up, he will be able to sell them for a more favorable price. Then, Ahmadjon will be able to use the profit from his business towards the well-being of his family.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Towards the purchase of sheep for business development.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a palm leaves selling business, selling from her home to her neighbours and to passersby. Mishi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase palm leaves to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase palm leaves to sell.

loans.name: Sober Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sober” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standards of living. 

The leader of this group is Tenneh C.. Tenneh is 35 years old. She was born in Freetown but she is currently residing in Kabala with her husband and 4 children. Her husband is a businessman and 3 of her children are attending primary school. Her eldest child is in secondary school. For 18 years now, Tenneh has been selling cooked rice, meat and vegetables. With her share of this loan, she will buy cooking ingredients – palm-oil, rice, fish, tomatoes, etc. at wholesale prices, in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients (palm-oil, rice, fish, tomatoes, etc.) at wholesale in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Kolaban Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Kolaban sont toutes  mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans  et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULABA un des villages de la sous préfecture de NIENA région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et les deux prêts passés ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de poissons à travers AWA D.. 
AWA D. compte acheter avec son  prêt,  8 Kg de poissons. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de NIENA. Les poissons sont revendus au  marché de BOUGOULABA et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Kolaban group are all married women, averaging 40 years of age and 5 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in BOUGOULABA, a village in the NIENA sous-prefecture in Sikasso Region, third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their third loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. Both previous loans were repaid without problems. This group of women sells fish through AWA D..

AWA D. intends to use her loan to buy 8 kg of fish. She gets her supplies at the grand market in NIENA. She resells the fish for cash, at her home and at the BOUGOULABA market, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 20'000 (ca US$ 40), to be used to pay for the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Since he was young, Bahodur has been known to work. His parents taught him how to get by as an agriculturist and he learned very well. Now that he is the father of 4 children, he still works as an agriculturalist. Thanks to his parents, Bahodur has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer. He hopes to increase his agricultural products so that he can provide his loved ones with a more promising life. 

Despite being a good agriculturalist and hard-worker, he needs help to move forward and improve his production. This is why he is asking for a loan to  buy more of the seeds and fertilizers that he needs, which are very expensive. But without them, his production will not improve. You can help Bahodur keep moving forward with his development plans.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont  toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans et  en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à T’DJILLA, un des villages de la sous préfecture  de NIENA région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passé ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de canaris à l’image de BIBA F.. 
BIBA F. compte acheter avec son  prêt, 30 canaris. Elle s’approvisionne au village de T’DJILLA auprès des femmes productrices de canaris. Les canaris sont revendus au  marché de T’DJILLA et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the SABOUGNOUMA group are all married women, averaging 40 years of age and 4 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in T’DJILLA, a village in the NIENA sous-prefecture in Sikasso Region, third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their third loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. Previous loans were repaid without problems. This group of women sells "canaris" (pottery containers), as does BIBA F..

BIBA F. intends to use her loan to buy 30 "canaris". She gets her supplies in T’DJILLA, from women who manufactures "canaris". She resells them for cash, and sometimes on credit, at her home and at the T’DJILLA market, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 10'000 (ca US$ 20), to be used to pay for the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: To buy "canaris" (pottery containers)

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Halima has operated a second hand clothing sales business for the past ten years, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Halima faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to get more funds and sell by wholesale in the future.

With the KES 60,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes and expand her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes and expand her business.

loans.name: Bibisoida

texts.en:
B. Bibisoida is a mother of 4 children. She is a very honorable and resolute woman. Ever since she was a young she learned the honest work of raising the cattle, knowledge she has passed downed to her own children who have also managed to improve their quality of life. Bibisoida and her husband started their livestock business with only one cow. After a number of sacrifices they were able to increase little by little the quantity of calves. At the moment, with the support of their children, they have started to produce milk. They sell these on the weekends in their village. Currently Bibisoida wants to expand her business and to purchase more cattle. With the desire of improving their living Bibisoida is counting to your generous heart.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle and calves to expand the business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

She has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business for the past few months. In addition, she also operates a retail shop which contributes to her other source of income. Emma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business and sell as wholesale in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase another boda boda (motorcycle) and bundles of maize flour for her retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase another boda boda (motorcycle) and bundles of maize flour  for her retail shop.

loans.name: Farukh

texts.en:
Farukh, a pleasant-mannered man, makes his living driving a taxi around the city of Isfara in Tajikistan. This has fulfilled Farukh’s long-term desire to be self-employed. He offers good service to his customers and tries to give them an enjoyable ride. Farukh has been in business for about two years. He has requested a loan of 4500 Somoni to help purchase spare parts for his car. We are happy for this opportunity to help Farukh improve his business and continue his success.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for his car

loans.name: Progress Ii Group

texts.en:
Umaru J. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Umaru was born in Sokuralla village near Kabala town. He is 35 years of age. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has three children, two of whom attend primary school. 

Umaru has been a motor-bike taxi driver for five years. This is the first loan that Umaru and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Umaru will use his share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy goats and sheep in order to diversify his business.

loans.use: Buy goats and sheep in order to diversify his business

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita is a 45-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and buying and selling livestock. She lives in Mabinay, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and livestock businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4000. Sanita is borrowing PHP 19500 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Sanita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.
 
About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a widow with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a charcoal sales business for the past three years, selling at home to her neighbours and passersby. Umazi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and sell wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou C. est une femme mariée e de 66 ans qui habite dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est soutien de famille et s’active dans le commerce d’huile de palme depuis plus de 30 ans. Elle a choisi son activité par passion. Elle est aussi très intéressée  par les profits que lui génère son activité ce qui lui permet de faire face a ses besoins personnels. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis mai 2005. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’huile de palme en Casamance destiné à la vente. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aissatou C., age 66, lives in Yoff. She's the family's bread earner, and for 30 years, she's been selling palm oil. She chose her business out of passion. She's also very interested in the profits realized from her business, which enable her to provide for herself.

She's been a member of the Yoff credit union since May 2005. She's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000 to buy palm oil in Casamance (Senegal) and to resell it. Her goal is to increase her profits and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To buy palm oil

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She travels from market to market to earn her living selling tobacco leaves. Her husband Felix, who is 63 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children between 28 and 42. 

Rosalina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosalina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 9th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 25000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her tobacco sales business so that she can to save up for her family's future needs and security. Rosalina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les huit prêts passés ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. 
KADIA D. compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100 régimes de bananes et quelques paniers de papayes. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de MEDINE. Les bananes et papayes sont revendus aux  marchés de MEDINE et de HAMDALLAYE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 85.000FCFA utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the JIGUISSEME group are all married women, averaging 40 years of age and 5 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in HAMDALLAYE, a village in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their ninth loan from Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand. All eight previous loans were repaid without problems.

KADIA D. intends to use her loan to buy 100 banana bunches and a few baskets of papayas. She gets her supplies at the grand market in MEDINE. She resells the bananas and papayas for cash, at her home and at the market in MEDINE and HAMDALLAYE, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 85'000 (ca US$ 170), to be used to pay for the daily expenses of her family.

loans.use: To buy and resell fruits

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling ready-to-wear (RTW) clothes and other home products. Her husband Armando, who is 57 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are 15 to 31 years old. Two of her children have their own families, three are working to help support the family and the two youngest children are currently going to school. Rita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly income of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell to save up for future business expansion and her children's education. Rita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

Rita is shown in the accompanying photo with some of the personal and home products that she sells.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Fatimata Malick

texts.fr: Madame Fatimata Malick S. est une jeune dame de 29 ans qui habite à Yoff depuis des années. Depuis plus de 3 ans madame S. s’adonne à la vente de jus et de glace. Auparavant elle  était habituée  à  vendre des produits divers. Elle a choisi cette activité sur recommandation de son mari. Elle est surtout intéressée par la réalisation de bénéfices que lui procure son activité. Elle est membre du guichet de Yoff depuis juin 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs  dans le but d’acheter une petite machine qui lui permet de conditionner ses sachets de jus. Son but est de mieux développer son activité, accroitre ses bénéfices et améliorer les conditions sociales de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs Fatimata Malick S. is a young lady of 29 years who has lived in Yoff for years. She has been selling juice and ice for over three years. Before that, she used to sell various products. She began her new activity because her husband recommended it to her. She is especially motivated by the profit that she earns in her business. She has been a member of our branch in Yoff since June 2010. She applies for a loan of 100,000 CFA francs to buy a small machine to fill juice into small bags. Her aim is to better develop her activity, increase her profit and improve the social condition of her family.

loans.use: To buy a machine

loans.name: Yondembeh Group

texts.en:
Meet with the members of the Yondembeh Group from Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of 2,200,000 leones. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Siray M. is the leader of this group. This 36-year-old is married to a businessman and they have four children. Siray has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She sells clothes and shoes. With her share of this loan, she will buy bales of clothes and dozens of shoes to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes and dozens of shoes to add to her business

loans.name: Sokhna Bintou

texts.fr: Madame Sokhna Binetou G. habite dans un quartier voisin de la localité de Yoff. Elle est âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée et pratique la coiffure depuis 1999. En même temps elle exerce le commerce de greffage, de chaussures et de produits cosmétiques. Elle a choisi le métier de coiffure par passion. L’activité de commerce  l’intéresse  beaucoup  aussi à cause de son aspect lucratif. Elle est membre du guichet de yoff depuis 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs.  Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs prévu pour régler sa commande de greffage et de chaussures qu’elle va placer a ses clients. Avec ce financement elle envisage augmenter ses gains et améliorer les conditions sociales de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs Sokhna Binetou G. lives not far away from the city of Yoff. She is 34 years old and married. She has been a hairdresser since 1999. At the same time, she sells hair extensions, footwear and cosmetics. She chose this activity because she has a passion for it. Another interesting factor in this activity is the income. She has been a member of our branch in Yoff since 2003. She has already repaid two previous loans. She applies for a loan of 250,000 CFA francs to buy hair extensions and shoes for resale to her customers. Thanks to this loan, she expects to increase her income and improve the social condition of her family.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and shoes

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a tailoring business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors and school uniforms to students who attend school. Susan faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of materials for tailoring. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors. Gladys' major challenge is the high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Shogher

texts.en:
Shogher D. was born in Azerbaijan and lived there until 1988.  She now  lives in Aghavnavank village in the Ijevan area. Shogher is a widow and has 3 daughters who are all married and live independently. 

Shogher worked as a librarian for the village administration, but she was dismissed last month on the grounds of redundancy.  Since 2003,  Shogher has  been raising cattle and managing a little food and household goods shop located in her home.  These occupations help Shogher finance her living expenses, and paid for her daughters' education as well as organized their weddings. 

Shogher said that the majority of her customers are retirees and can visit her shop twenty-four hours a day because there is no another shop in that area.
   
Shogher needs a 900,000 AMD loan to buy more pigs for her farm, to organize the sowing of fodder, and to increase her shop’s assortment of goods.
 
This is Shogher’s second loan from Kiva.  She used her first Kiva loan to buy fodder for her farm animals, some cows, and merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: To buy pigs for her farm, sow fodder, and increase shop’s inventory

loans.name: Momar

texts.fr: Monsieur Momar G. est un pêcheur yoffois qui est âgé de 45 ans. Il est marié et s’adonne a la pêche depuis plus de 20 ans c'est-à-dire depuis qu’il a quitté l’école arabe. Il a choisi cette activité qu’il a héritée de ses parents. Aussi son activité lui permet de gagner sa vie. Il est sociétaire du guichet de Yoff depuis décembre 2010. Il emprunte 150000 frs prévu pour la réfection et l’entretien de sa pirogue. Avec ce financement il envisage accroitre ses profits pour mieux faire face a ses charges familiales.
texts.en: Mr Momar G. is a 45-year-old fisherman living in Yoff. He is married and has gone fishing for more than 20 years, which means since he left the Arab school. He chose this activity because he inherited the business from his parents. In addition, it enables him to make a living. He has been a member of our branch in Yoff since December 2010. He borrows 150,000 CFA francs to repair and service his pirogue. Thanks to this loan, he expects to increase his profit to better provide for his family.

loans.use: To repair his pirogue

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Margaret operates a kindergarten school.  Children from the neighboring community attend her school. Margaret faces a major challenge of debt from parents who have not cleared school fees. She hopes to expand her kindergarten school in the future.

With the loan for 20,000 Kshs, Margaret wants to purchase chairs for her kindergarten school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase chairs for kindergarten school

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Linah operates a charcoal selling business from home, selling to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also sells dry fish to contribute to her income.  Linah faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demand in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the loan for 20,000 Kshs, Linah wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food for the family.

Michael has been operating a vegetable stall for the past six months, selling at the market to his neighbours and town dwellers. Michael faces a major challenge in price fluctuations in the market in his business. He hopes to expand and sell wholesale in the future.

With the loan for 10,000 Kshs, Michael wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for sale. He decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of its loan process.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a married man with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

Henry has been operating a french fries selling business for the past two years, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passersby. Henry faces a major challenge in the price fluctuation of potatoes in the market. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

With the loan for 40,000 Kshs, Henry wants to purchase sacks of potatoes to make french fries for sale. He decided to join Yehu because of its good variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes to make french fries for sale

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en:
Janvier is 34 years old and married. Janvier is in the business of transportation, which he has been doing for three years. His business is well-organized and is open from 5am until 12pm every day.

Janvier plans to use this loan to buy another motorcycle. He hopes to make enough profit to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shoes and cloth materials for resale

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 47 years old and married. He owns a clean and well-organized animal sales business. He has been in this business for ten years and is open from early in the morning until 8pm in the evening. He employs four people.

Sam will use this loan to purchase more cows to sell. He would like to continue to expand and will use any profits he makes toward this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase more cows to sell

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Patricia de 22 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, es empleada, vive con sus padres y hermanos, es soltera y trabaja para una sala de belleza, tiene 6 años de estar brindando servicios como cosmetóloga, tiene experiencia en su trabajo.
Ella ha decidido mejorar la vivienda donde vive con su familia, y solicita un préstamo para comprar los materiales como cemento, arena, hierro, mano de obra, su plan es construir un cuarto pero los ahorros que tiene no le ajustan para completar el gasto total, con este préstamo ella obtendrá los materiales necesario y llevar a cabo la construcción.
Patricia con los fondos espera realizar una buena inversión, que ayude a su familia ya que contaran con más espacio, su objetivo es mantener su trabajo, ayudar a su madre y formar en un futuro su propio hogar.
texts.en:
Patricia is 22 years old, and she lives in the El Transito Department of San Miguel.  She lives with her parents and siblings.  She is single, and she works for a beauty salon, with six years of experience in cosmetology services. 

Patricia has decided to improve her family's living quarters, and she is applying for a loam to buy the construction materials such as cement, sand, bricks, and labor.  Her plan is to construct a room, but her savings aren't enough to complete the project, so with this loan she will obtain the materials necessary and finish the construction.  Patricia hopes to make a good investment with these funds, which will help her family as they will have more space.  Her goal is to continue with her work, help her mother, and establish her own home in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of materials: cement, sand, bricks, and labor

loans.name: Orlando
