texts.es: El Señor  Orlando nacido en la ciudad Chuquisaca el 29 de enero, estado civil soltero, su objetivo de el señor es llegar  a  abrir una  gomería en el centro de la ciudad , para hacer crecer su negocio, lleva trabajando en ese rubro 7 años, aprendio este oficio debido a que su hermano Ramiro tiene la misma actividad y el le enseño el oficio de gomería, su crédito fue destinado para la compra de un lote de terreno que tiene como ubicación urbanización Amboro zona sur de la ciudad de santa cruz de la sierra, con el tiempo desea hacer construir ahí su casita y también su taller de gomería, es un joven muy trabajador con muchos planes para el futuro, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Orlando was born in the city of Chuquisaca on January 29th.  He is single, and his goal is to open a tire and auto repair shop in the center of the city.  In order to grow his business, he has been working in this field for seven years, learning about the profession from his brother Ramiro, who works in a tire shop and teaches Orlando about the job.  

The funds from this loan will be put towards the purchase of a plot of land which is located in the Amboro district, in the south of the sity of Santa Cruz de la Sierra.  With time, Orlando hopes to construct his house and his auto repair shop here.  He is young and very hard-working, with many plans for the future.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support provided to him.

loans.use: Purchase of property

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en:
Wilber is 24 and single. He is an artisan, embroidering cloths and sending his products to family members to sell in Lima and Cuzco, where there is greater demand.   He will be using his loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy cloth to make embroideries. 

Wilber has 4 brothers and 2 sisters who also help in the business.  They have run this business together out of their home in Ayacucho for 6 years. 

Wilber is a member of the communal bank "Margaritas" at FINCA Peru. He has been with FINCA for 1.5 years and joined because his sister was also a member. He likes to save for the future before he has a family to support. His dream is to have regular clients to sell his products to. He would also like to modernize his operations.

loans.use: To buy wool for embroidery business

loans.name: Veronica Beatriz

texts.es:
Verónica, de 23 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, es madre soltera tiene un hijo de un año de edad, vive con su madre y sus hermanos, Ella se dedica a vender en una tienda donde ofrece productos del hogar, este negocio le ayuda a mantenerse y a darle a su hija lo necesario, también a su madre con los gastos de la casa.
Actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería y aumentar el inventario, los productos que necesita son: pastas, embutidos, arroz, frijol, aceite, detergentes y cosméticos. Con esta inversión espera satisfacer las necesidades y peticiones de los clientes, así mismo mejorar su condición de comerciante.
Las aspiraciones de Verónica en relación al negocio, es surtirlo de los productos más necesarios y demandados, que sus ventas aumenten, ser cada día más competente y en su familia pues garantizarles una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Veronica, 23 years old, lives in the Jiquilisco department of Usulutan.  She is a single mother of a one-year-old son, and she lives with her mother and her siblings.  She works selling household items in a small store, and this business helps her support herself and give her son what he needs; it also helps her mother with household expenses.  

She is currently applying for this loam to buy merchandise and increase her inventory.  The products she needs are: pasta, sausages, rice, beans, oil, detergent, and cosmetics.  With this investment, she hopes to satisfy the needs and requests of her clients, and at the same time improve her business. Veronica's goals in relation to the business are to supply people with the most necessary and in-demand products so that her sales increase; she hopes to gain new skills every day, and to be able to guarantee her family a better and more secure financial future.

loans.use: Purchase of pasta, sausage, rice, beans, oil, detergent, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of equipment, CD, USB cables, and furniture.

loans.name: Katekaran Traders Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Katekaran Traders” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are small business people who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each person in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Usif T.. Usif was born in the village of Mayowlow, near Magburaka. He is 26 years of age. Usif is married to a businesswoman and they have no children yet. Usif is a motorbike taxi driver and has been running this business for 4 years. With his share of this loan, Usif will buy spare parts to maintain his motorbike.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to maintain motorbike

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz forma parte del banco comunal “Renace el sol con esfuerzo” perteneciente a la localidad de Chimbarongo,  ciudad de San Fernando. 

Ella se dedica a reparar y retapizar sofás, algunos los compra en mal estado y los repara para luego venderlos a un mejor precio, además retapiza sofás a pedido de clientes particulares. Luz tiene este oficio desde hace 17 años, trabajando directamente desde su casa, ya que acomodó un taller en el patio de ésta. Ella debe ir a buscar los sofás en mal estado con carretilla (carro pequeño de mano), para trasladarlos a su casa y poder repararlos. Ya que no cuenta con vehiculo particular. Luz además se dedica a la confección de cortinas y cojines.

Con este préstamo comprará telas, cueros y cuerina en las ciudades de Santiago y San Fernando. De esta manera aumentará su producción y sus ganancias. 
Ella vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, quienes además le ayudan en su negocio. Por su parte su esposo la ayuda cuando tiene días libres en su trabajo, quien se desempeña como artesano de mimbre (varitas flexibles de un arbusto). 

El sueño de Luz es comprar Maquinaria para coser cueros y una engrapadora eléctrica, ya que las costuras al interior de los sofás las realiza manualmente, lo que es muy sacrificado para su salud.

Su motivación para seguir con su negocio es costear los estudios de sus tres hijos.
Para Luz la ayuda de Fondo Esperanza ha sido fundamental, ya que el financiamiento que se le ha otorgado, ha sido un gran apoyo para su negocio. 
Chimbarongo es una comuna ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’Higgins 150 Kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa "lugar entre nieblas". La economía de Chimbarongo está basada principalmente en la elaboración de artesanías en mimbre, en el cultivo de frutales y la producción de vino.
texts.en:
Luz is part of the community bank "Renace el Sol con Esfuerzo" (The Sun Is Reborn with Effort), which belongs to the locality of Chimbarongo in the city of San Fernando.  She works in the repair and re-upholstering of sofas, some of which she buys in poor condition and then repairs to cell them later at a better price.  She also re-upholsters sofas at the request of particular clients.  Luz has been working in this job for 17 years directly from her house, as she has added space in her patio to do her work. She usually goes to pick up old sofas in a small car to move them to her house for repair, but she no longer has access to this vehicle. Luz also makes curtains and cushions.

With this loan, she will buy fabric, leather, and imitation leather in the cities of Santiago and San Fernando.  In this way, she will increase her production and her earnings.  She lives with her husband and their three children, who also help her with her business.  Her husband helps her when he has time off from his work as a craftsman of mimbre (a flexible type of shrub wood). Luz's dream is to purchase machinery to sew leather and an electric stapler, as she currently does the interior stitching on the sofas manually, which is causing her health problems.  Her motivation to continue with her business comes from her desire to fund the education of her three children.

The help of Fondo Esperanza (Hope Fund) has been fundamental for Luz, as the credit has supported her greatly in her business. Chimbarongo is located in the region Libertador General Bernando O'Higgins, 150 kilometers to the south of Santiago, the capital of Chile. Its name comes from the Mapuche language, and it means "place between the clouds." Chimbarongo's economy is based principally on artisan crafts made from mimbre, the cultivation of fruit trees, and the production of wine.

loans.use: Purchase of leather, imitation leather, and cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María, de 37 años de edad, reside en Arambala departamento de Morazán, donde vive con sus hijos de 18, 17, 9 y 8 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en casa propia y sus hijos actualmente estudian, María sostiene el hogar a través de un negocio que administra de comida y antojitos, este negocio surge por iniciativa propia hace 10 años.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para mejorar la vivienda,  específicamente necesita fraguar y encementar el piso de la cocina, para ello necesita comprar cemento y arena, que hasta el momento no ha comprado por falta de liquidez, este préstamo le dará el apoyo para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
Sus sueños es dar a sus hijos el estudio necesario y estos obtengan un titulo con el que se puedan defender en un futuro.
texts.en:
María, age 37, lives in the Arambala department of Morazán.  She lives with her children; ages 18, 17, 9, and 8.  She is a single mother, and she lives in her own house.  Her children currently go to school.

María supports her household through the food and snack business that she runs.  This business emerged through her own initiative ten years ago.

She is currently requesting a loan to improve her house.  She needs to set and cement the kitchen floor.  However, she needs to buy the cement and sand.  Up until now she has not purchased those items because of her lack of liquidity.  This loan will give her the support to improve the condition of her home.

Her dreams are to give her children the necessary education, and that they get a degree so that they can use it to fend for themselves in the future.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand

loans.name: Twisungane Group

texts.en: Phocas is 37 years old and married with five children between the ages of 2 and 10 years old. Phocas's business is well organized and he employs one person in his small shop selling various products. His business is open from 6:00 am until 8:30 pm. This is his third year of successful business operation. Phocas is the group leader. This group is called Twisungane in the local language. Phocas is the person on the right with his hand raised. The group includes six members; each one has their own business. Some of the businesses are a spare parts business, selling cakes and selling various products, etc. Phocas and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses so that they can offer a good service for their customers. This loan will impact the group members by helping them to purchase larger quantities which will allow them to earn more profits. Phocas and his group hope to save the extra money to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 23 años, es soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa con su padre en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de comida, jugos, gaseosas y golosinas. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fidelizada en la zona. Tiene un kiosco afuera del colegio Primario del caserío.

Elizabeth desea comprar insumos para satisfacer la creciente demanda de personas y clientes potenciales que llegan entre los meses de diciembre y abril para trabajar en la campaña de mangos en Tambogrande. Por ello, solicita un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa para comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 23 years old. She is single and has one child. She lives in her father’s house, in Tambogrande district, an agricultural located in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name. It’s located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque.

For 2 years she has been selling food, juices, soft drinks, and sweets. She has an established and loyal customer base in the area. She has a kiosk outside of one of the schools in the town.

Elizabeth wants to buy more ingredients and stock so she can meet the growing demand from people and potential customers who arrive between the months of December and April to work in the mango harvest in Tambogrande. She is requesting a loan of PEN 1,000.00 from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and stock in order to expand her business

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Since arriving from Bolivia, Rita has spent the past eight years building a strong cosmetics business. While it may seem like a small home-based business, it is really an effort to provide working women, that are also the heart of their family, with the opportunity to access basic necessities without leaving their homes. Her warm personality and the attention given to each of her clients has created a loyal client base. Rita’s vision goes beyond the cosmetics – she sees the products as a way to build community and help women build confidence through a network of like-minded individuals. With her loan from ACCION USA, Rita will be purchasing more inventory to increase the services she provides to her clients. Furthermore, she is striving to achieve the goal of a national position in the Mary Kay Company. Continuing to build her clients and her business will give her the leverage she needs to grow – not only as an individual but also as part of a national industry. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild the economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Duo Rosa De Saron Group

texts.es:
Duo Rosa D. Saron: Griselda D. los Angeles S. D. L. C.,es D. treinta y cinco años D. edad(35 años)tiene dos hijos pequeños elL. tiene su negocio desD. hace 10 años elL. venD. productos comestibles D. primera nesecidad, nos cuenta que le a hido bien en su negocio, que dia en dia ba creciendo mas,elL. venD. es su tienda,Arroz,frijol,azucar,sal,pastas,huevos,tomate,seboya,papas,etc, ahora elL. solicita su credito para surtir mas su negocio y tener mas bariedad en productos comestibles D. primera nesecidad,o comprar su mercaderia por mayor y asi lograr aumentar su ganacia.
doña Haydee N. L.,es D. 40 años D. edad tiene 3 hijos pequeños,elL. D. dedica a L. venta D. tortillas los tres tiempos,elL. se dedica a esta actividad desD. hace 3 años elL. solicita este credito para L. compra D. maiz y leña por mayor, elL. nos cuenta que quiere comprar por mayor ya que por este tiempo baja D. precio.
El maiz baja D. precio porque hay cosecha, y L. leña tabien baja D. precio porque es verano, elL. espera que fape le pueda ayudar y asi pueda aumentar su ganacia.
texts.en:
Rose of Sharon Duo: 

Griselda D. los Ángeles S. D. L. C., 35, has two small children.   She’s had her business for 10 years.  She sells basic need foodstuffs.  She tells us that she’s done well in her business and every day she grows more.  She stocks rice, beans, sugar, salt, pastas, eggs, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, etc. in her store.  Now she needs a loan to stock the store more and have a wider variety of groceries or to buy her merchandise at wholesale thus increasing her profits.

Haydee N. López, 40, has three small children.  She sells tortillas in three shifts.  She’s been in this line of work for three years.  She is asking for the loan to buy corn and firewood at wholesale.  She tells us that she wants to buy at wholesale because that’s the time when the price is lower.  Corn prices drop because of the harvest and the firewood’s price drops too because it’s summer.  She hopes that Fape will help her so that her profits will increase.

loans.use: To buy groceries and to buy corn and firewood at wholesale.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es: Patricio, de 60 años de edad, natural del distrito de San Francisco, de estado civil casado con la señora Rosa de 56 años, juntos tienen 02 hijos Edwin de 28 años y Noely de 15 años de edad y viven en su propia casa en la comunidad de las Palmas anexo del Distrito de Ayna San Francisco. Para Patricio su edad no es impedimento para seguir surgiendo y obteniendo buenos provechos; ya que de muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, es campesino cuenta 06 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de barbasco, cacao, hojas de coca y plátano; que son oriundas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Hace más de 35 años que trabaja en esta actividad, en tiempos de cosecha cuenta  con el apoyo de su familia y de los jornaleros para avanzar con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar de esa manera ve que su arduo trabajo tiene recompensa al ver la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos y hojas de coca. En adelante desea renovar las plantaciones de barbasco por hojas de coca; puesto que le generan más ingreso. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Agradece a la institución por concederle dicho crédito. Con los  1,500 nuevos soles solicitados,  contratará peones para realizar el desmonte de malezas que se encuentra en su parcela.
texts.en:
Patricio is 60 years old. He is from the district of San Francisco. He is married to Rosa, who is 50 years old. They have two children together, Edwin, who is 28 years old, and Noely, who is 15 years old. They live in their own house in the community of Las Palmas, which is annexed to the district of Ayna San Francisco. 

For Patricio, his age is not an impediment to continuing to work and make a good living. From the time he was very young, his parents taught him to work in the fields. He is a farmer and has 6 hectares of land planted with barbasco root, cocoa beans, coca leaves, and plantains, all of which originate in the jungle area of the Aprurimac River Valley. 

He has been farming for 35 years. During harvest times he has the help of his family and day laborers to bring the harvest in. What he likes most about his work is harvesting. When he sees the quality of his crops, then he sees the return on his hard work. The most difficult aspect for him is transporting his products from the fields to the city of San Francisco, which is where he is offered the best prices for his products and coca leaves. In the future, he would like to replace his plantings of barbasco root with coca leaves, because they generate more income. 

This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. He feels that this support will be of much help to him in his work. He is grateful to the institution for granting him this loan. With the PEN 1,500.00 that he requested, he will hire laborers to clean out the weeds in his fields.

loans.use: To hire laborers to clean out the weeds in his fields

loans.name: Rosibel Estela

texts.es:
Rosibel, de 26 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera de dos hijos, el primero de 8 años y el segundo de 3 años de edad. Rosibel vive con su madre quien le enseño un oficio para que se pudiera defender y es la elaboración de empanadas,  tiene ya 7 años de dedicarse al negocio, de lunes a sábado.
Actualmente ella necesita comprar productos como plátano, leche y leña, que son los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de las empanadas, tal situación la lleva a solicitar un préstamo pues no cuenta con lo necesario en dinero para realizar dicha compra.
Con el otorgamiento del préstamo ella espera invertir bien los fondos, mantenerse en el negocio, tener ingresos constantes,  proveer para sus hijos la alimentación, y en un futuro sueña con tener su propia casa y que sus hijos estudien preparándose para tener mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Rosibel, 26, lives in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department.  She is a single mother of two children; the oldest is 8 and the youngest is 3.   Rosibel lives with her mother who taught her a skill so that she could fend for herself: making turnovers.  She’s been in this business for 7 years now, Monday through Saturday.

She needs to buy products like bananas, milk and firewood which are the materials needed to make the turnovers.  This situation necessitates her asking for a loan because she does not have the necessary money to make the purchase.

She expects to invest the funds from the granted loan well, to stay in business, have steady income, provide food for her children, and in the future have a house of her own and that her children study and prepare themselves so that they will have better opportunities.

loans.use: To buy products: banana, milk and firewood.

loans.name: Kelisu Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a KIVA partner in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone,  is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Kelisu” group. These are small business entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 800,000.00 for each member to invest in their  businesses. 

Marian K. is the leader of this group. Marian is 45 years old, married, and has six children – 1 in primary school, 2 in secondary school, and the rest are no longer attending school. 

Marian sells food at the market – rice, onions, salt, sugar, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 22 years.  With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, onions, salt, sugar, etc. in large quantity to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more flour, sugar, yeast etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy peanuts to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita  vive con su hija quien se encuentra en su primer año de universidad. Ellas viven en la zona de alto san isidro que esta a veinte minutos del centro de la ciudad. La Sra. margarita tiene una tienda de barrio desde hace cuatro años. Ella es divorciada pero a pesar de esto ella trabaja mucho para que su hija pueda terminar sus estudios superiores. En esta oportunidad ella solicita el préstamo para aumentar el capital de su tienda con material escolar debido a que ya comenzaron las clases en los todos los colegios y necesita abastecerse para poder vender a sus clientes  que ya le están solicitando, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Margarita lives with her daughter who is in the first year of university.  They live in the Alto San Isidro zone which is twenty minutes from downtown.  Margarita has had a neighborhood grocery store for four years.

She is divorced but despite this she works hard so that her daughter may finish her higher education.

On this occasion she is asking for the loan to increase her store’s capital with school supplies since classes have started in all the schools and she needs to stock up to sell to her customers who are already asking for things.

She is a responsible, hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es:
Rosa, se dedica a vender ropa, tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su familia: su abuela y 2 hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad, es madre soltera  y la casa donde viven es propiedad de su abuela, está ubicada en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán.
El negocio de Rosa existe desde hace 7 años, vendiendo ropa, perfumes y cremas, estas ventas las realiza de forma ambulantes, recorriendo las colonias y cantones cercanos. Por el momento solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa (blusas, faldas, camisas y ropa interior), con esta inversión espera mejorar su inventario y ofreciendo variedad de prendas de vestir espera también que sus ventas aumenten.
Rosa cada día desempeña su trabajo con la esperanza de algún día contar con los fondos necesarios para comprar su propia casa donde vivir con sus hijos y que estos estudien para tener mejores oportunidades en el futuro.
texts.en:
Rosa, 30, sells clothes.  She lives with her family: her grandmother and two children who are 11 and 5 years of age.  She is a single mother and the house where she lives is owned by her grandmother.  It is located in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán department.

Rosa’s business has been in operation for 7 years.  She sells clothes, perfumes and creams.  She sells in an ambulatory manner visiting nearby neighborhoods and cantons.  For the moment she is asking for a loan to buy clothes (blouses, skirts, shirts and underwear).  She hopes this investment will improve her inventory offering a wider selection of clothing; she hopes that her sales will increase too.

Rosa works every day with the hope of someday having enough funds to buy her own house to live in with her children and that they may study to have better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts, shirs and underwear.

loans.name: Alvarita

texts.es:
Alvarita forma parte del banco comunal “Renace el sol con esfuerzo” perteneciente a la localidad de Chimbarongo,  ciudad de San Fernando. 

Ella se dedica a la confitería, vendiendo dulces, galletas, bebidas y varios. Trabaja en la feria, en colegios y plazas, hasta las 2 de la mañana de lunes a domingo, Alvarita se desempeña en este oficio desde hace 20 años aproximadamente. Ella traslada su mercadería en un triciclo y un carrito. Su mercadería la compra principalmente en la ciudad de San Fernando. 

Alvarita es madre soltera tiene 7 hijos, 6 de ellos están casados y uno vive con ella, ya que tiene una discapacidad mental, debido a un accidente laboral, por lo cual depende absolutamente de Alvarita. Y aunque su hijo recibe una pensión de invalidez y ella una pensión de jubilación, sus ingresos no cubren todas sus necesidades, es por esto que Alvarita continua trabajando en este oficio, como su gran motivación.

Con este préstamo comprará un refrigerador, ya que el suyo se descompuso y es muy necesario para conservar en buen estado su mercadería. De esta manera aumentará su producción y sus ganancias. 

El sueño de Alvarita es tener un triciclo nuevo, ya que el que usa se encuentra en mal estado.

Para Alvarita la ayuda de Fondo Esperanza ha sido fundamental, especialmente por el financiamiento que se le ha otorgado, además el apoyo que le brinda el grupo ha sido muy grato para ella, ya que se ha sentido acogida, debido al buen trato,  el compañerismo y  responsabilidad por parte de ellos.
Chimbarongo es una comuna ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’Higgins 150 Kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa "lugar entre nieblas". La economía de Chimbarongo está basada principalmente en la elaboración de artesanías en mimbre, en el cultivo de frutales y la producción de vino.
texts.en:
Alvarita is part of the “Renace el sol con esfuerzo” (The sun rises with effort) communal bank located in Chimbarongo, city of San Fernando.

She sells sweets: candy, cookies, soft drinks and such.  She works in the markets, schools and squares until 2am from Monday through Sunday.  Alvarita has been doing this work for about 20 years.  She transports her wares in a three-wheeled vehicle and cart.  She buys her merchandise primarily in the city of San Fernando.

Alvarita is a single mother of 7 children.  Six of them are married and one still lives with her because of a mental disability caused by an accident in the workplace so is completely dependent on Alvarita.  Although her son gets a disability pension and she gets a retirement pension, her income isn’t sufficient to cover all their needs.  It’s because of this that Alvarita continues working at this occupation as her great motivation.

She will use this loan to buy a refrigerator because hers broke down and it is very necessary to keep her merchandise in good condition.  This will allow her to increase production and profits.

Alvarita’s dream is to have a new tricycle because the one she uses is in poor condition.

Fondo Esperanza’s help has been fundamental for Alvarita, especially for the loan granted.  Besides, the support provided by the group has been very pleasing to her because she feels welcome, because of the nice treatment, companionship and responsibility they show.

Chimbarongo is a community located in the Libertador General Bernardo O’Higgins region 150 kilometers south of Santiago (capital of Chile).  Its name in Mapudungun (Mapuche language) means “place among the mist.” Chimbarongo’s economy is based primarily on wicker crafts and fruit and wine production.

loans.use: For a refrigerator.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El Sr. Félix es casado se dedica al transporte urbano hace varios años, vive la zona de thago loma vive en casa propia, su casita se encuentra a unas cuadras de la escuela de la zona, su esposa se dedica  a la venta de verduras, tienen 3 hijos pequeños   el sr. Félix es muy conocido en su trabajo por su amabilidad y responsabilidad, trabaja de lunes a sábado los domingos se dedica al comercio de papa, es una familia muy trabajadora, el préstamo lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción y poder terminar de construir su casa, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Félix is married and has worked in public urban transportation services for several years.  He lives in the Thago Loma zone in his own house.  His little house is located a few blocks from the local school.  His wife is a vegetable merchant.  They have three small children.

Félix is very well known at work because of his kindness and responsibility.  He works from Monday to Saturday.  On Sundays he’s a potato merchant.

It is a very hard working family.  The loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies to finish building his house.  He is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Edy

texts.es: Edy, de 32 años, natural del distrito de Quimbiri; es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto con su esposo Wilson de 37 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Juan de 06 años y Naomi de 03 años quienes son su adoración. Edy, es una señora muy carismática y enfocada en sus responsabilidades; se dedica al negocio de un Bar – Recreo con el nombre “Edy Mariluz” ubicada en el distrito de Quimbiri donde ofrece bebidas alcohólicas para el consumo de las personas mayores, igualmente ofrece platos típicos de la selva como: Tacacho con cecina, chilcano de carachama – bagre, que son peces oriundas de la zona selvática de nuestro querido Perú. Cuenta con el apoyo de 03 señoritas que están dispuestas a brindar la buena comodidad a su público concurrente, viene trabajando hace 08 años en este negocio y esta agradecida por la preferencia de sus degustadores. Los fines de semana tienen mayor acogida del público, lo cual le genera mayores ingresos. Los planes para su futuro negocio es abrir una  nueva sucursal con el mismo nombre y en el mismo distrito. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo cual se compromete a pagar puntualmente para así obtener los mejores beneficios posteriormente. Con los  mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará mesas y sillas para renovar su local.
texts.en:
Edy, 32, is from Quimbiri district.  She is a very cheerful, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Wilson, 37, and their two beloved children, Juan, 6, and Naomi, 3, whom she adores.

Edy is a very charismatic woman, focused on her responsibilities.  Her business is a bar/snack shop, called “Edy Mariluz,” located in Quimbiri district, where she sells alcoholic beverages to adults.  She also provides typical dishes from the jungle like: Tacacho con cecina (roasted, smashed plantain with pork), chilcano de carachama-bagre (river fish served stewed with tomatoes, onions and culantro), which are native to the jungle area of our beloved Perú.  She has three young women who help her and are willing to provide her public with good customer service.  She’s been in business for 8 year and is grateful for the preference her customers show towards her.  More people come by on weekends so income is higher then.  Plans for the future include opening a new branch with the same name but in a different district.

This is her first loan with MFP so she commits to repay punctually in order to receive subsequent benefits.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy tables and chairs to upgrade her locale.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNION FUERZA Y AMISTAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Justo; el tiene 53 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de granos como trigo, habas, entre otros, luego el socio viaja a las ferias  por el Valle Sagrado para vender sus productos a sus clientes, a la vez el socio tiene su carrito el cual brinda el servicio de taxi el sale a trabajar de vez en cuando es un trabajo extra que el realiza con su carro, de estas dos formas el socio saca a su familia adelante.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de más granos para la distribución a sus clientes en el Valle Sagrado.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Justo, 53, is a member of the “UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD” (Unity, Strength & Friendship) communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

He has a spouse and two children.  He alternates his daily chores with being a grains merchant.  He buys and sells wheat and lima beans, among others.  He travels to the farmers’ markets in Valle Sagrado to sell his products to his customers.  At the same time, he has a small car that he offers taxi services with.  He does this occasionally; it’s an extra job he does with his car.  In these two ways he earns enough to support his family.

He is asking for a loan to buy more grains to distribute among his Valle Sagrado customers.  He is happy with the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: To buy more grain to distribute among his customers in Valle Sagrado.

loans.name: Maribel Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” UNION FUERZA Y AMISTAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maribel; ella tiene 51 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de venta de anticuchos ella vende en su local anticuchos de carne , corazón  entre otros mas todo esto a base de carbón a la parrilla , la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su familia(papa y hermana) en sociedad, siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento y de esta forma ella saca a su familia adelante la socia se siente feliz con esta actividad ya que puede estar más tiempo con sus hijos y es esto un motivo importante para que ella siga adelante con el negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio de anticucheria como aceite, carnes, carbón entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maribel, 51, is a member of the “UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD” (Unity, Strength & Friendship) communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has two children. She has an anticuchos sales business.  She sells meat and heart anticuchos, among others.  All are roasted on a charcoal grill.  She works alongside her family (father and sister) as partners.  This is the only activity she’s in at present and this is how she supports her family.  She is happy with this activity because she is able to spend more time with her children and this is an important reason for her to want to get ahead with the business.

She is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for her anticuchos like: meat, oil and charcoal, among others.  She is happy with the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her anticucho (skewered, roasted meat) sales business.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SERIGNE FALLOU est créé le 03 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 36 femmes qui habitent la même localité. Elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par affinité. Leurs activités dominantes sont le petit commerce, l'agriculture et la transformation.

Madame FATOU ABDOU N. debout à droite sur la photo, habillée en vert est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée 23 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de sa petit sœur et la nièce de son mari

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Et parallèlement elle vend des chaussures et des fruits de saison. 

Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, subvenir à ses besoins et constituer une bonne épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Fallou was created on December 3, 2009. It is composed of 36 women, all living in the same neighborhood and knowing each other because they are neighbors and friends. Most of them run small stores, or are active in agriculture or processing.

Mrs Fatou Abdou N., standing to the right in the picture and wearing a green dress, chairs the group. She is 23 years old, married and the mother of four children. In addition, she cares for her younger sister and her husband's niece. She breeds sheep. At the same time, she sells footwear and seasonal fruit. Her objective is to contribute to improved living conditions for her family, provide for her needs and save an appreciable amount of money.

loans.use: To buy two sheep

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 31 años, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 9 años de edad, tiene casa propia y es profesor, trabaja en el Instituto Tecnológico hace 4 años, de lunes a viernes de 7:00am a 4:00pm.
Él por el momento se le presentan algunos gastos educativos que no puede cubrir por lo que solicita un préstamo para cubrir estos gastos, este préstamo le ayudara para cancelar una Maestría que desea estudiar y pagar las mensualidades. El seguir estudiando para él es lo mejor pues debe seguir actualizándose para mejorar el desempeño en su trabajo ya que es su sueño, realizarse con una buena profesión para ayudar más a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge resides in El Transito in the Department of San Miguel. He is 31 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and nine year old son. Jorge has been a teacher at the Instituto Tecnológico for four years and works Monday through Friday from 7am to 4pm.

At the moment Jorge has a few educational expenses that he is not able to pay, so he is requesting a loan that will help cover them. The money will be used to pay the monthly tuition toward completing his Master’s degree. Continuing his education is the best way for him to improve his performance at work. It is his dream to become a good professional so that he can further assist his family.

loans.use: Pay his tuition toward completing a Master's degree

loans.name: Quick Affairs Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a KIVA partner in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Quick Action” group. These are small business entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000.00 for each person to invest in their businesses. 

Mariatu K. is the leader of this group. Mariatu is a 45-year-old widow with 1 child in primary school. Mariatu sells fresh fish. With the help of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying cartons of fresh fish to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy medicine to resell, and products to make soap to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 65 años de edad, natural del distrito de Quimbiri es un hombre muy alegre y próspero, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Trancito de 65 años; tiene cuatro hijos quienes viven en sus propias casas junto a sus familias. Juan, es un hombre de buen trato, su negocio es administrar su propio hospedaje llamado “Hostal Vacors” situado en el distrito de Quimbiri donde brinda a sus usuarios las mejores habitaciones desde simples hasta matrimoniales, incluido terma, TV cable y playa de estacionamiento, su hospedaje es muy concurrido por los servicios que presta; tiene una construcción de 03 pisos donde ofrece 28 cuartos para poder arrendarlos. Este negocio lo  viene administrando por más de 22 años y obtiene buenos ingresos y cuenta con el apoyo de sus trabajadores para que se encarguen de la limpieza. Le gusta administrar su hospedaje y que sus usuarios se sientan cómodos. Los planes para el bien de su negocio es aumentar más habitaciones; por ello están construyendo 06 habitaciones más. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, comprará material de construcción como cementos, fierros y ladrillos.
texts.en:
Juan is 65 years old and a native of the District of Quimbiri. He is a happy and prosperous man who lives in his own home with his wife Trancito, age 65. They have four children who live in their own home with their families. Juan, a well-mannered gentleman, manages a boarding house called “Hostal Vacors” in the District of Quimbiri where he provides guests the best accommodations ranging from single rooms to bridal suites. Accommodations include bathrooms, cable TV, and parking. His establishment is well-known for the services it provides. The building that houses Juan’s business has three floors and contains 28 rooms available for rent. He has managed this business for 22 years and generates good revenues so that he can pay the housekeeping staff. Juan enjoys managing his boarding house and making sure that his guests are comfortable. He plans to expand his business by building six more rooms.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Juan is willing to complete all of his payments on time because he wants to access another loan very soon. He is a well-liked member in his Communal Bank. His loan of 3000 PEN will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, and bricks.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build more rooms for his boarding house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy slippers to resell

loans.name: La Ilucion Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento La Ilusión entrando a su segundo  ciclo conformado por 8 integrantes que viven en la zona del torno de los 8 clientes todos cuentan con negocio y actividad fija, la Presidenta la Sra. Regina de edad de 27 años oriunda del departamento de Oruro Poopó totoral actualmente vive en la localidad  del torno barrio Miraflores hace 19 años. Su Actividad es la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio cuenta hace 4 años  con esta actividad y como segunda actividad trabaja como profesora en el colegio de la zona turno noche, con el dinero del credito comprara abarrotes por mayor, fideo, arroz, azucar, etc. ella es  soltera y no cuenta con ningún hijo por el momento pero es uno de sus deseos.                                                                                                       Secretaria es la  Sra. Arnilda de edad de 21 años vive en la zona su  Actividad es la venta  de pescado cuenta con esta actividad hace 7 años en la zona del mercado Estado civil: convive con el señor Marco hace 10 años el señor cuenta con la actividad de profesor en la zona del torno, con el dinero dle credito comprara electrodomensticos para su casa, Los señores están muy agradecidos con la institución con el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “La Ilusión” (The Illusion) is starting its second loan cycle with eight members who live in the District of El Torno. All eight of these clients have established business activities. The group president is Sra. Regina. She is 27 years old and originally from the Department of Oruro Poopó Totoral, but she currently has been living in the Miraflores neighborhood of the town of El Torno for the past 19 years. Regina has been selling groceries out of her home for four years and also has a job teaching classes at the local school at night. The money from her loan will be used to buy groceries in bulk such as noodles, rice, sugar, and other items. Regina is single and does not have children at the moment, but she would like to have them some day.

Sra. Arnilda is the group secretary. She is 21 years old and lives in the area. Arnilda has been selling fish at the local market for seven years. She is in a common law marriage with Sr. Marco. For the past ten years, her husband has worked as a teacher in the District of El Torno. The money from her loan will be used to buy electric appliances for her home.

The members are grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: Purchase noodles, rice, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Abatoni Group

texts.en:
Belthilde is 36 years old and is married.  Belthilde's business is well-organized and she employs one person in her small shop selling various products. Her business is open from 6am until 10pm. This is her third year of successful business operation. 

Belthilde is the group leader of a loan group called "Abatoni" in the local language. Belthilde is the middle women in the photo. The group includes five members, each one has his/her own business. 

Belthilde and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses so they can offer good service to their customers. This loan will impact the group members by helping them purchase more products to sell, which will allow them to earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase supplies, acquire five plastic dining sets, and pay to have her pizza oven repaired

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo A. T., està muy agradecido con su credikiva pues ha mejorado su infraestructura de negocio e incrementado el volumen de ventas de sus productos. En la actualidad està aplicando a un subsidio de vivienda para obtener su casa en Villas de San Pablo, macroproyecto liderado por la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo en su misiòn como constructora de comunidades. Este es su segundo credikiva  y el dècimò credito que recibe por parte de la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, para inyectarle un nuevo capital de trabajo a su negocio con el cual comprarà insumos para la preparaciònde alimentos vegetarianos empacados como Cebada, ajonjolí, linaza, harina integral  y empaques. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Gustavo por favor ingrese al siguiente enlace:
 http://www.kiva.org/lend/189014
texts.en:
Gustavo A. T. is extremely grateful for his previous Kiva loan since it helped improve the infrastructure of his business and increase the sales volume of his products.  He is currently applying for a housing subsidy in order to obtain a home in Villas de San Pablo.  Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo is a leader of this large project in order to fulfill its mission as a builder of communities.  

This is Gustavo’s second Kiva loan and the tenth one he has received from Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo.  The new injection of operating capital will be used to buy ingredients for preparing vegetarian snacks such as barley, sesame, linseed, and whole grain flour, as well as packaging.  To learn more about Gustavo’s story, please click on the following link:  http://www.kiva.org/lend/189014

loans.use: Purchase packaging & ingredients for making vegetarian snacks

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 55 años, natural del distrito de Ayna San Francisco; es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Alejandro de 55 años y sus 02 queridas hijas Mónica de 25 años y Zulema de 20 años; las cuales todavía dependen económicamente de elL. y lo que más desea es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy joven a Martha le nació el gusto por las ventas de las prendas de vestir, es por ello que con el tiempo decidió dedicarse a L. venta de ropa. Actualmente tiene un pequeño puesto en un centro comercial llamado “Gamarrita” es aquí donde ofrece L. variedad de ropas nacionales e importadas; los fines de semana acude a distintas ferias que se realizan en diferentes pueblos de L. zona del Valle Río Apurimac ya que según manifiesta es allí donde mejores pagos obtiene por sus ventas. Viene trabajando 10 años en este negocio y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien le apoya en las ventas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las prendas que están de moda en L. capital que es L. ciudad de lima, ya que así siente que se gana L. confianza de sus compradores, considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar los pesados fardos de ropa a las distintas ferias, pero aún así no se da por vencida, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende el bienestar de su familia. Con el tiempo, desea poner otra tienda en L. ciudad de Pichari distrito que viene desarrollándose y cuenta con mayor masa poblacional. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y siempre esta pendiente del bienestar de sus compañeros. Con los 3,000  nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa en L. ciudad de Lima, sobre todo prendas de verano; por que el calor es perenne en L. selva peruana.
texts.en:
Martha, age 55, is originally from the District of Ayna San Francisco. She is a cheerful hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her husband Alejandro, age 55, and their two beloved daughters, Mónica (age 25) and Zulema (age 20). Both of her children are still financially dependent on her. What she wants most is to provide her family with a better quality of life. As a young woman, Martha discovered her taste for fashion by selling clothes. Eventually she decided to open a clothing shop and now has a small booth at a shopping center called “Gamarrita” where she offers a variety of domestic and imported clothing. On the weekends, she travels to various fairs held in different towns in the Apurimac River Valley where she is able to sell her goods at better prices. Martha has been working in this business for ten years and has the support of her husband who helps with making sales. What she enjoys most about her work is advising her customers about which clothes are fashionable in the city of Lima and earning their trust. She considers the most difficult part to be transporting the heavy bundles of clothing to different fairs. However, she refuses to give up since the welfare of her family depends on her business. Eventually she hopes to open another shop in the city of Pichari, an area that is still developing and has a large population.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Martha is willing to submit all of her payments on time because she wants to access another loan very soon. In her Communal Bank, she is a supportive member who is always concerned about the welfare of the rest of her group. The loan of 3000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more clothes in Lima, mostly summer fashions since the heat is ever present in the Peruvian jungle.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Elba

texts.es: Elba S. V. tiene 30 años y vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla donde tiene una miscelanea y vende perfumes, cosmèticos, accesorios y ropa en general. Desde los 16 años terminò el bachillerato y de inmediato empezò a estudiar educaciòn preescolar en la universidad , logrando recibir grado en el año 2004. Elba desde que estaba estudiando ya tenia un mercado domèstico, es decir sus compañeros de estudio eran sus principales compradores, a ellos le vendia ropa cosmèticos y fantasia en general, asi fuè como en la universidad todo el mundo la conocia por su gran amabilidad y respuesta efectiva en los pedidos que su compañeros le hacian.  Una vez termina su carrera universitaria, inicia su vida laboral como profesora preescolar en diversos centros educativos, donde gradualmente estructura su nuevo mercado para luego adicionarle mayores opciones en un punto de venta; en la actualidad comercializa muchos productos para damas caballeros y niños, hace trasncripciones y ofrece el servicio de resfuerzo escolar, apoyando a los niños en àreas en las cuales necesitan avanzar y/o presentan mayor dificultad. Su principal sueño es comprar una vivienda para adecuar su propio centro educativo y este es justamente su mayor desafio. Mientras es apoyada por la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo mediante su primer financiamiento, a travès de la lìnea credikiva, para poder aumentar su capital de trabajo y con el cual comprarà una vitrina, ùtiles escolares, morrales y maletines que ya tiene encargados y que auguran una recuperaciòn del capital oportuna. En la actualidad su negocio muestra los siguientes indicadores financieros a partir de los cuales se planea su crecimiento: razòn corriente 7,87%, rotacion de cuentas por cobrar 12 dias, rotacion de inventarios 31 dias, rentabilidad sobre las ventas 36%.
texts.en:
Elba S. V. is 30 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla where she has a general store in which she sells perfumes, cosmetics, accessories and clothes.  She obtained her high school diploma at 16 and immediately started studying a course in pre-school education at university.  She obtained her degree in 2004.

When she was studying, Elba had a market made up mainly of her fellow students.  She sold them clothes, cosmetics and decorative items in general.  While she was at university everybody knew her for her great kindness and her quick response to the orders that her fellow students made.  Once she finished her degree, Elba started her working life as a pre-school teacher.  She worked in several educational centers and in each one she gradually structured her new market so that she could add additional points of sale.  She currently sells lots of ladies', men's and children's products, does transcription work and offers additional tutoring to support children in areas where they need to make progress and / or are having difficulties.  Her main dream is to buy a building so that she can set up her own educational center.  This is her biggest challenge.

Elba is being supported by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through her first loan, via Kiva, which will help her to increase her working capital and which she will use to buy a display case, school supplies, backpacks and briefcases.  She already has orders and therefore she will be able to recover the capital in a timely manner.  Currently her business shows the following financial indicators on which she plans her growth: working capital ratio - 7.87%, accounts receivable turnover period - 12 days, inventory turnover period - 31 days, profit on sales - 36%.

loans.use: To buy a display case and school supplies, backpacks and briefcases that she has orders for

loans.name: Carmelitas Group

texts.en:
The Carmelitas communal bank is currently in their fourth loan cycle at FINCA Peru. They have 9 members: Pelaya, Paulina, Victoria, Rosila, Adbeel, Lucia, Vanessa, Frisia, and Erica. Their total loan amount is 4,350 nuevos soles for this cycle. The group members run a variety of businesses in Ayacucho, including sales of groceries and artisanal goods. 

Pelaya is the President of the Carmelitas communal bank. She is 41 years old, married, and has 6 school-aged children. She has been a member of FINCA and the bank for one year now. She will be using her loan of 300 nuevos soles to buy firewood to sell in Ayacucho. She enjoys the support that FINCA provides her as an entrepreneur and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy firewood to resell

loans.name: Eklou

texts.fr: Monsieur Eklou a 26 ans et est marié. Il fait comme activité la climatisation auto et a associé la vente des pièces détachées. Cette activité lui  permet de  répondre  financièrement  aux besoins de ces 2 enfants.  Il  a commencé l’activité en 2006 et  s’approvisionne à Accra au  Ghana.  Il a son établissement  en face  de la société  Ayi-Transport.  IL demande un prêt  pour acheter les  pièces  détachées pour satisfaire plus de  clients.
texts.en: Mr Eklou is 26 years old and married. He installs air conditioning in cars and sells spare parts. This activity enables him to provide for his two children. He began his activity in 2006. He gets his supplies in Accra in Ghana. His business is located opposite the premises of the company Ayi-Transport. He applies for a loan to buy spare parts to serve more customers.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies for his bakery and snack bar such as wheat flour, sugar and fruit, wholesale

loans.name: Grace Patricia

texts.es: Grace Patricia M. es una mujer de 28 años que vive con su conyuge y su hijo de 9 años en el barrio Por Fin, de la ciudad de Barranquilla al sur occidente de esta capital. Alli tiene una miscelanea donde vende fantasia, calzado, productos plàsticos, negocio que mantiene con la exhibiciòn de articulos diferentes en cada temporada. Esta actividad la inicò en el año 2007   inicialmente vendiendo productos, mediante guias especializadas de cosmèsticos, una vez aumentaron sus utiliddes fuè diversificandolo hasta adicionar vitrinas, donde exhibe su merancia. Grace   sueña ver su negocio convertido en un gran almacen ubicado en su propia vivienda, pues en la actualidad habita en condiciones de arreandamiento. Su negocio es de gran apoyo a las necesidades de su hogar, por eso acude a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, para aumentar su capital de trabjo mediante financiamiento y formaciòn empresarial, aplicando, en este su primer credito, mediante la lìnea credikiva, pues planea  comprar listados de ùtiles educativos, que requieren los colegios a sus estudiantes para su desempeño y que ella puede acreditar a los padres de familia, para que sus hijos lleven todos sus libros, cuando la familia no tengan la posibilidad de hacer un gasto inmediato. El negocio de Grace Patricia maneja una utilidad del 33% mientras sostiene una rotaciòn de inventarios de 35 dias y un capital de trabajo actual de $1,450.000 COP. , indicadors desde los cuales se planea su crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
Grace Patricia M. is a 28 year-old woman who lives with her husband and 9 year-old son in Por Fin neighborhood, in the south-west of the city of Barranquilla.  She has a general store where she sells decorative items, shoes and plastic products. She displays different products in her business according to the season.  Grace Patricia started her business in 2007.  Originally she sold products through specialized cosmetics guides.  Once her profits increased, she diversified her business, even adding display cases where she displays her merchandise.

Grace Patricia dreams of seeing her business become a large store located in her own home as she currently lives in a rental house.  Her business is a great support for her household.  For this reason, she is approaching Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to increase her working capital through a loan and to receive business training.  This will be her first loan through Kiva.  She plans to buy lists of school supplies that schools require students to have.  She will sell these supplies to the children's parents on credit so that their children have all the supplies they need even though the family may be unable to afford an immediate expense.

Grace Patricia's business has profits of 33%, an inventory turnover period of 35 days and a current working capital of 1,450,000 Colombian pesos.  These are the financial indicators on which she plans her business growth.

loans.use: To buy lists of school supplies to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ameyo

texts.fr: Dame  Ameyo  est mariée et a 38 ans.  Elle fait la vente de produit d’alimentation. Elle a commencé l’activité en 1985 et  achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé. Ensuite elle revend au marché local d’Akodessewa. De plus, elle a reçu deux crédits déjà qu’elle a parfaitement remboursés. Elle demande un prêt  pour acheter 2 cartons de tomate, 5 sacs de riz et  2 cartons de sucre.
texts.en: Ms. Ameyo is married and 38 years old.  She sells food.  She started her business in 1985 and buys products at the main market in Lomé.  Then she resells at the local market in Akodessewa.  In addition, she has already received two loans which she has fully repaid.  She is asking for a loan to buy 2 cartons of tomatoes, 5 bags of rice and 2 cartons of sugar.

loans.use: Purchase of food

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 59 años, natural del distrito de Quimbiri es una señora muy alegre y trabajadora, vive sola en su propia casa ya que todos sus hijos ejercieron una carrera y son independientes. Rosa, es una mujer muy laboriosa con su arduo trabajo pudo educar a sus 04 hijos y sacar profesional a cada uno de ellos. La bodega de Rosa es la primera en abrirse en su barrio situado en el distrito de Quimbiri, abre las puertas de su negocio desde las 06 de la mañana y ya están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lleva 27 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela adquirir un puesto dentro del mercado situado en su propio distrito y así hacer crecer su negocio. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a las compañeras de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 59 years old and a native of the District of Quimbiri. She is a cheerful hardworking woman who lives alone in own home since all of her children have their own careers and are independent. Rosa worked very hard to provide her four children an education and help each one become a professional. Her store is the first establishment that opens in her neighborhood in the District of Quimbiri. She opens the doors of her business at 6am and is ready to welcome her first customers. They know that Rosa’s store offers a variety of merchandise, so they have no hesitation in buying since she provides everything they need. Rosa has been in this business for 27 years and considers the most difficult part to be remaining at her store all day and not having the opportunity to leave. In the future, she wants to acquire a shop at the local market and grow her business.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Rosa hopes to complete her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank. She is well-respected since she keeps the group organized. The loan of 1000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more merchandise to keep her store in business.

loans.use: Purchase more products for her store

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
They say that team work is dream work. That could not be truer when a happily married couple sets out to run their own business.

Luis and his wife Alexandra have been in the construction supply industry for over 20 years. Beginning in Colombia, they gained valuable experience and are working to apply their skills to the American market. They provide construction implements to contractors by either shipping from their own warehouse or acting as a mediator with supply companies. In recent years they have been able to supply more specialized equipment, giving them a noticeable edge in the market. 

With this loan they will be purchasing more inventory and expanding in the specialized equipment that they provide to customers. This loan is the beginning of what Luis and Alexandra see as a constantly expanding business. With the opportunities available to them in the US, South America and the Caribbean, they hope to grow into a formidable regional supplier.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Sop Cheikh Makhtar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP CHEIKH MAKHTAR est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 25 femmes qui sont toutes du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par affinité, par parenté et par voisinage. Leur principale activité est le petit commerce. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de DVF GUEOUL 

Madame AMINTA N., debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, vêtue de robe noire parsemée de petit points blancs est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus, d'habits, de pagnes et d'encens. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de dix ans. Elle s'approvisionne à la capitale (Dakar) pour revendre dans le quartier. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en marchandises

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The borrowing group SOP CHEIKH MAKHTAR was created on December 30, 2009.  It consists of 25 women who are all from the same neighborhood.  They organized by affinity, kinship, and neighborhood.  Their main activity is small business. The group is part of the Village Bank of DVF GUEOUL.

Mrs. AMINTA N., standing at the far right of the photo, wearing a black dress with small white dots is the group manager.  She is 51 years old, married, and mother of 6 children.   She runs a small business in fabric, clothing, “pagnes”, and incense.  She has been in this business for over 10 years.  She stocks up in the capital (Dakar) for resale in her neighborhood.

Her new loan will allow her to strengthen her level of supply of goods.

Her goal is to support her husband in taking care of the family.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, clothing, "pagnes" and incense.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector tiene 47 años, es un hombre soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en su casa propia con su madre. La casa está ubicada en el caserío Guaraguaos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Hector se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace 15 años. Por un lado cría animales menores, especialmente ovinos, en el terreno situado detrás de su domicilio. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre quién esta fallecido, así que conoce a la perfección el rubro. Hector también se dedica al cultivo y la comercialización de limones y mangos. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades se encarga de ayudar a su madre con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Hector desea comprar más fertilizantes para la plantación de sus limones para mejorar la producción y la calidad del fruto. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Hector is 47 years old, is single, and has no children.  He lives with his mother in a home he owns.  The house is located in the village of Guaraguaos in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, located near the Piura region.  The Piura region is four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.  

Hector has dedicated himself to agricultural work for the past 15 years.  He raises livestock, particularly sheep, on the land behind his home.  His father, who passed away, taught him how to do this, so he knows the trade well.  Hector also dedicates himself to growing and selling lemons and mangos.  He helps his mother support their family with the income he generates from these activities.  

Hector would like to buy more fertilizer for his lemon crop to improve the production and quality of the fruit.  For this reason, he believed it would be beneficial to request a 1000 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa, an organization that is helping him realize his goals.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Karen Margarita

texts.es: Karen Margarita B.,  es una joven soltera de 23 años y muy dinàmica;  ella tiene un negocio donde vende mercancias variada mediante catalogos y calzado de acuerdo al modelo y a la lìnea que su cliente exija. Ella iniciò su microempresa tomando como referencia la experiencia adquirida hace seis años,  cuando ayudaba a su madre en un pequeño negocio,  porque en ese tiempo estudiaba en la universidad y encontrò en sus compañeros de estudio, un mercado al que conquistò con su optimismo y gan vocacion de servicio. Asì fue como gradualmente se inscribiò en empresas que manejan productos mediante guias especializadas y tuvo mucha mas acogida,  posteriormente agregò a su negocio calzado, porque lo considera un producto con mucha demanda en todas las èpocas. Su sueño es establecer un local propio e implementar un almacen de variedades, pero su gran desafio es la competencia y el poco capital de trabajo con el que cuenta, por eso  ha recurrido a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo donde està aplicando a  su primer financiamiento por la lìnea de credikiva; con el comprarà  calzado colegial y ùtiles escolares aprovechando la oportunidad que le ofrece la temporada de ingreso a colegiò , en las cuales hay mayor rotaciòn de estos productos y sus ventas crecen, logrando aumentar sus utilidad que en la actualidad se encuentra en un25% respecto a los productos por catalogos y en un 100% respecto al calzado.
texts.en: Karen Margarita B. is a very dynamic young single 23-year old woman.  She has a business selling various products and footwear through catalogs according to the models and brands her customers want. She began her business using the experience she gained six years ago helping her mother with a small business. At the time, she was studying at university and found a market among her fellow students, winning them over with her optimism and great dedication to service.  She gradually became involved in businesses that sold products through specialized guides and catalogs and was favorably received. Later she added footwear to her business because she considered it a high demand product throughout seasons.  Her dream is to establish her own clothing store, but her greatest challenges are her competition and her limited working capital.  For this reason, she has turned to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, where she is applying for her first financing through Kiva.  With the loan, Karen will buy school shoes and school supplies, taking advantage of the start of the school year. when there is greater rotation of these products and increased sales.  It will allow Karen to increase her profits which are currently at 25% for catalog products and 100% for footwear.

loans.use: Buying school shoes and school supplies

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Collabinas” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,  tiene 02 hijos (1 independiente).  La señora estudio educación secundaria. 
Hace cuatro meses trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de animales vacunos y ovinos.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, comprará 02 animales vacunos y también lanas para la fabricación de sus tejidos como chompas, chullos, bordados y fundas.  Ella recibe el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en el magisterio.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y obtener mejores ganancias.	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y el intercambio de palabras con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of Las Collabinas communal bank in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department.  She is 48, in a common-law marriage, has 2 children (1 an adult) and she studied through secondary school.  Four months ago she started working with the Manuela Ramos Moviment. Her first loan was for 500 new sols which she used for her business of cattle and sheep sales.

With this loan of 1,500 new sols, she wil buy 2 cows and also wool that she uses to knit sweaters, hats, embroidery and, cushion covers.    Her husband helps with expenses as well with his work as a magistrate.

Her dream is to improve her business and get better earnings.

What she likes about the communal bank are the meetings, the punctuality, and the friendly exchanges among the other members.

loans.use: To buy two head of cattle and also wool for her knitting business of sweaters, wool hats, embroidery and pillow covers

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita de 26 años; natural del distrito de Quimbiri  convive con Edgar de 29 años, fruto del gran amor que sienten tienen 02 hijos Samith de 10 años y Ruth de 07 años de edad y juntos viven en su propia casa donde reina la felicidad. Sarita, es una mujer muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de sobresalir en la vida; es dueña de su propio negocio de Raspadillas; que lleva por nombre Raspadillas Sarita, donde viene trabajando 02 años cuenta que su primera inversión fue de 1,500 nuevos soles para la moledora de hielo, una carreta para vender las raspadillas y fruta. Al principio le fue difícil ganarse la clientela, pero luego la gente le gustó las raspadillas. Hoy disfruta de su trabajo y de los buenos ingresos económicos que le genera la venta de este refresco. Asegura que el secreto es: tener voluntad y ser creativo, vender lo que no hay, dar un buen servicio, ser cuidadoso con la limpieza y atender bien a la gente. Los planes para el futuro de su negocio es comprar otra moledora de hielo para así abastecerse con su público exigente. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará una moledora de hielo ya que con una sola moledora no se abastece.
texts.en: Sarita, 26 years old, from the district of Quimbiri, lives with 29-year-old Edgar. As a fruit of their great love, they have two children: Samith, 10 years old, and Ruth, 7 years of age. They live together in their own home where happiness reigns. Sarita is a very business-oriented woman with many desires of excelling in life; she is the boss of her own snow cone business called Raspadillas Sarita (Sarita's Snow Cones). She has worked there for two years and tells us that her first investment was 1,500 nuevos soles for the ice grinder and a cart on which to sell the fruit and snow cones. At the beginning, it was difficult for her to acquire new clients, but then her popularity grew as people tried the snow cones and liked them. Today she enjoys her work and the good income that the sale of this beverage generates. She advises that the secrets to a good business are: having willpower, being creative, selling unusual products, providing good service, paying attention to the cleanliness and attending well to her clients. The plan for her business' future is to buy another blender in order to keep up with the demand. This is the fourth loan with MFP and she is saving in order to be able to make her payments on time, seeing as she doesn't want to cause any problems with her communal bank because she is very happy with it. With the 1500 nuevos soles, she will buy a blender because her current blender doesn't suffice.

loans.use: To buy a blender.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Para Rita O. habitante del barrio ciudadela 20 de Julio, lugar donde vive con su conyuge y sus hijos en las edades de 15 y 19 años, el negocio de vender frutas tropicales, tutifruti o salpicon de frutas naturales y alimentos fritos, constituyen su dia a dia, de lunes a sabado y  de 8:00 a.m a 8:00 p.m  desde el año 2000, cuando iniciò esta actividad dirigida al mercado de peatones y vecinos, que comunmente pasan por el corredor donde se encuentra ubicado su negocio. Rita con su microempresa ha logrado apoyar el sostenimiento de su familia, porque tiene el gran desafio de llevar a sus hijos a que sean profesionales y sueña con que ellos sean hombres de bien y logren ser exitosos en lo que emprendan. Esta es justamente su inspiraciòn por la cual se levanta todos los dias con mucho entusiasmo a trabajar, para sostener su negocio que hoy se mantiene con una liquidez de 1,93, un endeudamiento en un 25%, una rotaciòn de cartera de un dia, logrando tambien una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de un 25,9%. Este es su primer financiamento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo y està aplicando a un credikiva para comprar frutas tropicales como mango, papaya, patilla, nispero, melon patilla, tamarindo, lulo, tomate de àrbol, azucar, harina,mantequilla, aceite y carne.
texts.en:
For Rita O., resident of the 20 de Julio neighborhood where she lives with her spouse and children who are 15 and 19 years old, her business of selling tropical fruit, fruit salads and fried food has been her day to day life, Monday through Saturday, from 8am until 8pm since the year 2000 when she started this business aimed at the market of pedestrians and neighbors who regularly pass through the corridor where her business is located.
