Rita has managed to support her family with her micro business because she faces the great challenge of seeing her children become professionals and she dreams with their becoming upstanding citizens and successful in whatever they undertake.

This is precisely the inspiration for her to get up every day with much enthusiasm to work, to support her business which today has a liquidity of 1.93, a debt of 25%, an inventory turnaround of one day and a profit margin over sales of 25.9%.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy tropical fruit like mango, papaya, melon, loquat, watermelon, tamarind, lulo, tree tomato, sugar, flour, butter, oil and meat.

loans.use: To buy tropical fruits like mango, papaya, watermelon, loquat, melon, tamarind, lulo (a species of nightshade), tomate de árbol (tree tomato, tamarillo), sugar, flour, butter, oil and meat.

loans.name: Dennys

texts.es:
Dennys es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Collabinas” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil casada y  tiene 01 hijo.  La señora estudió educación secundaria. 
Desde hace un año trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artefactos, títeres y ganados.
En la actualidad solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá para comprar 50 kilos de lanas para su tejido de títeres, para venderlos en Acora.  En el negocio le ayuda su esposo.
Su sueño es crecer más en el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Dennys is a member of the "Las Collabinas" communal bank located in the district of Ilave, El Collao province, Puno department.  She is 27 years old and married, with one child.  She has a secondary school education.

For the last year she has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles.  She invested the money in her business selling appliances, puppets, and livestock.

Now she is asking for a new loan in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles.  She will use the money to buy 50 kilos of wool for fabric for her puppets, in order to sell them in Acora.  Her husband helps her with the business.

Her dream is to grow her business more and increase her earnings.

What she likes about the communal bank are its meetings and its punctuality.

loans.use: To purchase 50 kilos of wool for fabric for puppets

loans.name: Yudani Evelin

texts.es: Yudani Evelin S. de 26 años es una joven casada y con un hijo de dos años de edad, que tiene un negocio de venta de mercancias especialmente productos alimenticios y cosmèticos, mediante guias especializadas de productos, a travès de las cuales promociona una variada gama de articulos entre vecinas, familiares y empleados referidos por sus propios clientes.   Yudani iniciò esta actividad buscando generar otros ingresos a su hogar  y gradualmente ha ido adquiriendo su experiencia y con ello ampliando la cobertura de su mercado; hoy està aplicando a un credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo para comprar productos alimenticios, que tambien vienen en catalogos y ya tiene un registro de encargos de sus clientes. Su sueño es tener una casa propia y su gran desafio es conseguir el suficiente capital de trabajo para atender la demanda de sus productos, respuesta con la cual ayudarìa a fortalecer su negocio, que en la actualidad presenta una utilidad del 22%, un capital de trabajo por valor de $1.750.000 cop y una rotaciòn de inventarios de 8 dias.
texts.en:
Yudani Evelin S., 26, is a young married woman with a two year old son.  She has a business selling merchandise, especially food items and cosmetics, via specialized catalogues though which she promotes a wide variety of items among her neighbors, family members and employees referred by her customers.

Yudani started this activity seeking ways to generate additional family income and gradually has been acquiring experience leading to an expanded market.  Today she is applying for a Kiva loan, which is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy food items that are also in the catalogues for she already has pending orders from her customers.

Her dream is to have a house of her own and her great challenge is to acquire enough working capital to meet demand for her products which would help her strengthen her business which currently is showing a 22% profit level, working capital valued at $1.750.000 COP and an 8 day inventory turnaround.

loans.use: To buy food items.

loans.name: Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca Group

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa, tiene 3 hijos,  es casada  y lleva trabajando con Edaprospo desde hace 1 año, Rosa  es tesorera del grupo “Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca”, grupo conformado por 10  integrantes. Rosa   trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza  desde hace 10 años y a su vez también vende comida en su casa, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a  logrado mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, obteniendo mayor ingresos y  así terminando  de construir su casa, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar productos de belleza y seguir vendiéndolos. Sabemos que Rosa  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Rosa has three children, is married, and has been collaborating with Edaprospo for a year.  She is the Treasurer of the “Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca” communal bank which has 10 members.

Rosa has been selling beauty products for ten years and also sells food at home.  Thanks to her effort and dedication she’s managed to improve her family’s quality of life obtaining higher income and thus finishing building her house.

With the goal of continued growth she is asking for a new loan to buy beauty products to continue selling them.  We know that Rosa will reach her goals with much effort and work and Edaprospo loans will help her.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Zulma Iraday

texts.es:
Zulma es socia del Banco Comunal “Inka Wasi” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 03 hijos, la señora estudio educación superior. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de lentes de contacto.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, comprará diez docenas de lentes. Trabaja sola en una tienda y su esposo también vende lentes en  otro puesto.
Su sueño es poner una cadena de ópticas que le permita generar más ingresos.	
Le que gusta de Manuela Ramos es la facilidad en que le brindan los préstamos.
texts.en:
Zulma is a member of the “Inka Wasi” communal bank located in Puno district, Puno province, Puno department.  She is 35 years old, married and has three children; she finished higher education.

She has been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for five years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in her contact lens business.

She will use this new 700 new sol loan to buy ten dozen lenses.  She works alone in a store and her husband also sells glasses in a different stall.

Her dream is to set up a chain of optician shops that will allow her to earn more income.

What she likes about Manuela Ramos is the ease with which they grant loans.

loans.use: To buy ten dozen contact lenses.

loans.name: Martha Ramona

texts.es: Martha Ramona G. tiene 60 años y es la propietaria del negocio “Confeciònes Marynaty” alli se dedica a la confecciòn de todo tipo de ropa especialmentetrabaja en  la lìnea masculina, aunque tambien trabaja las manualidades y principalmente la lencerìa . Su actividad es producto de la tradiciòn familiar, antes trabajaba en una empresa donde fortaleciò su saber y posteriormente decidiò emprender su propio negocio, por efecto de que por su edad no lograba encontrar un trabajo. Asi fuè como se dia a esta tarea con el fin de apoyar la educaciòn de sus tres hijos, que en la actualidad estan en las edades de 24 a 35 años. Su sueño es organizar su negocio en un local independiente a su casa y con todas las comodidades que le faciliten su crecimiento y sostenibilidad en el negocio. En la actualidad està solicitando su primer financiamiento a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo mediante su lìnea Kivacrèdito, para comprar telas, hilo, esponja, resortes, algodón y aplicaciones, pues ya se acercan los carnavales de Barranquilla y ella responderà a la demanda de esta temporada.
texts.en:
Martha Ramona García, 60, owns “Confecciones Marynaty,” a business where she manufactures all kinds of clothing, especially menswear, although she also works on crafts and lingerie.

Her activity is a product of family tradition.  She used to work for a firm where she strengthened her knowledge and later decided to start her own business because she couldn’t find employment due to her age.  This is how she took on this task in order to support the education of her three children who are currently between the ages of 24 and 35.  Her dream is to set up her business in a locale separate from her house with all the comforts that will facilitate its growth and sustainability.

She is asking for her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through a Kiva loan to buy fabric, thread, foam, elastic, cotton and appliqués because the Barranquilla Carnivals are approaching and she wants to be able to respond to the season’s demand.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, foam, elastic, cotton and appliqués.

loans.name: Hilaria Ursula

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilaria Ursula; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de artesanía y también se dedica al tejido y a la venta de chompas, ella trabaja en forma independiente llevando la artesanía y chompas a las diferentes tiendas que le hacen pedido, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de artesanía y lanas para hacer las chompas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hilaria Úrsula, 51, is a member of the “HATAN RUMIYOC” communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is a widow and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with a crafts business; she also knits sweaters to sell.  She works independently taking the crafts and sweaters to various stores that place orders with her.  Through this business she raises her children.  She wants to expand the crafts business and is asking for a loan to buy crafts and wool to make the sweaters.

She is happy about the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: To buy crafts and wool to make sweaters.

loans.name: Yao  Amétépe

texts.fr: Monsieur  Yawo  est âgé de 25 ans.  Il fait la photocopie. Il a commencé en 1996 l’activité et  s’approvisionne à la librairie Bon Pasteur. Ensuite, il satisfait les clients dans son établissement  CHATO & FILS à côté de la douane du port Autonome de Lomé. Il demande un prêt  pour acheter une photocopieuse.
texts.en: Mr. Yawo is 25 years old. He makes photocopies.  He started his business in 1996 and stocks up at the Bon Pasteur (Good Shepard) bookstore.  Then he serves his customers at his establishment CHATO & SONS next to the customs office of the Autonomous Port of Lomé.  He is asking for a loan to buy a photocopier.

loans.use: Purchase of a photocopier

loans.name: Akouwa Akofa

texts.fr: Mademoiselle  Akouwa est âgée de  26 ans. Elle fait la vente de boissons BB et de produits d’alimentation. Elle compte dans cette activité 10 ans déjà et revend les produits à côté du marché Ahligo. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et à la Brasserie du Benin.  Mais elle n’a pas de stocks raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un prêt pour se réapprovisionner.
texts.en: Miss Akouwa is 26 years old.  She sells BB drinks and food.  She has already been in this business for 10 years and resells products next to the Ahligo market.  She stocks up at the main market in Lomé and at the Benin Brasserie.  But she is out of stock which is why she is asking for a loan to replenish her stock.

loans.use: Purchase of food products and BB drinks

loans.name: Johannes

texts.fr: Monsieur Johannes  a  49 ans  et père  de 6 enfants. Il habite quartier Ahligo où il exerce son activité. Il  est meunier pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins  de ces  enfants.  Il a commencé en  1995 l’activité. Il a employé  une personne qui l’aide dans ces activités. Il  demande  un prêt  pour acheter une dynamo.
texts.en: Mr. Johannes is 49 years old and the father of six. He lives in the Ahligo district where he also works. He works as a miller in order to be able to support his children. He started this work in 1995. He employs one assistant. He requests a loan to purchase a generator.

loans.use: Purchasing a generator

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP MAME DIARRA est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 23 femmes qui sont toutes du même quartier. Elles se sont regroupées par voisinage et par affinité et fonds pratiquement toutes le petit commerce comme activité principale

Madame MAME FATY D. tout à fait à droite de la photo et mise en médaillon est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. 

Elle du petit commerce de vêtements. Elle est aussi couturière de profession. 

Son crédit lui servira à acheter des vêtements à revendre et a acheter des fournitures de couture pour confectionner des vêtements qu'elle revend dans le quartier.

Son objectif est de soutenir financièrement son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille, et prendre aussi en charge sa progéniture.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Mame Diarra has been created on December 30, 2009. It is composed of 23 women all living in the same neighborhood. They are friends and neighbors who decided to form a group together. Almost all of them work primarily as vendors.

Mrs. Mame Faty D. to the far right in the photo (she also appears in the medallion) is the group leader’s leader. She is married and the mother of three dependent children.

She retails clothing. She is also a seamstress by profession. Her loan will allow her to purchase closing for resale as well as sewing accessories needed to sew clothes to be sold in her neighborhood.

Her goal is to help her husband financially with family expenses and to support her children.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for resale, as well as sewing accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Sop Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP NABY est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 18 femmes qui sont de la même localité. Elles sont très solidaires et partagent le même centre d'intérêt: le développent de leur terroir. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KELLE N.

Madame ANTA M., à debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge d'un de ses neveux. 

Elle fait de l'élevage de poulets. Elle achète de l'aliment de volaille et des poussin d'un jour les élève pendant 4o à 50 jours pur les revendre dans le quartier soit sur pied soit plumés.

Son crédit lui permettre de faire une légère extension de son activité en passant une commande de poussins plus importante.
texts.en:
The Sop Naby solidarity group was created on December 30, 2009. It is composed of 18 women from the same neighborhood. They are  unified and share the same main interest: developing their land. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Kelle N..

Mrs. Anta M., standing to the right in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is 37 years of age. She is married and the mother of three dependent children. She also has one of her nephews in her care.

She raises chicken. She purchases chicken feed  and baby chicks, feeding them for 40-50 days before reselling them locally, either live or plucked.

Her credit [will] allow her to expand her business somewhat and to purchase  a larger brood of chicks.

loans.use: Purchasing baby chicks, chicken feed and veterinary products

loans.name: Ines Maria

texts.es: Ines Maria R. vive con sus dos hijos, en las edades de 15 y 16 años, en el municipio de Soledad muy cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Alli tiene su negocio a partir del cual vende servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional en una sala de belleza donde hace cortes de cabello, aliser, cepillado, peinados, maquillaje, pedicure y manicure dirigidos a damas y caballeros.  Ella iniciò esta actividad haciendo un curso de belleza, y cuando terminò empezò a trabajar como ayudante de la peluquerìa de una cuñada donde adquiriò su mayor experiencia y donde decidiò emprender su propio negocio.  Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo con la cual comprarà shampoo, masajes, silicona, tintex acondicionadores  y cosmèticos para la venda porque aprovecha asesorando a sus clientes respecto a que productos utilizar de acuerdo a su perfil fisico.  Con sus financiamientos ha logrado adecuar su local de trabajo y condicionarlo separado de su vivienda y con mucho confort, para que sus clientes una vez lleguen a solicitar sus servicios se queden y no se cambien a la competencia.   Su sueño es construìr un segundo piso para lograr aun mas la ampliaciòn de su local y lograr una educaciòn exitosa para sus hijos, que son su màxima inspiraciòn para el ejercicio de su oficio. En la actualidad su negocio maneja una rotacion de inventarios de 13 dias, una liquidez de 1,7  un endeudamiento del 30% y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de un 15% y desde aquì proyecta su crecimiento  con la nueva fianaciaciòn.
texts.en:
Inés María R. lives with her two children, who are 15 and 16 years old, in the municipality of Soledad very near the city of Barranquilla.  She has her business there selling personal and professional image improvement services in a beauty salon where she does haircuts, hair straightening, brush outs, hair styling, make-up, pedicure and manicure for men and women.

She started the activity taking a beauty course and when she finished she started working as an assistant in a barber shop belonging to a sister-in-law where she got more experience and decided to start her own business.

This is her second financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy shampoo, massages, silicone, hair dye, conditions and cosmetics to sell because she’ll advise her customers on which items to use according to their physical traits.

Her financings have made it possible for her to equip her workspace and set it up separate from her living quarters with quite a bit of comfort so that when her customers come by to request services they’ll stay and not go over to the competition.

Her dream is to build a second story to expand her locale even more to be able to successfully educate her children who are the paramount inspiration for her work.

Presently her business rotates inventory in 13 days, has a liquidity of 1.7, a debt of 30% and a profit on sales of 15% and she is projecting growth from here with the new financing.

loans.use: To buy beauty salon supplies.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan Antonio M. de 48 años es el propietario de la panaderìa refresqueria y salsamentaria “EL Triunfo”; èl es casado y  padre de 3 hijos en la edades de 13 a 17 años. Procedente de Concordia  en el departamento del Magdalena, pueblo donde naciò , llegò desde muy joven a la ciudad de Barranquilla con sus padres,  estudiò aquì su bachillerato para  posteriormente graduarse como tecnico en sistemas, actividad en la que trabajò para una empresa por varios años, tiempo en el que tambien  contrajo matrimonio. Cinco años despues decidiò desarrollar su espiritu emprendedor mediante  una iniciativa de negocio de panaderìa, en la que hoy tiene una experiencia de 15 años, actividad ha ido ampliando complementandola con comidas ràpidas y asadero de pollo.
En la actualidad esta aplicando a su tercer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, organizaciòn con la que ha logrado formalizar y legalizar su negocio, e incrementar su capital de trabajo. Con este, su credikiva comprarà harina, grasa, mantequilla, azucar, sal levaduras, queso, inversiòn que proyecta ser exitosa por el sitios estratègico donde se encuentra ubicado y por su gran experiencia en el manejo de la fabricaciòn de estos productos, que resultan ser una delicia al comerlos diariamente calienticos. Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales exitosos y gente de bien , por eso unido con su familia trabaja persistentemente para lograr este gran desafio de prosperidad personal, familiar y empresarial. Su negocio se ha sostenido aunque la competencia en la venta de pollos asados es muy fuerte, pero la calidad en el servicio y en la oferta que Juan Antonio tiene  siempre se ha impuesto. Asì ha sostenido la rotacion de sus cuentas de un dia, rotaciòn de sus  inventarios en 7 dias,  su rentabilidad en un 25% , su capacidad de pago es del 69%,  mientras su endeudamiento actual es de 31% y futuro aplicandole este financiamiento es de 33%. Para Juan Antonio cada dia representa un reto personal al que se enfrenta para cumplir con las metas que se ha propuesto.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio M., 48, owns a bakery/snack shop/cured meats shop called “El Triunfo.”  He’s married and the father of three children whose ages range from 13 to 17.  He is originally from Concordia in Magdalena department, the town where he was born.  He came to Barranquilla very young with his parents.  He studied high school here and later graduated as a Systems Technician, a job he worked at in a firm for several years, time in which he also got married.  Five years later he decided to develop his entrepreneurial spirit opening a bakery.  To date he has 15 years experience.  He has added to the main activity fast food and roasted chickens.

Presently he’s applying for his 3rd loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization with which he has managed to formalize and legalize his business and increase his working capital.  He will use this Kiva loan to buy flour, shortening, butter, sugar, salt, yeast and cheese.  He projects that the investment will be successful because of the strategic location his business has and because of the vast experience he has manufacturing these products that have become a delicacy when eaten daily warm from the oven.

His dream is that his children become successful professionals and upstanding citizens.  This is why, together with his family, he works persistently to overcome this great challenge of personal, family and business prosperity.

His business has survived even though competition in roasted chicken sales is very heavy but the quality of the service and of the goods Juan Antonio offers has always stood out.

Thus he has maintained an account rotation of one day, inventory rotation in 7 days, his profit margin is 25%, his capacity of payment is 69% while his current debt is 31% and applying this new loan his future debt will be 33%.  For Juan Antonio each day means a personal challenge that he faces to meet the goals he’s established for himself.

loans.use: To buy larger amounts of wheat flour, shortening, butter, sugar, salt, yeast and cheese.

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es:
Isabel Mari A. es una mujer de 45 años que vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposo y sus tres  hijos en las edades de 14, 16 y 20 años allí tiene un negocio llamado: “Tienda el grano de mostaza”  donde vende ranchos víveres y productos de la canasta familiar, en la que trabaja con sus esposo y con la que generan ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar. 
Isabel María desde la edad de 15 años llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla procedente de Majagual una población de Bolívar,  y se dedicó a trabajar de empleada del servicio doméstico durante una década; cuando contrae matrimonio decide   trabajar desde su casa para manejar mejor sus responsabilidades de madre, esposa y también generar ingresos para apoyar el sostenimiento, mientras  su esposo en ese entonces era cotero en una empresa, y después cambió su actividad laboral, para vender verdura en un puesto; cuando ella empezó su negocio  lo hizo con la venta de chicha de maíz o de arroz y también preparaba sopa en las horas de almuerzo y principalmente los días sábados y festivos, así lograba su mayor volumen de ventas.  En el año 1999 decidió iniciar un negocio de tienda en su casa y con la ayuda de su esposo, cuando ya habían reunido un capital para hacerlo, negocio que han logrado sostener y ampliar hasta llegara a fortalecerlo y generar sus propias fuentes de empleo desde su casa.
Este el financiamiento # 12 que tiene con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha logrado construir su historial crediticio y con la que ha logrado también darle una formalidad a su negocio.  Su sueño es continuar progresando, buscando oportunidades de trasladarse a otro barrio donde pueda generar   más estabilidad para su negocio, porque tiene un gran desafío respecto a la prestación de los servicios de luz, que muchas veces se tornan deficientes y también quiere mudarse a otro lugar para lograr una mayor comodidad y  el completo bienestar a sus hijos.  
En la actualidad su tienda maneja una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 2 días, su rotación de inventarios es de 19 días mientras maneja  una utilidad sobre las ventas es de 30%  y una capacidad de pago de un 39 %. Con su credikiva comprará útiles escolares, como libretas, lapiceros, lápices, block de hojas, cartulina para surtir su negocio en esta temporada escolar, lo cual augura una recuperación exitosa porque vende justamente lo que sus clientes necesitan.
texts.en:
Isabel Mari A. is a 45 year old woman living in the city of Barranquilla with her husband and three children ages 14, 16 and 20.  They have a business called: "A Mustard Shop" that sells groceries and basic products. She works with her husband to generate income to support their household.
 
María Isabel arrived in the city of Barranquilla from the Bolivar area of Majagual at age 15 and went to work as a domestic worker for a decade.  When she married, she decided to work from home to better manage her responsibilities  as a mother and wife and also to generate income to help with household expenses while her husband was a Cotero in a company.  Later on he changed his work to selling vegetables at a stall. When she started her business she did it by selling corn or rice chicha.  She also made soup at lunch time and especially on Saturdays and holidays when she made her highest volume in sales.  In 1999 she decided to open a store in her home with the help of her husband when they had assembled the capital to do so.  The business has been able to grow and expand and generate their own sources of employment from their home. 

This funding, # 12, she has with the "Mario Santo Domingo' Foundation, an organization with which she has managed to build her credit history and which has also given her business some formality.  Her dream is to continue progressing, looking for opportunities to move to another neighborhood where she can create more stability for her business because it faces great challenges regarding the provision of services like electricity, which often become weak, so she wants to move to another place for greater comfort and for the welfare of her children.
 
Today her shop handles a receivables turnover of 2 days, its inventory turnover is 19 days while operating return on sales is 30% and a capacity to pay 39%. With her Kiva loan she will buy school supplies like notebooks, pens, pencils, and pads of paper, and cardboard for her business in this school season, which promises a successful recovery because she sells exactly what her customers need.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies like book, pens, pencils, note pads, and cardboard to stock her business.

loans.name: John Francisco

texts.es:
John Francisco P., està satisfecho porque accederà a su segundo credikiva con el cual comprarà cerdos en pie y productos para alimentarlos y posteriormente vender su carne por libras, por lo cual espera vender mayor cantidad de carne a un muy buen precio satisfaciendo asì los pedidos de sus clientes. Con su anterior credito logrò hacer una buena inyecciòn de capital de trabajo a su negocio por eso agradece a los financiadores de Kiva por darle esta s dos oportunidades de acceder a crèditos, pues con el apoyo recibido ha podido crecer y aumentar el bienestar se su familia.  
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de John acceda al siguiente enlace:  http://www.kiva.org/lend/194714
texts.en:
John Francisco P. is satisfied because he will access his second Kiva loan that he’ll use to buy live pigs and feed for them to subsequently sell their meat by the pound.  He expects to sell larger amounts of meat at a very good price thus meeting customer orders.

He used his previous loan to make a significant capital injection into his business so he thanks Kiva funders for giving him these two opportunities to access loans because with the support received he’s been able to increase and grow his family’s wellbeing.

If you’d like to know John’s history, click on the following link: http://www.kiva.org/lend/194714

loans.use: To buy live pigs and feed for them to subsequently sell their meat.

loans.name: Marggi

texts.es:
Marggi R. vive en Malambo con su conyuge y su hijo de 18 años, en este municipio perteneciente al àrea metropolitana de Barranquilla, Maggi tiene su propio negocio llamado “Miscelanea y Panaderia Jorgito”, que comenzò a funcionar hace 7 años,  con la venta de cosmèticos por catàlogo, a la que fue agregando mercancias variadas que sus clientes le ivan sugiriendo y con su primer financiamiento en la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo logrò comprar una vitrina dandole el esquema de punto de venta, tal como ella lo habia planeado pues comprò vitrinas y las surtiò de articulos de papelerìa , teniendo como su principal mercado a las madres de los niños que ella cuida  en un hogar comunitario, o   asignaciòn que ofrece el estado nacional a mujeres que capacita previamente,  para que apoyen la alimentaciòn y el cuidado de los niños pequeños de la comunidad , con el fin de que   sus familiares  pueda trabajar y ellos esten bien cuidados , educados y alimentados nutritivamente y que en el caso de Maggui tiene 14 años de ser una “madre comunitaria”, actividad que le ha representado muchas oportunidades, pues ha conocido proveedores  de alimentos  de los mismos hogares comunitarios, con los que ha realizado contratos, como el que ahora tiene de proveer a 512 hogares de bienestar de alimentos derivados de la harina de trigo. Por eso desde el principio siendo consciente de esta oportunidad compró equipos básicos  de panadería como la sobadora, el horno, contrató un panadero, y alquiló un local con muchos implementos de panadería con los que resolvió su problema inicial de capacidad productiva de la que hoy goza y por la cual recibe también ingresos y la oportunidad del contrato ya mencionado. 
Este es el segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Maro Santo Domingo y está aplicando a un credikiva para comprar materias primas para su panadería, refrescos, dulces, implementos de aseo , para responder efectivamente a este contrato, porque su  gran desafío es justamente lograr sostener esta relación, ofreciendo la calidad que amerita los productos que son consumidos por infantes, los cuales debes ser procesados con las normas higiénicas y nutricionales de calidad y con la oportunidad que requiere la provisión diaria de estos a cada hogar de bienestar.
texts.en:
Marggi Ramírez lives in Malambo with her spouse and 18-year-old son.  This municipality is part of Barranquilla’s metropolitan area.  Marggi has her own business called: “Miscelánea y Panadería Jorgito,” which opened for business 7 years ago selling catalogue cosmetics.  Gradually she added other merchandise according to what her customers suggested and with her first Fundación Mario Santo Domingo loan she bought a display case giving the appearance of a sales point just like she’d planned because she bought display cases and stocked them with stationery items since her main market were mothers of the children she cares for in a group home, or placement that the national government offers to women who have been previously trained, to support the nourishment and care of small children in the community so that their parents can work and the children will be well cared for, educated and fed nutritionally.  

In Marggi’s case, she’s been a “community mother” for 14 years, an activity that has provided many opportunities because she’s met suppliers of food to the group homes with whom she’s negotiated contracts like the one she now has to supply 512 welfare homes with foods derived from wheat flour.  Because of this, aware from the beginning of this opportunity, she bought basic bakery equipment like a kneader and an oven, she hired a baker and leased a locale with many bakery tools which solved her initial problem of productive capacity which she now enjoys and through which she earns income and the opportunity of the previously mentioned contract.

This is the second financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’s applying for a Kiva loan to buy raw materials for her bakery, soft drinks, candy and cleaning supplies to respond effectively to this contract because her great challenge is precisely to maintain this relationship offering quality that the food the infants consume demands which must be processed following hygienic and nutritional norms of quality and with the opportunity that the daily provision to each wellbeing home entails.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her bakery, soft drinks, candy and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima 2 Group

texts.es:
El nombre de este comité es "Virgen de Fátima 2". Está formado por 15 miembros muy activas de la comunidad. Las mujeres están solicitando un crédito en este octavo ciclo de préstamo para comprar mercancía y artículos necesarios para su posterior venta. Todas las miembros del grupo tienen diferentes actividades y negocios, y algunas de ellas tienen un trabajo estable ganando un pequeño sueldo.
La Sra. Irene O. fue la que estableció el contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para crear este comité de préstamos. Ella ofrece servicios de costura en la comunidad y tiene una buena clientela, en aumento. Ella está buscando maneras de mejorar su negocio como el aumento del tamaño de su tienda y aumentar la mercancía disponible para hacer su trabajo (telas, agujas, hilos, botones, lienzos, etc.)
texts.en:
This committee is named "Virgen de Fátima 2". It is made up of 15 very active members of the community. The women are asking for credit in this 8th cycle of the loan to purchase merchandise and articles for a later sale. All members of the group have a stable job making a small salary.

Sra. Irene O. established contact with her neighbors and friends to form this loan committee. She offers sewing services in the community and has an increasing clientele. She is looking for ways to improve her business, such as increasing the size of her store and increasing the merchandise necessary to do her job (fabrics, needles, threads, buttons, linens, etc.)

loans.use: To buy sewing materials (fabric, cloth, needles)

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza vive en la zona de Miraflores Tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar su esposo quien  trabaja en horario continuo colabora con ,os gastos del hogar, ella trabaja como promotora de ventas desde hace tiempo (venta por catálogo) y también vende comida los fines de semana en los puentes trillizos y otras festividades ocasionales, la Sra. esperanza  también es consultora social trabaja en proyectos pequeños, ella solicita el crédito para incrementar de mercadería y compras algunos insumos razón por la cual solicito el crédito, es un apersona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Esperanza lives in Miraflores.  She has two children of school age.  Her husband, who works full-time, helps with the household costs.  She has worked  as a sales promoter for some time, selling through catalogs.  She also sells food on the weekends and other holidays on the Puentes Trillizos, three bridges in La Paz.  Esperanza is also a social consultant working on small projects.  She is asking for a loan to increase her merchandise.  She is a very hard-working woman and is grateful to the institution for the support it's given her.

loans.use: Buying cosmetics

loans.name: Fidela Erminia

texts.es:
Fidela es socia del Banco Comunal “Inka Wasi” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 03 hijos.  La señora estudio hasta 1ro de educación primaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de pasamanería y telas.
Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar cuatro cajas de cremas, colonias y otros productos.  Trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener un carro para trabajar, actualmente trabaja con un triciclo el cual le facilita poder vender sus productos.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad de los préstamos y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Fidela is a member of the community bank "Inka Wasi" located in the district of Puno.  She is 42 years old and married with three children.  Fidela studied until the first year of primary school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past three months. Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, money she invested in her business selling braids and fabrics.  She is asking for a new loan of 500 nuevos soles, money she will use to buy four boxes of cremes, colognes, and other products.  She works together with her husband.

Her dream is to have a car for work.  Currently she is working with a tricycle, which helps her sell her products.  What she likes about her community bank is the facility of obtaining loans and their punctuality.

loans.use: Buying four boxes of cremes, colognes, and other products.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Ii Group

texts.en:
The committee is called "Kuña Guapa II" and is in its first cycle with 11 members. It is a group of people united by solidarity and responsibility. The members have a great entrepreneurial spirit and therefore strive to meet fully the commitments made to the Foundation and conduct fund raising activities to help each other. Obtaining the credit will open many doors for the progress of their ventures. Such is the case of Ms. Ada B.. She has a small pantry and wants to increase her income to vary her stock of products and generate more income to support her family.

The committee was formed thanks to the efforts of Mrs. Adela F., a resident of Juan León Mallorquín (Ciudad del Este). Upon learning of the program, she contacted her neighbors and friends to form the committee in the area. Many ladies who live there are willing to work and are great entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase staple goods such as drinks, fruits & vegetables, and groceries in general.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
El Sr. Faustino  tiene 38 años y vive con su hermana.
El desde muy joven empezó a trabajar  como limpiador de paradas de taxi y luego como chofer, gracias a su esfuerzo logró comprar un vehículo y trabajar en él.
Él necesita de este crédito para la compra de cubiertas y también para realizar algunos arreglos que le faltan al vehículo  para que de esta manera pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Faustino anhela comprar otro vehículo y así obtener mejor ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Faustino is 38 years old and lives with his sister. At a very young age, he began working as a taxi cleaner and later as a driver. Thanks to his efforts, he was able to purchase a vehicle to use for his work.

He needs this loan to buy hubcaps and also pay for repairs since his vehicle is experiencing a few malfunctions. By correcting these problems, he hopes to provide better service to his customers. Faustino plans to buy another vehicle so that he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: Purchase new hubcaps & pay for vehicle repairs

loans.name: Maria Rebeca

texts.es:
María, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 2 y 7 años de edad, se dedica a vender productos de uso domestico, en una tienda que la administra en su casa. 
Este negocio surgió por necesidad, viéndose como responsable de la alimentación de sus hijos, decidió iniciar con el negocio, que hoy día es el que le ayuda a sobrellevar la carga del hogar. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería para el negocio, ya que en unas ocasiones se le agotan y pierde de vender.
Su objetivo es expandir más la tienda, abastecer de mercadería los inventarios, que sus ventas aumenten, y de su trabajo sacar a sus hijos adelante con una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
María resides in Jiquilisco in the Department of Usulután. She is 26 years old and a single mother of two children, ages 2 and 7. María sells household products from a store she manages in her home.

Her business has grown out of necessity since it is the means by which she is able to feed her children. She decided to start this business and now it helps her to support her household. María is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business since she has had opportunities when she ran out of inventory and lost potential sales.

Her goals are to expand her store even more, stock her inventory with more merchandise, increase her sales, and work to achieve a better financial situation so that her children can get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Visitamos a Juana Barón pues quiere su segundo credikiva; ella  nos contó  que estaba haciendo inversiones con la utilidad que produjo la primera inversión de su credikiva, la que distribuyó una parte en camarones y otra en pescado, además logró comprar juegos de cubrelechos que le habían encargado, credikiva  porque tiene nuevos clientes que han pedido les lleve camarón, pescado de mar,  toallas, multiusos, suéteres masculinos y camisas en general. Ella envía un mensaje de agradecimiento a sus fondeadores: “Que Dios le de mucha fortaleza para que la sigan apoyando.”   
Si usted desea leer su historia puede ingresar al siguiente enlace:

http://www.kiva.org/lend/189069
texts.en:
Juana Barón wants to obtain a second Kiva loan.  She said that she invested part of her first Kiva loan in shrimp and seafood for sale.  In addition, she was able to buy bedding sets that she had on order.  Juana needs another Kiva loan because she has new customers who are requesting shrimp, seafood, towels, multi-use products, men’s sweaters, and shirts.  She sends a message of thanks to her Kiva lenders: “May God give you much strength for your continued support.”

To read more about Juana’s story, please click on the following link:   http://www.kiva.org/lend/189069

loans.use: Purchase shrimp and seafood, as well as towels, multi-use products, men’s sweaters, and shirts

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en: Mr. Sergio is married with two children, one of whom is school age. He sells fruit and has two retail locations. One is 3½ miles away and the other is in area four of Ciudad del Este. The business is increasingly on the rise and generates a good income. With the help of his wife he is moving forward with much sacrifice and effort. Today Mr. Sergio is a successful small businessman with a large and loyal clientele because of his kindness. He has proven to be responsible and honest in his commitments and we must provide all necessary support for his endeavors.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José es un señor de 54 años de edad, dedicado a la carpintería, vive con su hija en Usulután, departamento de Usulután, don José posee un taller desde hace 10 años, y tiene también una pequeña tienda que comenzó hace un año.
Él solicita un préstamo para comprar madera para el taller y para mercadería de la tienda, esta inversión contribuirá a que él mejore sus servicios de carpintería, realizando todos los trabajos también con la tienda estará más estable teniendo al alcance todos lo que el cliente le solicite. 
Su aspiración es generar del negocio mayores ganancias con las cuales pueda cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, salud y otros gastos generales.
texts.en:
José is a 54 year old gentleman who works as a carpenter. He lives with his daughter in Usulután in the Department of Usulután. Don José has managed a workshop for ten years and also has a store that he opened a year ago.

He is requesting a loan to buy wood for his workshop and merchandise for his store. This investment will help him improve his carpentry services, complete all of his jobs, and also keep his store stable by offering everything his customers request.

His aspiration for his business is to generate more revenue so that he can pay for food, health care, and other general expenses.

loans.use: Purchase  wood for his carpentry workshop and merchandise for his store

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
Adrian S. and his family own Wing Shack, a family restaurant providing chicken wings, burgers, salads and more.  Born and raised in El Paso, Texas, Adrian has worked in restaurants since he was 14 years old.  When he decided to start a business, it made sense he start in an industry he already knew.  Adrian and his brother manage Wing Shack, with Adrian running restaurant operations and his brother in charge of finances.

Adrian and his brother have had a hand in every aspect of Wing Shack from the beginning.  Wing Shack’s menu is their own creation with their own recipes.  They bought an existing building and renovated it to fit the restaurant’s needs.  They personally painted and remodeled the inside, and actually built the restaurant bar themselves.  

Adrian heard of ACCION Texas-Louisiana through the local Hispanic Chamber of Commerce, after his bank denied him a loan.  Adrian’s primary objective with this loan is to build credit.  This is the first loan Adrian has received for Wing Shack, having to this point relied on his own capital and loans from friends.  By building credit through this loan, Adrian will be able to qualify for greater financing in the future, if and when the need arises.  

Since Wing Shack opened in March, 2010, it has consistently had strong sales.  The problem is that expenses sometimes have the money going out as quickly as it comes in.  When bills come in at once, it temporarily puts stress on cash flow.  The additional cushion this loan provides will ensure they have enough money to meet monthly operating costs.

Adrian says, right now, his life is the business.  Down the road, Adrian would like to open a second Wing Shack in El Paso’s western half, and possibly someday make it a franchise.  Adrian warns other business owners not to cut corners, and to properly insure their business.  Recently, there was an ice storm in El Paso that forced Wing Shack to close for three days.  Thankfully, the losses Wing Shack incurred are covered in its insurance policy.

loans.use: Building credit and meeting general operational expenses

loans.name: Azucena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Azucena, es una señora muy trabajadora, tiene 53 años D. edad, se dedica a vender semilla D. marañón, es V. y actualmente vive con sus hijos en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután. El negocio lo aprendió D. sus familiares, pero para mantenerse ella debe comprar en temporada D. Marañón, adquiriendo cantidades grandes para casi todo el año, es por esta situación que solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en compra D. semilla.
Con esta inversión espera obtener una buena cantidad D. semilla, para poder vender en todo el año, sin que le falte trabajo, sus ventas las realiza en Usulután y en ocasiones tiene que viajar hasta San Salvador para realizarlas, con el objetivo D. tener ingresos para su familia.
La aspiración D. doña Azucena es lograr una buena inversión D. los fondos del préstamo, vender durante el año buenas cantidades, cancelar puntualmente el préstamo  y mejorar su condición D. vida.
texts.en:
Doña Azucena is a hardworking woman. She is 53 years old and lives with her children in Jiquilisco in the Department of Usulután. Azucena sells cashew nuts and learned this business from her relatives. To keep her business running, she must buy when the cashews are in season. She is able to purchase large quantities that last for most of the year. On this occasion, Azucena is requesting a loan to invest in cashew nuts.

With this investment, she hopes to obtain good quality cashews that she can sell throughout the entire year and will allow her to keep working. Her sales are conducted in Usulután, but occasionally she travels as far as San Salvador to sell her product in order to generate income for her family. Doña Azucena hopes the funds from this loan will result in a good investment. She plans to sell large quantities throughout the year, repay her loan on time, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase cashew nuts

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar, tiene 27 años de edad, reside en Arambala departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad, vive en compañía de su esposa y una hija de 3 meses de edad, donde residen es propiedad de un tío, ahí tiene el negocio desde hace un año, lo atiende a tiempo completo y es la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería ya que quiere incrementar el negocio comprando granos básicos, azúcar, frijoles, arroz, aceite, café, sal, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a recibir mejores ingresos para seguir reinvirtiendo en el negocio, dándole un mejor funcionamiento y mejores ganancias para su familia.
El sueño de Oscar es construir su propia casa, es por eso que trabaja diariamente para algún día lograrlo.
texts.en:
Oscar is 27 years old and resides in Arambala in the Department of Morazán. He lives on his uncle’s property with his wife and three month old daughter. Oscar has been selling basic necessities for one year. He manages his business full-time since he relies on this source of income.

Oscar is requesting a loan to buy merchandise so that he can increase his business. He will buy basic grains, sugar, beans, rice, oil, coffee, salt, and other items. This investment will help him generate better earnings so that he can reinvest into his business. As a result, his store will function better and produce more income for his family.

Oscar dreams of building his own house. He will continue working until the he is able to achieve his goal some day.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, sugar, beans, rice, oil, coffee, salt, and other items

loans.name: Fausto

texts.en:
Mr. Fausto N. is a client of our bank from several years ago. He is married to Mrs. Andresa Bogado. They are the parents of three children and are located at Kilometer 7 New Town (Ciudad del Este) as of next Monday.

Mr. Fausto is dedicated to the sale of offal by walking around the area. Through his dedication he already has his own house. His family is industrious, honest, and responsible, as reflected with the fulfillment of their loan obligations.

loans.use: To purchase meats and offal

loans.name: Aura Sofia

texts.es:
Este es el tercer financiamiento que la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo le hace a Aura O.  B.  y actualmente su segundo credikiva, con el que planea comprar vestidos y accesorios  infantiles al por mayor y de contado. Ella se encuentra muy contenta porque cada vez que ella invierte en su negocio su capital se incrementa y responde mas rápido a sus clientes porque maneja una mejor liquidez y con su esposo persiste en el trabajo porque su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales exitosos. 

Si usted conocer la historia de Aura O. puede acceder al siguiente enlace:

http://www.kiva.org/lend/204781
texts.en:
Aura O. B. is receiving her third loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which is her second through Kiva.  She plans to buy clothing and baby accessories in bulk and with cash.  Aura is extremely satisfied because each time she invests in her business, her capital increases and she is able to respond more quickly to her customers.  She is able to handle her liquidity better, which allows her husband to focus on his work.  Her dream is to see her children become successful professionals.  

To read more about Juana’s story, please click on the following link:   http://www.kiva.org/lend/204781

loans.use: Purchase clothing & baby accessories

loans.name: Cala Calita Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento Cala Calita  esta compuesto por la siguiente mesa directiva: la presidenta del grupo  es la señora  Karin, se dedica a la venta de  frituras  ella produce y entrega a escuelas colegios desde hace 10 años, su familia esta compuesta por su  esposo y dos  hijos que todos viven con ella. El monto que solicito es para la compra de aceite y papa en cantidad.  La tesorera del grupo es la señora Soraida se dedica a la venta de abarrotes hace ya 10 años, su familia esta compuesta por su esposo y  su dos hijos. El monto que ha solicitado es para la compra  en cantidad (abarrotes), todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en muchos casos sacan a delante a sus familias solas con el único deseo de mejorar su calidad de vida, las socias están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.En la foto las socias se encuentran con sus niños.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Cala Calita” is led by the following officers:

Sra. Karin, the group president, has been making and selling chips for ten years. She delivers her product to schools and colleges. Her family consists of her husband and two children, all of whom live with her. Her portion of this group loan will be used to buy oil and potatoes in bulk.

The group treasurer is Sra. Soraida. She has been selling groceries for ten years. Her family consists of her husband and two children. Her part of the group loan will be used to buy groceries in bulk.

All of the members are responsible and hardworking individuals. In most cases, their families are able to move forward by themselves. Their only wish is to improve their quality of life. The members are grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided. In the photograph, the members appear with their children.

loans.use: Purchase potatoes & oil for making chips

loans.name: Lisseth Noemy

texts.es:
Liseth, de 19 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 5 años de edad, la casa es de su suegra. Liseth se dedica a la venta de pupusas, tiene un año de dedicarse a este negocio, el horario de venta es de 4:00pm a 9:00pm, aprendió la elaboración de las pupusas por su suegra.
Ella necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en maíz, chicharrón y quesillo, esta compra le ayudara a tener los materiales necesarios para preparar las ventas diarias, también a la atención de los clientes ya que espera mejorar su preparación de las pupusas.
Las aspiraciones de ella con respecto al préstamo es: realizar una buena inversión, mejorar los ingresos de la familia, ayudar a su hijo en los estudios y algún día tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Liseth, age 19, lives in San Francisco Gotera in the Morazan department. She lives with her husband and five-year-old child. Their house belongs to her mother-in-law. Liseth sells pupusas [stuffed tortillas] and has had this business for one year. Her sales schedule is from 4:00 pm to 9:00 pm. She learned to make pupusas from her mother-in-law.
She needs a loan to invest in corn, pork and cheese. This purchase will help her to have the necessary materials to prepare for her daily sales. It will also improve her customer service as she hopes to improve her pupusas.
Her goals with respect to this loan are: to make a good investment, improve her family's income, help her child with his education, and to one day have her own home.

loans.use: the purchase of rice, pork and cheese.

loans.name: Jenis

texts.es: Jenis A. es una mujer de 48 años de edad  que vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su conyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 20 y 23 años. Jenis  se dedica a la venta de carnes rojas , como extendiòn del oficio de su esposo que tiene un expendio en el mercado desde hace 16 años. Ella tiene los clientes en el  barrio donde vive y en los alrededores , allì las familias le encargan por libras y ella diariamente toma los pedidos, con este negocio ha apoyado el sustento del hogar y cada dia se esmera por tener nuevos clientes para obtener mayores utilidades y apoyar a sus hijos, Su meta principal el lograr tener un  punto de ventas en su vivienda bien condicionado con los niveles de higiene y  refregeraciòn que este producto requiere. Jenis està aplicando a su primer financiamento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo y es su primer credikiva  con el cual comprarà carne roja al pormayor para obtener mejores descuentos y aumentar su cobertura de clientes.  Su mayor desafio es superar el duelo que dejò su madre al partir pues logrò desatibilizase con su muerte pues era su mejor amiga y un gran apoyo.
texts.en: Jenis A. is a 48 year old woman who lives in the city of Barranquilla with her spouse and two children, aged 20 and 23. Jenis sells red meat, as an extension of her husband's job. He has had a stall in the market for 16 years. She has customers in the neighborhood where she lives and in the surrounding areas. Families order pounds from her and she takes their orders every day. She has supported her family with this business and every day she strives to have new customers and more profits to support her children. Her main goal is to have a point of sale in her house that is well equipped with the levels of sanitation and refrigeration that the product requires. Jenis is applying for her first loan with the Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo and this is her first Kiva loan. With it, she will buy red meat wholesale to get higher discounts and increase her humber of customers. Her biggest challenge is getting over her greif for her mother. She has been able to become stable after her death. She was her best friend and a great support.

loans.use: She will buy red meat wholesale to get higher discounts and increase her number of customers

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena R. es una joven muy activa que vive en Puerto Colombia, un municipio a la orilla del mar, alli tiene un negocio de miscelanea llamado Variedades Loma de Oro; ella es casada y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad , su negocio inicò hace dos años con una pequeña vitrina metalica, en la que exhibia articulos de una manera muy tecnica, pues justamente es una experta en mercadeo y ventas porque estudiò esa carrera y ademàs tuvo experiencia de trabajo en un depòsito de viveres,  donde conociò a su hoy esposo y con el que tiene un hijo en la edad de dos años de edad; ambos renunciaron de esta empresa y se dedicaron a trabajar de manera independiente como hasta hoy lo hacen. Por un lado Maria iniciò su negocio de miscelanea a la que agregò un computador portatil y una impresora, pues tambien presta el servicio de transcripciones, comunicaciones por fax y fotocopiaje  y  por otro lado su esposo se dedicò totalmente a su tienda de viveres, ambos negocios han sido importante el el mejoramiento de sus ingresos. El sueño de Maria es ver convertido su miscelanea en un gran almacen, con un surtido que responda a las necesidades de sus clientes en cada temporada del año; por eso hoy aplica a su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, a travès de la lìnea credikiva, con el cual comprarà una fotocopiadora , artulos de papelerìa para atender la demanda de los estudiantes de los colegios cercanos, especialmente en esta època en que los padres de familia deben hacer sus compras de utiles escolares, para responder a las necesidades educativas de sus hijos.  De esta manera Maria y su esposo se esfuerzan por construirle a su pequeño hijo un futuro pometedor, para que cuando sea adulto y mire la inmensidad de su mar encuentre felicidad, en un hermoso escenario donde sus padres forjaron su destino.
texts.en:
Maria Elena R. is a very active youth who lives in Puerto Colombia, a municipality on the edge of the ocean. There she has a miscellaneous business called Variedades Loma de Oro. She is married and has a 2-year-old child. She started her business two years ago with a small metal cabinet in which she displayed items very professionally-- she is an expert in merchandise and sales because she studied this subject and has also had experience in a warehouse. This was where she met her husband. They both left the company and started working independently, which they are still doing today.

Maria started her miscellaneous business, and got a laptop computer and a printer because she also offers transcription, fax, and photocopying services. Her husband works full-time in the grocery store. Both businesses have been integral to the improvement of their income.

Maria's dream is to see her shop grow into a large store, with stock to supply the demand and needs of her customers in every season of the year. With this goal in mind, she is applying for her first loan from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, through Kiva. She will use the loan to purchase a photocopier and stationery to supply the demand of the students from the local schools. This is a season of high demand, when fathers are buying school supplies for their children's educational needs. 

Maria and her husband are working hard to build a promising future for their young child, so that when he is grown and looks upon the vastness of the sea he will find happiness in a beautiful setting where his parents forged his destiny.

loans.use: she will purchase a photocopier and stationery to satisfy the demand of the students from the local schools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase corn, gas and firewood

loans.name: Walter Milton

texts.es:
Walter, es agricultor y ganadero, tiene 37 años de edad, vive en su propia casa en compañía de una hermana y tres sobrinos, residen en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, él aprendió desde pequeño el oficio, junto a su padre trabajaban en el campo, el siembra maíz y chile, también atiende el ganado que es de su propiedad.
Walter desea  realizar una compra de ganado de repasto, también sembrar maíz y chile, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar el ganado y los materiales para realizar la siembra (abono, semilla, fertilizantes). Con la obtención de este préstamo  comprara los materiales para realizar el proceso de siembra y continuara en sus trabajos agrícolas.
 Su objetivo es cada día buscar los medios para realizar su trabajo y aumentar su ganado, ya que este trabajo es el que le da el sustento diario, Walter espera que con la presente inversión pueda tener una cosecha abundante.
texts.en:
Walter is a crop farmer and livestock farmer.  He is 37 years old and lives in his own home in El Transito, in San Miguel department, with a sister and three nephews / nieces.  Walter learned his trade as a young boy, working alongside his father in the fields.  Walter grows corn and chili peppers.  He also looks after his own cattle.

Walter would like to buy some non-dairy cattle and also sow corn and chili peppers.  He is requesting this loan to buy the cattle and the materials he needs to sow his crops (manure, seed and fertilizers).  He will use his loan to buy the materials he needs to sow his crops and thereby continue with his farming.

Walter's goal is to continue searching every day for the means to carry out his work and increase his number of cattle since this work puts food on the table.  Walter hopes that this investment will provide him with an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To buy non-dairy cattle and also supplies for sowing corn and chili peppers

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es: Zaida D. es una mujer de 57 años de edad que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena; en un barrio donde habitan trabajadores independientes,  comeciantes y  en general gente muy trabajadora,  Zaida se dedica a la venta de hayacas y pasteles desde hace cuatro años, cuando su esposo quedò desempleado  y llegaron a Cartagena con su madrè y un pequeño capital.  Asì fuè como empezaron  a vivir de la preparaciòn de estos  alimentos y el apoyo de una pequeña  pensiòn de su mamà; Zaida cuenta que con su negocio le ha ido muy bien, porque ha aumentado los ingresos del hogar, su esposo la ayuda y tambien viaja para vender mercancias  por eso se ausenta en largas temporadas y su negocio en ese momento es el sustento del hogar .  Esta actividad productivapracticada por Zaida, ha sido importante para todos porque  ha  logrado reunir un dinero para la cuota inicial de su vivienda  y ahora espera recibirla  para  adecuar su negocio allì, porque su gran desafio es lograr un mecado permanente el este barrio donde proximanete habitarà con su familia. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo,  con el comprarà arroz, aceite,verduras,carnes de cerdo y pollo, para aumentar su capital,  pues espera vender sus productos a tiendas y puntos de venta, con los cuales estaria impactando positivamente sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Zaida D. is a 57 year-old woman who lives in the city of Cartagena.  She lives in a neighborhood whose residents are self-employed workers, salespeople and generally very hard-working people.  Zaida's business is selling pies and 'hayaca' (a cornmeal dough with a savory filling wrapped in plantain leaves then boiled or steamed).  She has been in this business for four years, since her husband became unemployed and they came to Cartagena with her mother and a little bit of capital.

They started living on the income from her business preparing this food, with the support of a small pension of her mom's.  Zaida tells us that her business has done very well and her household income has increased.  Her husband helps her and also travels to sell goods.  For this reason, he is often absent for long periods of time and during these times her business supports the household.  Zaida's business activity has been important for all of them because she has managed to get together enough money for a down payment on a house.  She now hopes to receive her house so that she can set up her business there as a big challenge for her is managing to attract a permanent market in this neighborhood where she will soon live with her family.

This is Zaida's first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy rice, oil, vegetables, pork and chicken to increase her capital.  She hopes to sell her products to stores and other sales locations.  This would have a positive impact on her income.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, vegetables, pork and chicken

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica C. es una mujer de 26 años que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y su hijo de 3 años de edad (en la fotografia) allí tiene el negocio de vender mercancía variada, el cual inició cuando su padre al verla sin entusiasmos porque no encontraba trabajo, hizo un préstamo y  le regaló, la mitad de este para que iniciara un negocio. Así fue como angélica por sugerencia de un tío comenzó comprando juegos de sabanas, toallas, y ropa para niños que vendía en Ovejas, un pueblo en el departamento de Sucre, aprovechando que allí tiene muchos familiares los que se constituyeron en su primer mercado doméstico; su negocio muy pronto empezó a tener éxito y  esto la entusiasmó porque empezó a contribuir en los gastos del hogar hasta el punto que entre ella y su esposo lograron ahorrar y comprar su propia casa, en un ambiente de comunidad solidaria, donde hay muchos negocios.  Este es el primer financiamiento que hace con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el aspira a comprar en mayor volumen cosméticos, perfume y ropa, con esta inyección de capital de trabajo ampliará su mercado y responderá con rapidez y oportunidad a pedidos de sus nuevos clientes. Su meta es tener un local bien condicionado y confortable listo para despertar la atención y acción de compra a quien  a él se acerca.
texts.en:
Angélica C. is a 26 year-old mother who lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and her 3 year-old son (in the photo).  There she has a business selling a variety of merchandise.  She started in her business when her father, seeing her lacking enthusiasm because she couldn't find work, took out a loan and gave her half of it so that she could start a business.  This is how Angélica, on the suggestion of an uncle, began buying sheet sets, towels and children's clothes that she sold in Ovejas, a village in Sucre department.  She took advantage of the fact that she has a lot of family members there and they made up her first domestic market.  Her business very soon started to become successful and this encouraged her because she started contributing to her household expenses and reached the point where she and her husband were able to save and buy their own house in a close community where there are many businesses.

This is Angélica's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to use it to buy cosmetics, perfume and clothes in larger quantities.  With this injection of working capital, she will expand her market and be able to respond quickly and in a timely fashion to her new customers' orders.  Her goal is to have well-equipped and comfortable premises, ready to attract the attention and desire to buy of those who approach them.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, perfume and clothes in larger quantities

loans.name: Pulacayo Group

texts.es: El banco de Emprendimiento "PULACAYO " es uno grupo  nuevo de la agencia, se encuentra en su primer ciclo, el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco esta representadas por las siguientes socias: Presidenta la señora Matilde quien es la líder del grupo, tiene como negocio la venta de lencería de forma ambulante, ofrece sus productos en oficinas, donde ya tiene su clientela, es un apersona muy trabajadora, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería por mayor y así de esta manE. incrementar su capital de trabajo. Como TesorE. esta la Sra. Margarita que tiene el negocio de venta de Chocolates en la una de las calles céntricas de la ciudad, con el dinero del crédito desea comprar chocolates por caja para surtir sus productos. 	todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en muchos casos sacan a delante a sus familias solas con el único deseo de mejorar su calidad de vida, las socias están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Pulacayo Communal Bank is a new group with the agency, and it is in its first cycle.  It is comprised of responsible and hard-working people.  This group is represented by the following people.

Matilde, the president, is the leader of the group.  She has a business selling lingerie in an itinerant manner.  She sells her products in offices where she already has customers.  She is a very hard-working person.  She will use the loan to buy wholesale merchandise.  That way she will increase her working capital.

Margarita is the treasurer.  She has a business selling chocolates on one of the centrally located streets in the city.  She wishes to use the money from the loan to buy boxes of chocolates to stock up on her products.

All of the members are responsible and hard-working people.  In many cases, they get their families ahead by themselves.  Their only wish is to improve their quality of life.  The members are grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Inka Wasi” ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, provincia D. Puno y departamento D. Puno, tiene 59 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 04 hijos (2  independientes), la señora no tiene estudios.
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace un año, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta D. verduras y frutas.
Con éste crédito D. S/. 400.00 nuevos soles, comprará 100 unidades D. choclo, verduras y naranjas.  La señora trabaja sola pero recibe la ayuda D. su esposo quien es carpintero.
Su sueño para el futuro es agrandar el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la ganancia D. sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the "Inka Wasi" community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 59 years old, married, and has 4 children (2 of whom live independently).  She did not attend school.

Andrea has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling fruit and vegetables.

Andrea will use this loan for 400 Peruvian soles to buy 100 units of corn, vegetables and oranges.  She works alone but receives help from her husband who is a carpenter.  Her dream for the future is to expand her business and improve her income.  What she likes about her community bank is the money she makes on her savings.

loans.use: To buy 100 units of corn, vegetables and oranges

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Collabinas” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,  tiene 01 hijo.  Yesenia estudio educación secundaria. 
Hace un año que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Este nuevo crédito de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, lo piensa invertir en su nuevo negocio de alquiler de equipos de sonidos y servicios en general (eventos), comprará equipos para implementar su sala de grabaciones.  Ella trabaja junto con su esposo.
Su sueño es tener la sala de grabación bien implementada y así generar mejores ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la confianza entre las socias, la responsabilidad y la facilidad de préstamo con meses de gracia.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a member of the "Las Collabinas" community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 23 years-old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She studied at high school.

Yesenia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling groceries.

She plans to invest this loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles in her new business renting out sound systems and general services (events).  She will buy equipment to fit out her recording studio.  She works together with her husband.

Yesenia's dream is to have a well-equipped recording studio so that she can make more income.  What she likes about her community bank is the trust that exists between the members, the responsibility and the loan terms with grace periods.

loans.use: To buy equipment to fit out her recording studio

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: El Sr. José Luis G. C. él es trabajador por cuenta propia en el negocio del Servicio de Venta de Cal  tiene treinta   años  de dedicarse a esta actividad, su servicio lo brinda en el norte del país vendiendo la cal, tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado Para la Compra del producto cal  y al mismo tiempo le invierte a su medio de trasportar el producto su camion y así brindar un mejor servicio, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
José Luis G. C. works for himself in the business of selling lime.  He has had this business for 30 years.  He offers his service, selling lime, in the northern part of the country.  He has four school age children.

He has had five loans with CEPRODEL.  He has used each one to buy lime and to invest in his means of transportation, his truck.  That way he provides better service.  The loans from CEPRODEL have helped him immensely because he has improved the living conditions for himself and for his family.

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Martha Leonor

texts.es: La Sra. Martha Leonor N. ella es trabajadora activa del Colegio Público “Ernesto Che Guevara” de Villa el Carmen desempeñándose como Docente tiene  Veinte y tres  años  de trabajar para esta institución como docente de la educación secundaria, es casada actualmente  tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha Leonor N. is an active employee of the Ernesto Che Guevara Public School in Villa El Carmen. She has worked as a high school teacher at this institution for 23 years. Martha is married and currently has two school age children.

She has received seven loans from CEPRODEL and each one was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, and other items to expand and improve her home. The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great help because they have enabled her to improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, and other items for home improvements

loans.name: Sonia Narcisa

texts.es:
La Señorita. Sonia Domínguez es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, vive por el sector que lleva el mismo nombre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde 1999, nombrada así por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, su gente es muy amable, cordial y mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señorita. Sonia tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera y vive en compañía de su mamá con quien comparten los gastos del hogar, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.
 
Nuestra socia labora hace 10 años en una lubricadora (cambio de aceites de los vehículos) que es de su propiedad, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde y el tiempo que tiene libre le ayuda a su mamá en la picantería (restaurant).
