Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que   tiene muy buenas amigas con quien conversa y salen de la rutina en cada reunión, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir su lubricadora en la compra de aceites. Su meta es  tener un vehículo propio.
texts.en:
Sonia Domínguez is a member of the Yanuncay community bank.  She lives in the neighborhood of the same name which is located in the city of Cuenca.  This city has been a world heritage site since 1999.  It was named a world heritage site because of the architectural beauty of its historic center.  Its people are very kind and friendly and they maintain their culture and traditions.

Sonia is 44 years old, single, and lives with her mom.  Together they share the household expenses.  Sonia owns the house in which they live.  She has been working for 10 years in a 'lubricadora' (a place that carries out vehicle oil changes).  She owns the business.  She works from Monday to Friday, from 9.00am to 5.00pm.  In her spare time she helps her mom in her 'picantería' (restaurant).

This is Sonia's third loan as a member of her community bank.  She likes being a member of the bank because she has very good friends there who she chats to and they all get to break out of their routines when they attend the meetings.  Sonia will invest her loan money in her oil change business, buying oils.  Her goal is to own her own vehicle.

loans.use: To buy lubricants (oils)

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Felipe De Jesus G. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a pagar las protecciones de las puertas y ventabas, ya le elaboraron las protecciones esta en proceso de colocarlas. Ahora desea poner el piso de concreto al frente de su casa.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar la mejor, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que desea realizar a su vivienda. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una fábrica en el área de producción, ya que su esposa se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe como mesera de un restaurante.
Las personas que aparecen en la foto es su esposa la señora Alma Janeth Rojas y su pequeño hijo del señor Felipe De Jesus G., ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita, y fue  imposible atendernos.
texts.en:
Felipe De Jesus G. is grateful for your assistance with the previous loan.  It helped him to pay for protections for the doors and windows.  He has already made the protections, and he is in the process of installing them.  Now he wishes to lay down a concrete floor in the front of his house.

He is requesting the loan to be able to buy the material and pay the person who will make the improvement.  At this time Felipe does not have the money needed to make this improvement at his house.  He plans on repaying the loan with the salary he receives from his work in production at a factory.

His wife takes care of the family expenses with the salary she gets as a waitress in a restaurant.

The people in the photo are his wife, Alma Janeth Rojas, and his young son, Felipe De Jesus G..  He was at work on the day of the visit, and it was not possible for him to be there for the photo.

loans.use: Concrete floor at the front of his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: investment in his taco stand

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Don Ramiro A., llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla, a la casa de su hermana, procedente de El Carmen de Bolívar en el año de 1992.   En esta ciudad empezó a trabajar como ayudante de construcción  durante dos años y luego como ayudante de tiendas  durante 6 meses, para finalmente irse  a Bogotá a “probar suerte”   también trabajando en el oficio de la construcción. En el 1996 regresó a Barranquilla  donde de dedicó  al comercio de mercancías en pequeña escala a vecinos y familiares por encargo hasta el año 1997, cuando por una agresión quedó con invalidez permanente en sus piernas y en este año también contrajo matrimonio  y en la actualidad tiene  dos hijos que son mellos. 
Ramiro con su discapacidad es un hombre muy independiente, y proactivo,  realizó cursos de manualidades,  se especializó en la encuadernación, trabajó como instructor, mientras se dedicaba a  armar agendas y otros implementos para vender a los estudiantes universitarios del sector; también  tuvo  en administración las dos cafeterías de las que  recibía pagos  mensuales.  
Con el apoyo de un capital de su esposa  empezó a negociar  con toallas y sábanas que una amiga le conseguía a buenos precios para que vendiera. Con las utilidades   reunidas por  él y su esposa, compraron un carro de perros calientes, contrataron un trabajador pero no les dio el resultado previsto y fue en este momento en el que vieron disminuido su capital. Así que decidió trabajar él personalmente, y en dos semanas, duplicó la inversión pues le favoreció que tenia  buen punto comercial.  Así fue como  él mismo realizaba las compras de materiales en una salsamentaría   hacia donde diariamente se desplazaba en su silla de ruedas;  con las utilidades acumuladas compró otro carro para perros y un horno para pizzas y contrató un empleado en cada puesto, pero con mucho control y  él trabajaba  preparando las salsas en unión de su esposa, que le ayudaba algunas noches.
Con sus ahorros en una cuenta programada acudió a la  FMSD   para postularse y acceder a los programas  de vivienda de interés social con subsidio del gobierno,  donde salió beneficiado con un subsidio y obtuvo un micro crédito hipotecario para completar su cierre financiero y en el año 2004 recibió su casa la cual adecuó.
 Ramiro es un hombre ejemplar, la fuerza de voluntad que impone a sus actividades, no le dejan desfallecer y  por eso ha mantenido su negocio cada vez que ha enfrentado un desafío. Actualmente tiene un ayudante al que paga su salario por día trabajado.  En su negocio tiene un carro de perros, un horno para pizzas, 1 freidor 2 juegos de sillas con sus mesas y le genera un promedio de venta de $200.000 Cop  cada fin de semana con un incremento promedio del 50% en días festivos. De la FMSD. ha recibido créditos para adecuación de vivienda, organización empresarial y  crédito hipotecario ; sus objetivos están marcados por el crecimiento del negocio para lo cual requiere adquirir una plancha que le permita diversificar sus servicios para incluirle carnes, pollo asado y otros productos y este es justamente la razón por la cual está aplicando a un credikiva
texts.en:
Ramiro A. arrived at his sister's home, in the city of Barranquilla, from El Carmen de Bolívar, in 1992.  In this city he started working as a construction assistant.  He carried out this job for two years and then worked as a shop assistant for 6 months.  Finally, he went to Bogotá to 'try his luck', also working in the construction trade.  In 1996 he returned to Barranquilla where he sold merchandise on a small scale to neighbors and family members, selling to order.  He did this until 1997 when he was assaulted and left with a permanent disability in his legs.  That same year he got married and he currently has two children (twins).

Ramiro, in spite of his disability, is a very independent and proactive man.  He took courses in handicrafts, specialized in book binding and worked as an instructor while he made diaries and other implements to sell to local university students.  He also managed two cafeterias from which he received monthly payment.  With the support of some capital from his wife, he started selling towels and sheets that a female friend of his acquired at good prices for him to sell.  With the profits he and his wife made, they bought a hot dog cart and hired a worker for it but things didn't work out as they had planned and they saw their capital reduced.  Ramiro decided to work in the business himself and in two weeks he doubled his investment since he had a good sales location.  He bought his supplies himself in a delicatessen where he went daily in his wheelchair.  With the profits he made, he bought another hot dog cart and a pizza oven and hired an employee for each location but this time he took a lot of control of the business and he worked preparing the sauces together with his wife who helped him some nights.

With his savings in an account, he came to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for and access the social housing programs with government subsidy.  He was given a subsidy and obtained a micro housing loan to complete his financial closing.  In 2004 he received his house which he adapted.

Ramiro is an exemplary man.  He puts a lot of willpower into his activities and doesn't let them fail.  For this reason, he has held onto his business every time that he has faced a challenge.  He currently has a helper who he pays on a daily basis.  In his business, he has a hot dog cart, a pizza oven, one fryer and two sets of table and chairs.  He makes on average 200,000 Colombian pesos every weekend with an average increase of 50% on public holidays.  He has received loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to adapt his house, to organize his business and also a mortgage loan.  His goals are marked by the growth of his business for which he would like to acquire a grill.  This will allow him to diversify his services to include meats, grilled chicken and other products.  This is the reason he is applying for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To acquire a grill so that he can diversify his services to include meats, grilled chicken and other products

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Alejandra P. tiene ya mas de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, está es la fuente de ingresos para su familia.
Está solicitando un préstamo para liquidar el pago de un pedido que realizo ya que los clientes que le encargaron el producto ya no le quisieron pagar, y ella tiene que solventar el pago si no le cancelan el crédito. Para la señora Alejandro es importante conservar su contrato con la compañía de belleza solo con ese ingreso cuenta para salir a delante con su familia. 
Espero contar con su cooperación en este crédito ya que el anterior puedo compra la mercancía que necesita para entregarles a sus clientas lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Señora Alejandra P. has already spent four years selling beauty products from a catalog. She uses the income from this business to support her family.

Alejandra is seeking a loan to pay for an order that her customers asked her for but do not now wish to pay for the product. If she does not pay for it, the company will refuse to give her credit. It is important to Alejandra to maintain her contract with the beauty products company as without this income she will not be able to get ahead.

She hopes for our cooperation in obtaining this loan so that, as she did in the past, she can buy the merchandise that she needs for her customers as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Julián Adrián

texts.es:
El señor Julio Adrián D. H. O. es taxista y quiere comprar un nuevo vehiculo ya que el que tiene ahora  a estado fallando y desea brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Por lo cual esta solicitando nuestra ayuda para poder financiar la compra ya que el no cuenta con el dinero para comprarlo.
El señor Julián pagara el préstamo con sus ingresos como taxista.
texts.en:
Julio Adrián D. H. O. is a taxi driver and would like to buy a new vehicle since the one he owns now has mechanical problems and he would like to proviD. his customers with a better service.  He is requesting our help to finance his purchase since he doesn't have enough money to buy a new vehicle.

Julián will repay his loan with the income from his job as a taxi driver.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Walisuma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WALISUMA” iniciará el ciclo número uno en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, el día de la reunión estaba presente una señora que acompañaba a otra socia, por eso se ven 9 personas en la foto.   La asociación comunal “WALISUMA” está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  una presidenta, la señora Fidela.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: atención de una Pensión,  confección de enaguas, venta de ladrillos, venta de celulares, tejido de camas y venta de ladrillos.

La señora Fidela, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la A.C.  “WALI SUMA” un ciclo, pero antes estaba en otro grupo también por un ciclo, lo que significa que es cliente de Pro Mujer aproximadamente un año,  el mismo tiempo que tiene el negocio de venta de ladrillos.  La señora Fidela  se ha dedicado a la elaboración de ladrillos por que ha visto que es un negocio rentable, antes atendía una Pensión. El crédito de este ciclo será destinado a comprar aserrín y leña, combustible que la señora utiliza para cocer  los ladrillos.  La venta es realizada en la zona de Villa Exaltación, Av. Aroma.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  el crédito.
texts.en:
The 'Walisuma' community bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación regional office.  The group has eight members.  On the day of the meeting a woman was present who was accompanying one of the group members.  For this reason, there are 9 people in the photo

The 'Walisuma' community bank is managed by an executive committee led by a president, Fidela.  The bank's members have different businesses such as: working in a guest house, making traditional skirts, selling bricks, selling cell phones and knitting bedspreads.

Fidela, the bank's president, says that she has been a member of the 'Walisuma' community bank for one loan cycle but she was previously a member of another group for one loan cycle too.  This means that she has been a client of Pro Mujer for approximately one year.  This is the length of time she has had her brick selling business.  Fidela makes bricks because she saw that it is a profitable business.  She used to work in a guest house.  She will use this loan to buy sawdust and firewood, fuel that she uses to bake her bricks.  She makes her sales in Villa Exaltación district, Av. Aroma.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the loans.

loans.use: To buy sawdust and firewood

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es: La Sra. Ana Celia G. M. ella es trabajadora activa del Ministerio de Educación desempeñándose como Docente en el colegio “Ernesto Che Guevara” tiene doce  años de trabajar como docente de la educación para esta institución, actualmente tiene un  hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  Seis  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo esta solicitando para hacerle una mejora a su casa de habitación y para comprar unos medicamentos, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Celia G. M. works for the Ministry of Education as a teacher at Ernesto Che Guevara School.  She has been working as a teacher at this school for twelve years.  She currently has one school-age child.

Ana Celia has had six loans from CEPRODEL and has used each one to buy building supplies such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, etc. to extend and improve her home.  She is requesting this loan to make an improvement to her home and also to buy some medicines.  Her loans from CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly since they have enabled her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy building supplies: sand and cement.  To buy some medicines.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Liliana Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora. Liliana Cárdenas es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, vive por el sector que lleva el mismo nombre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde 1999, fue nombrada así por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, su gente es muy amable, cordial y mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Liliana tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 8 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es chofer profesional y labora conduciendo su propio taxi, con el sacrificio y trabajo de los dos han construído su casa propia.

La Señora. Liliana se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar ya que debe estar al cuidado de sus hijos, pero en su casa se dedica a trabajar en artesanías pintando adornos de cerámica para el hogar el cual vende a sus amigas y conocidas.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 2 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más adornos de cerámica para pintar. Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Liliana Cárdenas is a member of the Yanuncay communal bank, and lives in the neighborhood of the same name in Cuenca. This city was named a World Heritage Site in 1999, for the beautiful architecture of its historic center. The people are very friendly and polite and maintain their culture and traditions.

Liliana is 34 years old and married with 3 children, ages 14, 8 and 5. Her oldest son is in high school, and the younger children attend a primary school in the city. Her husband is a professional driver, and works driving his own taxi. With much work and sacrifice, they have built their own home.  

Lilian works to care for her home, and for her children, but at home she also devotes time to handicrafts, painting ceramic decorations for the home, which she sells to friends and associates. 

She has been a member of her communal bank for 2 years. The funds from her loan will be invested in the purchase of more ceramic decorations to be painted. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase ceramic decorations

loans.name: Ciro

texts.es: Ciro, tiene36 años de edad, natural del distrito de Quimbiri, es un hombre muy trabajador; esta casado con Alicia de 28 años y tienen 03 hijos; juntos viven en su propia casa, ubicada en la  comunidad de Roca anexo del Distrito Quimbiri. Ciro, es el sostén de su familia, desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar  en la chacra, es campesino y viene trabajando 16 años en sus propias tierras, espacio en donde cultiva café y hojas de coca; que son plantas oriundas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. En tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de jornaleros, quienes rápidamente extraen los frutos y hojas de coca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio que están situadas en la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos y sembrar plantas de cacao y plátano. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Agradece a la institución Prisma por concederle el crédito. Con los  1,500 nuevos soles solicitados,  contratará jornaleros para realizar el desmonte de malezas, asimismo comprará semillas de café para sembrar en su parcela.
texts.en:
Ciro is 36 years old, from the Quimbiri district. He is a very hardworking man. He is married to Alicia, who is 28, and they have 3 children. They all live together in their own home, located in the Roca community, in Quimbiri. Ciro is the breadwinner for his family; since childhood his parents raised him to work on the farm. He is a farmer, and has worked his own lands for 16 years, growing coffee and coca leaf, which are plants native to the Apurimac River valley.

During the harvest season, help from day laborers is necessary, as they quickly pick the beans and coca leaves. What he enjoys most about his work is harvesting, as he feels the months of hard work are reflected in the quality of the fruits.  The most difficult part is transporting his goods from the farm to the collection centers, which are located in San Francisco. Here the best prices are offered for his products. In the future, he would like to purchase more land in order to increase cultivation and grow cacao and banana. 

This is his first loan with MFP. He believes this contribution will help him greatly with his business. He is grateful to the Institucion Prisma for extending this credit to him. With the money requested, he will contract day laborers for clearing weeds, and purchase coffee seeds for planting.

loans.use: Purchase coffee seeds, and contract workers to assist with weeding

loans.name: Dora Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Dora es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, vive por el sector de  Don Bosco en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde 1999, fue nombrada así por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, su gente es muy amable, cordial y mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Dora tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 15, 14, 13, 11 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es chofer profesional y labora conduciendo un bus, viven en un departamento que es propio.
 
Doña Dora se dedica a la elaboración de globos de papel de china, esta actividad lo aprendió de sus padres quienes trabajaban en esta labor. Sus hijos le ayudan todos los días de domingo a domingo y sin un horario fijo, Son 20 años que se dedica a esto ya que comenzó desde muy pequeña.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y tiene muy buenas amigas, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales como: papel de china, carrizos, alambre, pegamento, etc. para la elaboración de los globos. Su meta es crecer en su negocio y llegar a tener un taller de costura.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of Yanuncay communal bank, and lives in the Don Bosco neighborhood in Cuenca. This city was named a World Heritage Site in 1999, for the beautiful architecture of its historic center. The people are very friendly and polite and maintain their culture and traditions.

Dora is 28 years old and married, with 4 children, ages 15, 14, 13 and 11. Her 3 older children are in high school, and her youngest son attends primary school in the city. Her husband is a professional driver, and works driving a bus. They live in their own apartment.

Dora works making tissue paper balloons, which she learned from her parents, who also did this work. Her children help her every day, from Sunday to Sunday, with no fixed schedule. She has been doing this work for 20 years, because she started very young.

This is her second loan through the communal bank, where she has many good friends. The money from this loan will be used to purchase materials such as tissue paper, wire, reeds, adhesive, etc., to make her balloons. Her goal is to expand her business, and one day have a tailor shop.

loans.use: Purchase tissue paper, reeds, wire, adhesive, etc.

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es: El Sr. Pablo Emilio G. C. él es trabajador activo de una empresa Contratista desempeñándose como Jardinero tiene cinco  años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL   uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este crédito lo está solicitando para sufragar unos gastos personales en su hogar, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Señor Pablo Emilio G. C. is an active employee of the company, Contratista.  He has worked there as a gardener for over five years.  He is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  He has had two credits with CEPRODEL.  One was for the purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, and gravel and the other was to expand and improve his house.  The credit that he is currently seeking will be used towards personal, household costs.  The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited him and his family in many ways and have improved their quality of life.

loans.use: Pay off personal, household costs.

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC AYLLU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Livia; ella tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa y productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y entre otros, ella envía a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado en forma independiente, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa y productos de primera necesidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa y productos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Ms. Livia is a member of the community bank SUMACAYLLU. The bank is located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco. She is 35 years old and lives with her partner and 2 children. She alternates her daily activities in a business selling clothes and also staples such as rice, sugar, milk and others. She works as an independent sending her products from Puerto Maldonado to the city. She wants to grow and improve her business. She is asking for a loan to buy clothing and wholesale products. She is happy to have the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: To buy clothes and wholesale products

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC AYLLU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Benito; el tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de queso, el socio vende queso en el mercado desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de queso.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar queso al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Mr. Benito is a member of the community bank “SUMACAYLLU”. He is 36 years old and lives with his partner and 5 children. His daily activities involve running a business selling cheese in the market from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm. He wants to grow and improve his business selling cheese. He is asking for a loan to buy cheese wholesale. He is happy to have the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy cheese wholesale

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Fernando B. le está haciendo falta pintarla principalmente y desea cambiar la fachada de la misma. Pretende realizar algunos maceteros de concreto algunas molduras que hagan ver una casa más bonita.
En este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar esos cambios a su vivienda, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo.
El planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos de su trabajo de técnico de eléctrico de la comisión de agua potable (municipio), es el ingreso que tiene para su familia, ya que tiene dos hijos adolescentes quienes están estudiando. 
La persona que aparece en la fotografía es su esposa la señora Lucían Martínez ella nos atendió el día que se realizó la visita a la vivienda de la familia B..
Están agradecidos por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual han realizado mejoras a su vivienda ya que son personas mayores de edad y es muy difícil que les otorguen préstamos.
texts.en:
The home of Mr. Fernando Baez is principally lacking paint and he would like to change the façade. He is trying to make some concrete pots to trim the yard so that the house has a nicer appearance. Currently, he does not have the money necessary to make such changes to his home and this is why he is requesting the loan. 

He plans to repay the loan with the income from his job as an electrical technician where he works for the municipal water commission. This is the income that he has for his family because he has two teenage children who are still in school. 

The person in the photograph is his wife, Lucia Martinez. She served us the day of our visit to the Baez family home. 

They are grateful for the cooperation in the previous loan, which they used to make improvements to their home, because they are elderly and find it difficult to obtain credit.

loans.use: to finish the roof and repair the exterior of the house.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC AYLLU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cristina; ella tiene 53 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 8 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. pensión restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella trabaja desD. las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. pensión restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para el restaurant.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en: Ms. Cristina is a member of the community bank “SUMACAYLLU”. The bank is located in Cusco district in Cusco province, Cusco department. She is 53 years old and is married with 8 children. She runs a restaurant. She prepares breakfast, lunch and dinner. She works between 7:00am and 7:00pm. It is with this business that she supports her children.  She would like to grow and improve the restaurant. She is asking for a loan to buy products for the restaurant. She is happy to have the loan and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy products for a restaurant

loans.name: María Geovana

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocida por su cultura tradicional por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal  Las Piedras.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 24 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de cuatro y un años de edad. El marido trabaja en una fábrica de madera.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Lleva cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que más vende son los perfumes.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal hace ya ocho ciclos y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que ofrece la institución. Sus sueños son terminar su casa que aun la tiene inconclusa.
texts.en:
In a neighborhood known as "Las Piedras," in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo, the communal bank "Las Piedras" meets every 15 days.  Portoviejo is known for its cultural traditions, for the happiness of its people, and its San Pedro and San Pablo festivals.

Here we find Maria, who is 24 years old and who is in a common-law marriage from which she has 2 children, aged 4 and 1.  Her husband works in a wood factory.

She is a housewife who, in order to generate her own income, sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women.)  She works 3 days a week; she sells her products on credit and collects every week or every 15 days, according to her customers' wishes.  She has been doing this work for 5 years.  She receives her products in her house, and what she sells most are the perfumes.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and other products.  She has been with her communal bank from the start, for 8 loan cycles, and she likes it because of the additional benefits that the institution offers.  She dreams of finishing her house, which is still incomplete.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC AYLLU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fanny; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras y animales menores como gallinas y cuyes, la socia tiene un pequeño terreno de cultivo, la socia quiere construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Sumac Ayllu” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.

The member is Fanny. She is 38 years old, lives with her partner, and has 3 children. She alternates her regular daily activities with her business selling vegetables and small animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs. She has a small piece of crop land, and she wants to build a house. She is requesting the loan to buy construction materials.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Túpac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad y 4 hijos.
Agustina está casada y estudió la  primaria completa. 
Su actividad consiste en la venta de verduras en general, productos que compra desde la ciudad de Arequipa, su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Arequipa en las construcciones como operario. Ella está empezando a trabajar con Manuela Ramos recientemente, para empezar solicitará un préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles,  dinero que invertirá en su negocio, pues con esto comprará diferentes productos como cebolla, zanahoria y otros.
Su sueño es  mejorar en su negocio y sobre todo aumentar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la ganancia generada por los ahorros, es lo que más le impactó por primera vez.
texts.en:
Agustina is a member of the communal bank, Túpac Amaru, which is located in the Yunguyo District and Province, in the Department of Puno.  She is 36 years old and has 4 children.  She is married and has completed her primary studies.  

For a living, she sells vegetables, which she purchases from the city of Arequipa, where her husband works as a construction operator.  Recently, she began working with Manuela Ramos.  In order to start, she is asking for a loan of 500 soles, money that she will invest in her business.  With this loan, she will purchase a variety of products, such as onions, carrots, etc.  Her dream is to improve her business and above all, increase her earnings.  What she loves most about her communal bank is the interest that she earns from their savings.  This has had an enormous impact on her.

loans.use: To purchase different products such as onions, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC AYLLU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y venta de útiles escolares, la socia atiende desde las 8.00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y venta de útiles escolares. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, libros y borradores.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the communal bank, “SUMAC AYLLU”, which is located in the Cusco District and Province, in the Department of Cusco.

She is 32 years old and has 2 children.  She alternates her time between working in her grocery business and selling school supplies.  She works from 8am until 7pm.  She has been able to provide for her children through these businesses.  She would like to expand and improve her grocery shop and school supplies business.  She is seeking a loan in order to purchase more merchandise, such as notebooks, pens, books, and erasers.

Luz Marina is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase school supplies, such as notebooks, pens, books, and erasers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Fanny Miryan

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC AYLLU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fanny Miryan; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como contadora, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento y yeso.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fanny Miryan is a member of the communal bank “SUMAC AYLLU”, which is located in the Cusco District and Province, in the Department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, single, and has one child.  She works as an accountant every day, from 8am until 7pm.  Through this job, she has been able to provide a better life for her son.  The reason for her loan is because she would like to construct her home.  She plans to use it to purchase construction materials, such as cement and plaster. 

She is happy about the loan and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials, such as cement and plaster.

loans.name: Fresia María

texts.es: La Sra. Fresia María S. A. ella es trabajadora activa de la Empresa  Ministerio de Educación desempeñándose como Docente de Educación  Primaria  tiene veinte y seis  años  de trabajar para esta institución, tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para implementar un pequeño negocio en su hogar el cual es el engorde y destace de cerdo, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Fresia María S. A. is an active employee of the Ministry of Education, where she has worked as an elementary school teacher for 26 years. She has one child who is in school. Fresia has received two loans from CEPRODEL and each one was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, and other items so that she could improve her home.

This loan she is requesting will be used to start a small business in her home where she can fatten and butcher pigs. The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit since they have enabled her to improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Start a home-based business fattening & butchering pigs

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC AYLLU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Emilio; el tiene 49 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras y también es maestro de construccion, el negocio de venta de verduras lo realiza su esposa y de esta manera juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras como cebollas, tomates, zapallos entre otras verduras.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "SUMAC AYLLU". This group resides in the district of Cusco, near the Cusco providence and department. 

Mr. Emilio is 49 years old, married and has 3 children. He alternates his daily activities between vegetable sales and construction. His wife works in the business selling vegetables and so together they can support their children. He wants to expand his business selling vegetables. He is requesting a loan to buy vegetables such as: onions, tomatoes, pumpkins, among others. 

He is happy because of his loan and promises to comply with the payments on time.

loans.use: This member is requesting a loan to buy vegetables such as: onions and pumpkins, among others.

loans.name: Baleria

texts.es:
Baleria tiene 47 años y reside junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Viven en casa propia en la zona rural del distrito Tambogrande, que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace seis años, Baleria se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino en un corral en su propio domicilio. Cuando sus ovinos ya han alcanzado un tamaño y peso ideal, ella se los ofrece en venta a su clientela establecida y fidelizada en el mercado local. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre y conoce a la perfección este rubro. 

Baleria desea usar el préstamo para arreglar y mantener su corral. También desea comprar alimentos balanceados para su ganado para crecerlos a un buen nivel de desarrollo y continuar a venderlos en el mercado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Baleria is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children. They have their own house in the rural district of Tambogrande, located in the province of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Baleria has been raising sheep at her home for six years. When her sheep have grown to the ideal size and weight she sells them to her faithful customers in the local market. She learned this trade from her father and she is an expert in this field.

Baleria wants to use the loan to fix and maintain her sheep pen. She also desires to buy food for her livestock to grow them to a good size and to sell them at the market. For this reason she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To buy food for her livestock

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee, de 31 años,  es una mujer muy decidida y segura. Vive en casa de sus suegros, con su esposo Miguel que tiene 30 años,  y sus hijos Fabricio de 6, Pedro de  8, y Angeline de 3 años. Hace más de 2 años Haydee, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y para lograrlo recorre las calles de su distrito visitando sus familiares y amistades, quienes le compran al momento ó le hacen pedidos de sus catálogos, de esta manera capta clientes, que hoy la prefieren, ya que cada 18 días se abastece de más productos. Asimismo, administra  el alquiler de su carro, a un joven de su confianza de hace un año y le va muy bien. Haydee, se siente muy contenta de realizar sus dos labores, y esta segura que trabajando con mucho empeño mas la ayuda de todos ustedes ella podrá instalar una librería en casa de su madre, para que pueda administrarlo. Por ahora seguirá apoyando a su esposo, para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, dice “estar agradecido con la ayuda que recibió y que recibirá en esta oportunidad; y que no desconfíen, ya que pagará puntualmente sus cuotas”. Haydee compra mercaderías necesarias cada 18 días, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará más productos de belleza  para abastecer sus pedidos que tiene.
texts.en: Haydee, age 31, is a very dedicated and confident woman. She lives in her in-laws' home with her husband, Miguel, age 30, and her children Fabricio, age 6, Pedro, age 8, and Angeline, age 3. For over 2 years, Haydee has been selling beauty products for a living. In order to do so, she walks around the streets of her district, visiting her family and friends, who make purchases on the spot or order products from catalogs. This is how she gains customers, who prefer her because she gets more products every 18 days. She has also been renting out her car to a trustworthy young man for a year, and this has been working out for her. Haydee feels happy to have the two businesses, and she is sure that by working hard and with your help, she will be able to set up a bookstore in her mother's home so that she can manage it. For now, she will continue helping out her husband so that they can cover both the household and educational expenses. This is her second loan with MFP, and she states that she is grateful for the help that she has received and will receive at this time. She says not to mistrust her because she will make her repayments on time. Haydee purchases the necessary merchandise every 18 days, which is why she is requesting this loan to purchase more beauty products to fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Gerardo Antonio B. L. él es trabajador activo de la Empresa “CEMEX” desempeñándose como obrero tiene  cuatro   años de trabajar para esta institución, es casado actualmente tiene dos hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como, Arena, Cemento, piedra, piedrín etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Sr. Gerardo Antonio B. L. is an active employee of the CEMEX Company where he has worked as a laborer for four years.  He is married and currently has two children who are in school.  Gerardo has received two loans from CEPRODEL and each one was used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, stone, gravel, and other items so that he could expand and improve his home.  The loans from CEPRODEL have been a great benefit since they have enabled him to improve the living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan tiene 67 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en su casa propia en la parte rural del caserío Cruceta en Tambogrande, una zona agrícola ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace seis años, se dedica al cultivo de frutas, nueces  y plantas. Tiene un pequeno terreno agrícola situado en su caserío. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección este rubro. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en la zona. 

Juan desea usar el préstamo para comprar pesticidas y fertilizantes para mantener su cultivo de limón. De este modo, puede mejorar la producción de su fruta, venderlas a buen precio en el mercado local y así percibir mayores ingresos. Para lograr su objetivo, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juan is a 67-year-old single man with no children. He lives in his own house in a rural area of the Cruceta hamlet in Tambogrande, an agricultural zone located in the Piura province, in the region by the same name, over 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For six years, he has been growing fruits, nuts, and plants for a living. He has a small crop field situated in the hamlet. He learned this skill from his father, which means he knows about agriculture to a tee. He has an already established client base in the area.

Juan would like to use this loan to purchase pesticides and fertilizer for his lime cultivation, thus improving fruit production, selling them at the local market at a good price, and earning bigger profits. In order to achieve this goal, he sees the need to request a 1,000.00 PEN loan.

loans.use: Purchase pesticides and fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS” iniciará el ciclo número catorce en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes,  un varón y siete señoras.   La asociación comunal “Estrellas” está dirigida por una mesa directiva , a la cabeza la presidenta, la señora Juana, como tesorera la señora Adela y como secretaria de actas, la señora Olimpia.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: venta de ropa, venta de abarrotes, comerciante de papa, venta de chamarras, ropa de varón (Ternos), chofer de Trufi, venta de verduras, comercial – ferretería y venta de papa y chuño.

La señora Juana, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte de la A.C.  “Estrellas” desde hace 3 años.  La señora Juana tiene 40 años edad, está casada, tiene 5 hijos,  el negocio  que desempeña actualmente es la venta de verduras, actividad que realiza en la Feria 16 de Julio y la Feria de la Ex - tranca, por ahora trabaja sola.
El crédito de este ciclo será destinado a la compra de mercadería. 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  el crédito.
texts.en:
The Estrellas Group will start its 14th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the central hub of Panamericana. The group is comprised of eight members: one man and seven women. The Estrellas Group has a board of directors; the president is Ms. Juana, the treasurer is Ms. Adela, and the secretary is Ms. Olimpia. The group members partake in several types of businesses: clothing sales, general store, potato sales, jacket sales, menswear (suits), minibus driver, vegetable sales, hardware sales, and potato and freeze-dried potato sales.

Ms. Juana, president of the microfinance group, indicates that she has been a part of the Estrellas Group for 3 years. She is a 40-year-old married mother of five. She currently sells vegetables for a living in the 16 de Julio Market, and in the Ex-tranca Market. For now, she works alone.

This loan will be used to purchase merchandise.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she stated that she likes the loans.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
Dionicia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Túpac Amaru”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene un hijo.  Ella pudo estudiar la primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace doce años,  su  primer préstamo fue  de      S/ 300.00 nuevo soles,  dinero que invirtió en su negocio anterior que  consistía en el engorde de ganados menores como chanchos y ovejas; actualmente se dedica a la venta de frutas, gelatinas y paletas de hielo en la ciudad de Tacna.
Con éste préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará una congeladora para la producción de paletas de hielo y gelatinas; el resto del dinero lo utilizará para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio.
Su sueño es tener una tienda en Tacna. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es compartir con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Dionicia is a member of the Túpac Amaru Microfinance Group, located in the Yunguyo district of the province by the same name, department of Puno. She is a 36-year-old married mother of one. She was able to complete elementary school.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN, which she invested in her previous business: livestock farming, specifically pigs and sheep. She currently sells fruits, gelatin, and ice cream bars in the city of Tacna.

With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase a freezer for her ice cream and gelatin production. She will use the rest of the money to increase merchandise for her business.

Her dream is to open a store in Tacna. What she most likes about her microfinance group is sharing with her fellow group members.

loans.use: Purchase freezer for ice cream bar production

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica, es una mujer sensata y trabajadora, tiene 35 años. Vive en compañía de su esposo Robert  y sus dos hijos, Varia de 10 y Roberto de 4 años, en su casa propia y lo que más desean es salir adelante. Hace 4 años, esta emprendedora mujer apostó en instalar su bodega de productos perecibles; luego que ganara experiencia trabajando 3 años en la venta de desayunos. Desde entonces, realiza dos negocios y le va muy bien, asimismo su esposo la ayuda en la atención de su bodega, mientras llega de su otro negocio. Así nunca dejan de percibir rentas, pero le gusta  lo que hace,  y esta convencida que trabajando arduamente y de manera responsable no descuida la rentabilidad de su negocio, ya que con esas ganancias, mas el sueldo de su esposo y  los créditos anteriores, puede construir su casa, en la que hoy en día  funciona su tienda. En la actualidad,  se ha propuesto  seguir construyendo su casa, pero ahora el segundo piso y  de ese modo piensa mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos. Este es el 13avo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una incansable trabajadora, por ello dice “que confíen en ella y estén seguros que pagará todas sus cuotas como lo viene haciendo hasta hoy en día ”. Mónica compra mercadería cada fin de semana para su negocio, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos comestibles para abastecer más su bodega.
texts.en: Monica is a sensible and hardworking woman who is 35 years old. She lives with her husband, Robert, and their two children: Varia, age 10, and Roberto, age 4. They own a home, and what they wish for the most is to get ahead in life. Four years ago, after working 3 years and gaining experience in selling breakfast, this enterprising woman took a risk and opened a general store. Since then, she has managed both businesses, and they have prospered. Her husband helps attend to the general store while she runs the other business. Thus, they never stop earning money. She likes doing what she does, and she is convinced that hard work and responsibility will keep her businesses profitable because with her earnings, her husband's income, and her previous loans,  she can build a house that today functions as her store. Currently, her aim is to keep building the second floor of her house, thus improving her family's quality of life. This is her 13th loan with MFP, where she is a tireless worker, which is why she says to trust in her and be sure that she will make her repayments as she has been doing up to now. Monica purchases merchandise for her business every weekend. With this loan that she is requesting, she will purchase foodstuffs in order to restock her general store.

loans.use: Purchase goods for general store

loans.name: Danit Celia

texts.es:
Danit tiene 30 años y reside junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Viven un su casa propia en el caserío Palominos en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace dos años, Danit trabaja como peluquera y también se dedica a la costura de ropa como vestidos y blusas. Ella confecciona estas prendas para luego vendérselas a sus clientes ya establecidas en la zona. Esta actividad provee mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y se vale de ella para ayudar al mantenimiento de su economía diaria.

Danit desea ampliar su negocio por adquirir materiales como utensilios de peluquería y productos de belleza. También desea usar el dinero para el mantenimiento de una máquina de  coser. Con estas adiciones, Danit podrá seguir creciendo su negocio poco a poco y obtener mayores ingresos. Su mayor anhelo sigue siendo sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida. Para lograr su objetivo, he creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternative un crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Danit is a 30-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children. They own their house in the Palominos hamlet of the Tambogrande district, an agricultural area situated in the Piura province of the region by the same name, over four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For two years, Danit has been working as a hairdresser. She also makes clothing, such as blouses and dresses, for a living. She makes the clothes and sells them to her established customers in the area. This business provides much financial help for the household, and she manages to cover her daily expenses on her own.

Danit would like to expand her business and obtain materials like styling tools and beauty products. She would also like to use the money for sewing machine maintenance. With these additions, Danit will be able to make her business grow little by little, thus obtaining bigger profits. Her greatest wish is to help her family get ahead, and to improve their quality of life. In order to achieve her goal, she sees the need to request a 1,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase styling tools and beauty products

loans.name: Rositas Del Ocho Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Rositas del Ocho, eligieron este nombre porque las señoras viven en el barrio ocho y les gustan las rosas D. castilla. Este grupo está ubicado en el estado D. México. La comunidad se caracteriza  porque, la mayoría D. los habitantes se dedican a la crianza  D. borregos. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes. Elizabeth López S. es integrante del grupo y tiene 27 años, estudió hasta la preparatoria,  es ama D. casa y comerciante, comenta que su negocio es parte fundamental para salir adelante y contribuye con los gastos D. su familia; ella tiene dos hijos varones. La señora Elizabeth  se dedica a la venta D. tacos D. carnitas D. cerdo que venD. los días lunes en el tianguis, ella lleva 8 años con el negocio. Su dedicación ha permitido que sus clientes la prefieran por su buen servicio y trato que les brinda a los clientes. Este préstamo le ayudará a comprar alimento para los cerdos que cría, así como condimentos que utiliza para la preparación D. las carnitas. Ella sueña que algún día pueda tener un establecimiento más granD. para poder satisfacer la demanda D. su producto.
texts.en:
This group is called “Rositas del Ocho” (The Little Roses of the Eight). The members chose this name because these ladies are from neighborhood #8 and enjoy Damask roses (otherwise known as roses of Castille). Most of the residents raise sheep. This group consists of eleven members.

Elizabeth López S. is one of the members of this group. She is 27 years old and completed her education through the preparatory level. Elizabeth is a housewife and merchant and says that her business is fundamental to her ability to move forward and contribute to her family’s expenses. She has two sons. Sra. Elizabeth sells roasted pork tacos at the flea market every Monday. She has been in this business for eight years. Her dedication has resulted in her customers choosing her because of the good service she provides. This loan will help her buy feed for the pigs that she raises, as well as condiments she uses for preparing pork tacos. She dreams of someday having a larger establishment so that she can satisfy the demand for her product.

loans.use: Purchase pig feed & condiments for preparing pork tacos

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Su nombre es sinónimo de fortaleza. Ana, es madre soltera, que se dedicó al cuidado de sus 2 hijos; ahora vive junto a su hija Claudia, de 15 años, en su casa propia, ubicada en La Merced (selva central peruana). Hace más de 10 años se ha dedicado en la distribución de cerveza en la ciudad de Pichanaki, con el tiempo gracias a la constancia y dedicación, se convirtió en una de las responsables de esta actividad, logrando percibir un monto mensual de S/. 1500 nuevos soles. Pero sus aspiraciones, le hicieron abrir hace 3 años un pequeño quiosco en su ciudad natal, donde vende toda variedad de bebidas, como también productos de primera necesidad. Ahora quiere convertir su negocio en una distribuidora de cerveza. “No hay nada como tener tu propio negocio”, afirma. Como ya es conocedora del trabajo está segura que logrará su objetivo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las optimistas”, y este es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde se siente realizada por los logros que está obteniendo. Ana dará el primer paso para la creación de la distribuidora, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar 60 cajas de cerveza, para así poder comenzar la venta al por mayor.
texts.en: Her name is synonymous with strength. Ana is a single mother who used to look after her two children. She now lives with her daughter, Claudia, who is 15, in her house, located in La Merced (Central Peruvian jungle). For over 10 years, she has distributed beer in the city of Pichanaki. Over time, thanks to her perseverance and dedication, she has become one of the most important figures in the business, managing to rake in 1,500.00 PEN monthly. Three years ago, her aspirations drove her to open a small kiosk in her hometown in which she sells a variety of beverages, as well as basic need items. She now wants to convert her business into a beer distribution company. "There is nothing like having your own business," she states. Since she is already familiar with the business, she is sure that she will reach her objective. She is a member of the Las Optimistas microfinance group, and this is her sixth loan with MFP, where she feels fulfilled because of her accomplishments. Ana will take the first step in creating the distribution company, which is why she plans to purchase 60 cases of beer so that she can start selling beer wholesale.

loans.use: Purchase 60 cases of beer

loans.name: Manuel Higinio

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 46 años, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en una casa de material adobe con calamina. Viven en el caserío de Sequion, ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Sus hijos estudian en el colegio del mismo caserío.

Desde hace más de ochos meses, Manuel se dedica al negocio de vender guano. Con su esfuerzo y sus ahorros, compró una motocarguera de su propiedad en donde carga el guano y lo distribuye a los distintos potreros que solicitan el producto. Adicionalmente, cuenta con unas cabezas de ganado vacuno. Apoyan a sus hijos y su esposa con estos trabajos.

Manual desea invertir capital en su negocio para generar una mayor rentabilidad y obtener una mejor calidad de vida. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2,000 nuevos soles. Manuel tiene buenas referencias personales que dicen que siempre se ha despeñado como una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 46-year-old married man who lives with his wife and three children in an adobe house with corrugated metal roofing. They live in the Sequion hamlet, located in the district of Olmos, a highly commercial agricultural area in the Lambayeque province, over an-hour-and-a-half from the city of Chiclayo. His children study at a local school.

For over eight months, Manuel has been selling guano for a living. With his efforts and savings, he purchased a cargo tricycle in which he hauls the guano and distributes it to the different fields that need the product.

Additionally, he owns livestock. He supports his wife and children with these two jobs.

Manuel would like to invest capital in his business in order to make it more profitable and to obtain a better quality of life. For this reason, he sees the need to request a 2,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa. Manuel has good personal references who state that he has always behaved like a responsible person.

loans.use: Purchase more material to expand his business

loans.name: Rocio Elena

texts.es: La señora Rocío Elena V. M. se dedica a la venta de celulares hace tres años aproximadamente su puesto se encuentra ubicado en el centro comercial Miguel Grau calle Cajamarca Ica el cual es alquilado, La solicitante vive en casa familiar conjuntamente con sus padres y su menor hija quién se encuentra en edad escolar. Está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de mercadería. Se propone otorgarle el crédito por que presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en: Ms. Rocío Elena V. M. has been selling cellular phones for a living for about three years. She rents a stand that is located at the Miguel Grau shopping center on Cajamarca Ica Street. The applicant lives in a home with her parents and her school age daughter. She is requesting this loan so that she can purchase merchandise. She qualifies to receive this loan because she has good personal and work references.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Frank Walter

texts.es:
Frank tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres y hermanos en el distrito de Reque, una zona ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque..

Cuenta con una pequeña bodega  en su domicilio donde vende productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, además cigarros, golosinas, y bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas. También alquila mesas de villar y otros juegos para personal de un club deportivo cultural.

Frank desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles.

 Frank es muy trabajador y tiene muy buenas referencias de personas en la comunidad que lo conocen.
texts.en:
Frank is a 29-year-old single man who lives with his parents and siblings in the Reque district, an area that is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

He runs a small general store from home in which he sells basic need items, as well as cigarettes, candy, and drinks like beer and soda. He also rents out pool tables and other games to personnel at a sports club.

Frank would like to expand his business by purchasing more merchandise so that he can meet customer demand. For this reason, he would like to request a 500.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

Frank is a very hard-working man with great references from people who know him in the community.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Jesus Pan De Vida Group

texts.es: “Jesús Pan De Vida”, esta alcancía está conformada por 9 personas muy responsables y tienen un buen tiempo trabajando unidos como grupo siguen integrando nuevas socias ya que les va muy bien en sus respectivos negocios y están felices con el préstamo que les brinda EDAPROSPO. Janet es una nueva integrante de esta alcancía ella tiene 40 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos de 17, 15 y 3 años de edad, ella se dedica a realizar trabajos de manualidades como: decoración con globos, pinturas, tejidos de macramé (carteras), teje para vender y también pedidos, además de realizar todas estas actividades Janet trabaja como cocinera en un club campestre pero solo sábados y domingos, los ingresos de todas estas labores le ayudan a cubrir, los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos ella solicitó el préstamo para completar el monto que le falta para  comprar una máQ. para acabados de carteras en cuero. A Janet le gustaría poner un restaurante- café. En la fotografía podemos apreciar  a 8 integrantes del grupo dos de ellos acompañados de sus hijos y la señora María Luz C. López faltó por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en: “Jesús Pan De Vida” (Jesus, Bread of Life Group) is made up of 9 very responsible people who have a good time working together as a group.  They keep involving new members as people see how well their own businesses are going and how happy they are with the loan from EDAPROSPO.  Janet is a new member of this group.  She is 40 years old, is a single mom, and has three children who are 17, 15, and 3 years old.  She works making crafts like balloon decorations, paintings, and woven bags.  She knits things to sell and also takes orders.  In addition to all these activities, Janet works as a cook at a country club on Saturdays and Sundays.  Her earnings from all these jobs help to cover the expenses of the home and of her children.  She is asking for a loan to be able to buy a machine for finishing leather wallets.  Janet would like to open her own restaurant.  The photo is of 8 of the group members with their children.  Mrs. María Luz C. López had to work and could not be present for the picture.

loans.use: To buy a leather-wallet finishing machine

loans.name: Tiacaque Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Tiacaque, este nombre fue elegido porque las señoras viven en la comunidad de  Tiacaque que significa: lugar donde nace agua entre peñascos. Está ubicado en ixtlahuaca, México y se caracteriza por tener una presa de agua y que la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la crianza de borregos. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes y es la segunda vez que solicitan un crédito. Una de las integrantes del grupo se llama Rosario A. C. Tiene 33 años y estudió hasta la secundaria, es ama de casa y comerciante, comenta que su negocio es muy importante ya que contribuye con los gastos de su familia, ella tiene dos hijos varones y una hija. Rosario se dedica a la crianza de borregos desde hace 3 años, ella pide el prestamos para fortalecer su negocio. Su dedicación ha permitido que sus animales sean reconocidos por los clientes ya que la carne es de buena calidad. El crédito le ayudará a comprar más alimento para sus borregos. Ella sueña que algún día pueda incrementar el número de sus animales y así ofrecerles a sus hijos una carrera profesional. Observaciones, la persona que no se ve bien se llama María Cristina.
texts.en:
This group is called Tiacaque, and the name was chosen because the women live in the community of Tiacaque which means: the place where the water  comes forth between the crags. It is located in Ixtlahuaca, México and is characterized by having a dam. The majority of the inhabitants raise lambs. 

The group is made up of twelve memebers and it is the second time they are requesting a loan. One of the members of the group is called Rosario A. C. She is 33 years old and has an eighth grade education. She is a housewife and merchant. She says that her business is very important because it contributes to her family's expenses. She has two sons and one daughter. Rosario has been raising lambs for three years and is requesting the loan to strengthen her business. Her dedication has allowed her to be recognized by her customers for having high quality meat. The loan will help her buy food for the animals. She dreams of one day being able to increase the number of animals she has and in this way offer her children a professional career.

*Note: The person that cannot be seen very well in the photo is called María Cristina.

loans.use: Raising lambs.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth O. is from the village of Deboloc Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old. Janeth is married and has 3 infant children. To make a living, Janeth owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee, milk, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Janeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and fund working capital for her business.

Janeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Janeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Bilegtbaatar

texts.en:
Bilegtbaatar, 25, is married and lives with his wife and two-year-old child in Hentiy province in Mongolia. His wife works at a telephone company where she is paid 300,000 MNT monthly.  Their child attends kindergarten. 

Bilegtbaatar began a taxi service business in 2008 with his old car in the province center where he lives. Then in 2010, he bought another car, which he currently uses to operate his taxi service. Now, he has regular customers and his business has become more stable. His daily net income is 15,000 to 20,000 MNT, from which he spends 8000 MNT for gas. 

Bilegtbaatar is a hardworking, honest, and polite person who says, "My car is getting outdated and always breaks down. I spend money for spare parts and maintenance fees. I am trying to save more money to buy a new car so that I can save money."

Bilegtbaatar is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to add to the money he has saved up to buy a  new car.

loans.use: To buy new car to taxi service

loans.name: Baldandorj

texts.en:
Baldandorj, 29, is single and lives with his two sisters in Hentiy province in Mongolia. They live in a ger, Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard for the past two years. His two elder sisters operate a meat trading business, while Baldandorj operates a taxi business which he started in 2010. 

Baldandorj drives a used car as a taxi between Hentiy and Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. In addition to this, he also operates a delivery service. His average monthly income is 840,000 MNT, which is spent on supporting his family. 

Baldandorj is a hardworking, honest and kind man who says, "I bought an old car from someone which I use for my transportation service. In the future, I would like to buy a new car so that I could save some money on gas and spare parts".  

Baldandorj is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his car and to purchase more meat for his sisters to sell at their stall.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Siilegmaa

texts.en:
Siilegmaa, 40, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Hentiy province in Mongolia. Her husband drives a taxi and her two children attend a local secondary school. They live in a regular house and have a decent standard of living. 

Siilegmaa began a clothing trading business in 2006. In the beginning, she sold clothing at a trading center, but now she rents a stall at a local outdoor market. Her daily net income is 60,000-80,000 MNT, which goes up to 100,000-120,000 during special days like public holidays. Her husband's daily net income is 10,000 to 15,000 MNT. Both of them have regular customers and now they have two vehicles, a truck and a car. 

Siilegmaa's current working capital is 2,500,000 MNT and she wants to expand it in order to buy an apartment.  She is a hardworking and honest person. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothing for her business and buy spare parts for her husband's car.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal Expenses

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya, 46, is married and lives with her husband, son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land on the outskirts of the city. Her daughter studies at a university while both her husband and son work. 

Enhtuya began operating a drugstore in 2002. She rents a room in a private hospital for her pharmacy. She now has an official state certificate for her business which proves that her business is registered  and is allowed to operate legally.  She purchases medicine from large drug producers to sell in her drugstore.  She employs a salesperson and a cleaning person.

Enhtuya is a hardworking and active person who says, "I am planning to enlarge my store and make some improvements, as the drugstores and pharmacies are being examined by the Government strictly". She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to expand her product line and enlarge her drugstore.

loans.use: To expand product line

loans.name: Hurelbaatar

texts.en:
Hurelbaatar, 49, is married and lives with his wife and four children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They used to live in someone's backyard but now own their own land. Hurelbaatar started operating a carpentry business in 1990. He makes stoves for houses and works for a construction company in the summer time.

Hurelbaatar is the only person who is supporting the family needs. His wife is unemployed and one of his children attends a local secondary school. His two older sons graduated from a vocational school as carpenters but both of them are currently unemployed. 

He is a modest and hardworking person who says, "I would like to open my own workshop and provide jobs for my sons. Operating a workshop at the market would be good because it is a crowded place and it's easy to get custom orders which would allow us to expand our business and increase the family income." Hurelbaatar is requesting a loan of 550,000 MNT to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Javhlan

texts.en:
Javhlan, 29, is married and lives with her husband and daughter in the Hentii province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Javhlan's daughter goes to a local primary school.
