loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is a housewife and lives with her husband and 5 children in Kalar Abadi, a small housing development in Gujranwala. Gujranwala is located in the Punjab, an area famous for its industries and rice crops.

Shameem  stays at home and takes care of her children and does her household responsibilities. She is a very active lady and is always ready to help her family in every possible way. She is 53 years old. Her husband’s name is G. T.. He works in a hospital and earns a reasonable income. 

Due to financial constraints, Shameem was unable to help her elder children finish their education. They left school and started working to financially support the family. Her eldest son works in a factory, her second son has a job with a private company, and her daughter sews clothes for neighboring clients. Her remaining children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. 

Shameem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband.  He wants to start a transport business to run after he completes his day job. With this loan he will buy a rickshaw, which will help him earn extra money every month.  Shameem is hopeful that this investment will help her family enjoy a better financial life by increasing her household income. 

Shameem is a regular loan user of Asasah's. This is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and had never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shameem.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw for starting a transportation business

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 36-year-old married man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been engaged in crop farming and pig raising for the last seven years. He dreams of diversifying his crops and enlarging his plantations. He wants a loan to reconstruct his pig sty.

loans.use: To rebuild pig sty

loans.name: 77-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Hoa P. Thị (103) is a 52-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Hoa is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 77-Quảng Hưng (18-4-77).

Hoa is widowed and has no children.  To making a living, Hoa provides room rental services to local community members.  Hoa has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2011, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hoa is requesting a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women for 4248000 VND to purchase materials needed to expand her services.  This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by this borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Thuyết (105) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her general store business.


2.  N. Thị Nương (104) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her general store business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hoa P. Thị (103) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 77-Quảng Hưng (18-4-77 Quảng Hưng).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 4500000 VND.  Vào 2011, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Thuyết (105) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  N. Thị Nương (104) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand service

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is an potato farmer and owns a maize mill.  He would like a loan to buy another maize mill.  He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He desires to educate his children and expand his business. However, mechanical breakdowns and climate changes are affecting his businesses.

loans.use: To buy a maize mill

loans.name: Maja

texts.en:
Maja is from the town of Banga. She is 60 years old, married, and has 5 children. Maja is engaged in farming, particularly plants and rice crops. She sells her rice to traders. Maja also raises chickens in her backyard. She sells the eggs to her neighbors. Maja hopes to acquire more chickens.

Maja joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maja has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and feeds

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 43-year-old widow who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  a general store and a grains trading business (buying & selling rice and corn).  She lives in Rizal, Palawan. 

Sylvia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past second loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sylvia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000,  uplifting her family's standard of living.  

This time, for her third cycle loan, Sylvia is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy additional goods to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Sylvia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anelita

texts.en:
Anelita is a married woman who lives in Rizal, Palawan. She earns a living by operating 2 business ventures:  a general store and a food vending business selling native delicacies. Her husband Rey, who is 44 years old, works as a welder.  He also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 3 children who are between 13 and 18 years old.  Two of her children are currently going to school. 

Anelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Anelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 24000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10000,  uplifting her family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 11th cycle loan, Anelita is borrowing PHP 28000 to buy stock of goods to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Anelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture is Mrs. Duong S., 55.  She is a fisherwoman in the province of Siem Reap. Her husband died of senility years ago. She lives with five children, four of whom are married, one is still single and helps her with the fishing business. 

Mrs. Duong S. and her son need to spend at least eight hours a day fishing in and around Tunle Sap River. They bring the fish they catch to sell in bulk to their customers, who are retail sellers in the market. Duong S. will use her loan to purchase a machine to connect with her existing boat, and the rest of Kiva funds she will use the improve her boat.

loans.use: To purchase machine to connect to boat, and improve boat

loans.name: Kitoola Women's Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
34-year-old Andrew T.'s business journey began with a modest farming business one and a half years ago.  It is from this farming business that Andrew obtained the capital to buy much of his start-up retail stock. His retail shop is located in Kitoola-Lugazi. 

Andrew is happily married and has  5 children.  He says his business generates 260,000 shillings for him monthly. With this loan, he says he is going to purchase more retail commodities to resell. Kitoola Women's group is the group he is affiliated with.

loans.use: To purchase of more retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren, 48, is widowed and lives with her daughter in Arhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her daughter attends a local secondary school. 

In 1984, Purevsuren began her own shoe repair business. She has been operating her business for a long time and has several regular customers. In the beginning, she started her business with a working capital of 10,000 MNT and now her working capital is 280,000 MNT. Purevsuren wants to expand her business and increase her income. She is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to purchase the necessary materials for her shoe repair service. 										

Purevsuren is an open-minded and sociable person who says, " I would like my daughter to get a good education and want to help her until she will be able to live on her own."

loans.use: To purchase the necessary materials for shoe repair

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to open another business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of cooking flour, cooking oil and soaps. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, cooking oil and soaps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional working capital for a business

loans.name: Memusi Ole

texts.en:
Memusi Ole N. is a 41-year-old farmer. He is married and a father of six schoolchildren. He has been farming his own piece of land for the last ten years.

Memusi learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET-registered client. This will be Memusi's second loan, and he plans to use the entire loan amount to prepare land for planting and to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his twenty acres of maize. He plans to use the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of the loan to develop his own plot of land and to lease more land for farming so he can increase his maize output.

Memusi's dream is to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant maize on a large scale.  Memusi is punctilious, and with the right resources at his disposal, he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To prepare land for planting and to buy chemicals and fertilizer for twenty acres of maize

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a married woman who lives in Talisay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  used clothing, pig fattening and fishing. Her husband Tarciano, who is 51 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living. They have four children who are 18 to 28 years old. Luzminda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Luzminda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16 loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000, which she intends to use to buy additional used clothes to resell to save up for the future education of her children. Luzminda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes to resell

loans.name: Ochgerel

texts.en:
Ochgerel, 27, is married and lives with her husband, mother and son in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on land they recently purchased. Her mother is retired and her three year old daughter goes to kindergarten. 

Ochgerel opened a food shop and her income has become more stable. She is planning to enlarge her shop and expand her business. She is a hardworking and modest person who says, "I would like to purchase more food as the price will get higher in the coming season." She is requesting a loan of 400,000 MNT for this purpose.

loans.use: to purchase more food for her shop

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy N. is a 30-year-old farmer. He is married to Vivian N. and a father of three schoolchildren. Sammy has been farming in the town of Narok for the last eleven years.

Sammy learned about KADET from a friend who is already a registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to buy farm inputs and hire field hands to prepare the land. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease more land for farming to increase his maize output and to build some rental houses.

Sammy's dream is to educate his children and improve his family's standard of living. Sammy is thorough, and with the right resources at his disposal, he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and hire field hands to prepare the land

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en:
Sikukuu is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a tailoring business for the past two years, with her neighbors as her customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She hopes to establish different business premises in the future.

With her KES 10,000 loan Sikukuu wants to purchase clothing materials and threads for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials and threads for her tailoring business

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her beauty salon business.  She is 37 years old and married to N. M., who is a security guard earning a low income.  Farzana started a beauty salon business to financially support her husband. Now her business is well established and she has a good number of clients in her community. She lives with her family in a city Gujranwala which is located in Punjab Pakistan and famous for its rice industry. Her home is located in Kalar Abadi which is a small residential area of the city and contains 2 rooms.  She is the mother of 4 sons and 2 daughters. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education except the youngest one who is only 3 years old. 

Farzana started this business 11 years ago and she is confident that the loan investment will bring positive changes to her business. She will invest the loan in buying beauty products like facial creams, mascaras, eye shadows etc.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has always attended every meeting and paid her installments on timely basis. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Farzana.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for a beauty salon business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman who lives in Aborlan, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a general store and buying & selling dry goods.  Her husband Orville, who is 37 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 8 and 12 years old. Joyce joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Joyce has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to buy stock for the sari-sari (general) store to save up for the future expansion of her business. Joyce is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Rupare

texts.en:
Rupare D. is 34 years old. He is married, and he is the father of five school-going children. Rupare is a farmer. He farms his own piece of land, and he has been doing this for the last ten years with good returns.

He learned about KADET LTD from a friend who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan. He plans to buy maize, seeds, chemicals, and fertilizer for his maize plantation. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming in order to increase his maize output.

Rupare's dream is to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can plant maize on a larger scale. Rupare struggles, but by having the right resources at his disposal, he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To buy maize, seeds, chemicals, and fertilizer

loans.name: Sasine Ole

texts.en:
Sasine Ole N. is 42 years old, married, and a father of six children. He has been farming in Narok for ten years.

Sasine learned about KADET from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his first loan, and he plans to use it to buy farm inputs and prepare the land for planting.  He plans to use the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan to re-invest in the farm.

Sasine's hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and to be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and prepare the land for planting

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa is a married woman with six children, two of whom graduated from school and four still attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She owns real estate houses which has been in operation for the last ten years. Her potential customers are  tenants and neighbours. In addition she also makes natural juice to sell which contributes as a source of income.  Arafa hopes to open more businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase cement and sand to expand her real estate houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cement and sand to expand her real estate houses.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single woman who owns a house tha  has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the high cost of transport.

She has operated a second hand clothes selling business for the past four years, selling from home to her neighbours. Fatuma hopes to open more business in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase  bundles of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Suyianka  William

texts.en:
Suyianka William T. is 32 years old. He is married, and he is the father of two children. He has been engaged in farming activity in Narok for seven years and earns a good income.

He learned about KADET LTD from a member of a group that is registered with KADET. This will be his second loan with KADET, and he is planning to prepare his land for planting maize. Maize has been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions.

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and to plant more acres of maize. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer in maize.

loans.use: To prepare his land for planting maize

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is in a business of selling retail goods. She is 39 years old and married with 2 children. All of her children go to school. She has taken a loan to stock more retail goods to sell. Anita hopes to pay for her children's school expenses with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more supplies of retail goods to sell.

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
Naima is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a natural juice making business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours. Naima faces the major challenge of seasonalitywith her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Ksh 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase mangoes and bananas for making juice to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes and bananas for making juice to sell.

loans.name: Sofia's Group

texts.en:
Sofia is the resident of Gujranwala which is a famous industrial city of Pakistan. She has lived there in a 3 room brick house with her family in the area of Kalar abadi for over many years.  She is 53 years old and married to Y. M.. They have 5 children. 

Her husband works in a government organization for a low income.  H is income is quite low because he is illiterate, so sofia works in people houses doing their domestic work like dish washing etc to financially support her husband and family. 

Due to poor their financial conditions, she couldn’t provide education expenses for her children. Her eldest son works in the government sector and her eldest daughter works with her doing domestic work in people houses. Her remaining children stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband to start a transport business. With the loan, he will buy a donkey and a donkey cart and start providing transport services to his customers.   

Sofia is hopeful that this investment will give her husband’s business a good start and will increase her household income. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She is a very responsible client and has established a good credit record.

loans.use: To buy a donkey and a donkey cart to start a transport business

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a single woman with two children, both  of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a food selling stall, operating from home where neighbours are her potential customers. Margret faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open another business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and vegetable oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past two years.  Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Mariam faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase hair chemicals and hair weaves. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase hair chemicals and hair weaves.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is currently in a business of selling bread.  She is 25 years old, and married with 2 children. One goes to school. Ester asked for a loan to stock more bread to sell.  She hopes to pay the tuition for her children's school with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a charcoal selling business.  She sells at home to her neighbours and passersby. Rachel faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open more businesses in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Thumu

texts.en:
Thumu is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past four years.  Her potential customers are passersby and the neighboring community.  Thumu faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her beauty salon in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cosmetics and hair weaves. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and hair weaves.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a married woman with ten children, six of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past ten years, selling in a shop and from home to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition, she also sells natural juice which contributes to her other source of income. Esha faces the major challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to grow more business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of frozen meat, chicken and pork

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more radios and watches

loans.name: Joseph Oloisiriri

texts.en:
Joseph O. K. is a 34-year-old man from the agricultural town of Kilgoris, south of the Rift Valley in Kenya. He is married to Lilian K., who farms in the same town. They have four children who depend on them for their basic needs.

Joseph has a book-selling business, whereby he sells religious and other motivational books. Some of the books are written in his local dialect of Maasai in order to reach his community at the language they understand best. He has done this work for the last seven years and makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES. He recently joined KADET LTD to gain access to microcredit, and he is now taking out his first loan, which he will use to buy more books to sell.

Joseph will use his profits to diversify into the transport business (locally known as boda boda), since he believes that he will make extra income. His desire is to see his business grow, enabling him to support his family through the provision of basic needs.

loans.use: To buy a stock of books to sell

loans.name: Joseph Ewesit

texts.en:
Joseph Ewesit E. is a young man of twenty three years. He is married and is the father of one beautiful child. They live in Lodwar town. He runs a butchery shop and also sells goats in the same area. He has been in this business for five years now and makes a monthly income of KES.10,500.


This will be Joseph's first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy goats for slaughter. He will then sell the meat. With the income he gets he wants to expand his shop. In the future he wants to provide his family with all their basic needs.

loans.use: To buy goats for slaughter

loans.name: C7449 Duterimbere Group

texts.en:
Leonard is 24 years old and is single. Leonard currently works in a shop in Kanazi district.  He takes care of two relatives who are between 8 and 25 years old. He runs a well-organized small store which sells various products, such as rice, sugar, soap, etc. He has been operating it successfully for three years, and his shop is open from 6am to 7pm every day.

Leonard is the leader of this group, called 'DUTERIMBERE' in the local language, which means "to be developed". The group consists of two men and eight woman. 

The group has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more products for their boutique so that they can provide better service to their customers. The loan will impact the group members by helping them to purchase larger quantities of stock, which will allow them to earn more profits. With the extra income they all earn, Leonard and his group hope to save some money and to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Sairam

texts.en:
Sairam runs a small business selling men’s shoes and clothing. She is married, with two grown children. Sairam has been in this business for over 10 years and has partnered with IMON International for almost 4 years. Her diligent, hard work has helped her succeed in business and maintain a loyal clientele. Sairam would like to receive a loan for 7500 Somoni to serve as working capital in her business. Financial assistance will help her purchase an assortment of clothing. High-quality, durable, and comfortable merchandise will sell well and will help Sairam's business grow, especially in the coming spring season.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
K. Zuhro is a married mom who supports her family with a small business selling men's shoes. She has been in business for 20 years and has gained much experience as an entrepreneur and sales person. One of the things she enjoys the most about her business is the opportunity to help her customers look their best. She tries to have a variety of shoes on hand so that she is able to offer a range of choices and to meet each customer's needs. 

Financial support from IMON International has been instrumental in the success of Zuhro's business. She has been able to take out several loans and has established herself as one of the best clients. Zuhro's goal is to continue to learn and improve her business. She has requested a loan of 7500 Somoni so that she can purchase some additional inventory. This loan will enable Zuhro to be prepared for increased demand and earn some additional income that will help her and her family.

These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. loans.use: To increase working capital for development of business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more dozens of slippers, eggs and bread.

loans.name: Shamin

texts.en: Shamin is currently in a business of selling tea. She is 40 years old, a widow, and has 1 child who goes to school. Shamin borrowed a loan to stock more tea to sell. Shamin hopes to build a house with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more tea to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Florence Nayelel

texts.en:
Florence Nayelel R. is a  27-year-old lady. She is married and is the mother of four children. They live in Napetet in the outskirts of Lodwar town. She sells fish in the same area and has been in this business for eight years now. She makes a monthly income of KES 8,500.


This is her first loan from  KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy fish for resale and, with the income, she plans to open a retail shop. In the future she wants to become a big businesswoman in Lodwar.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 31-year-old, industrious businessman from Pap Onditi, an upcoming town near the city of Kisumu. He is married to Alice who operates a money transfer business (known as M-pesa). 

Paul has been operating a motorcycle spare parts shop in Pap Onditi for the past two years. At the moment, Paul makes a monthly income of Kshs 30,000. He is taking his first loan of Kshs. 25,000 which he intends to use to buy additional stock of spare parts. 


He will use the anticipated profits to plough back into his business and to support his wife in her money transfer business. His hope is to stabilize his business and to become a leading businessman in his town.

loans.use: To buy stock of  spare parts.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is currently in a business of selling goods, such as sugar, in a shop. She is 31 years old, married to a driver, and has 3 children. All of her children go to school. Sarah borrowed a loan to stock more goods to sell. She hopes to pay her children's school fees with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more goods to sell.

loans.name: Geofrey Omondi

texts.en:
Geoffrey A. is a 25-year-old, enterprising man from Kisumu, a city along the shores of Lake Victoria. He is married to Janet who sells vegetables. They have two children aged two and four years.

Geoffrey operates a motorcycle transport business in Kisumu (a business locally known as Boda Boda). This form of transport is becoming popular in many rural areas of Kenya since it is cheap and convenient. Kennedy is taking a first asset loan from KADET Limited to buy another motorcycle. He plans to pay back this loan well so that he can qualify for more loans in the future. 

Geoffrey will use the profits to pay for the loan and also to save so that he can buy another motorcycle: his long term plan is to own a transport business (taxi company) that can support his family in terms of their basic needs.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 41 years old and is married with four children.  He is a motorcycle driver . He has been in this business for about one and a half years.  He works from 6am until 9pm every day. His business is well-organized.

Theoneste has now requested a Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, for the purpose of expanding his business by buying another motorcycle to help him.

With this loan, Theoneste has a vision of growing his business.  He hopes to earn more profits than before, which, in turn, will be used for further reinvestment in his business, and he will be able to save in the future.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Nachodok  Alepar

texts.en:
Nachodok Alepar R. is a fifty-year-old widow who has six children, all over eighteen years. They live in Kalokol in the outskirts of Lodwar town. She has been selling dried fish in the same area for ten years. She makes a monthly income of KES.9,500.


This will be Nachodok's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to buy fishing nets with the loan. With the income she will get she wants to venture into transporting and sending dried fish to Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya.  


In the future Nachodok wants to be a sucessful business lady and also to be able to support herself financially.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Marie louise is 32 years old and is married, with 3 children aged between 7 and 12 years.  For 3 years, Marie louise has been running a shop that sells African cloth. The shop is open from 7am until 5pm every day except on the weekend, and employs one other person.

Marie louise will use her loan to purchase more cloths and also to reinvest in her business. With any profits, Marie louise will have savings in the future.

loans.use: To buy more African cloths to sell

loans.name: Suzi

texts.en: Suzi is currently in a business of selling alcohol. She is 33 years old and married to a policeman.  She has 2 children, both of whom go to school. Suzi asked for a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. With extra profits from her business, Suzi hopes to construct a house in the future.

loans.use: To stock more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.en:
Lucie is 48 and is married, with seven children between 8 and 24 years old. Marie has been running a pub that sells drinks and food for 3 years. The pub is open from 5am until 9pm every day, and she employs one other person.

Lucie will use her loan to purchase more drinks and food for her pub and also to help start a new sorghum business. All her profits will go back into investing in this new business.

loans.use: Expanding her pub

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 32 years old and is married, with four children between 3 and 13 years old. His business is well-organized. Jean Bosco sells sacks to the wholesalers who want to bag charcoal, rice, sugar and so on.  His business is open from 6am until 5pm every day. He employs two people and has 3 years experience in his business.

Jean Bosco has requested a loan from KIVA. via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more sacks to sell. With this loan,  Jean Bosco will increase his business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks to sell.

loans.name: Rogers Joseph

texts.en:
Rogers K. is 27 years old and single. He operates a shop in Kamobo Trading Centre. He has been in this business for three years earning a monthly income of 14,500 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

Rogers has borrowed 79,000 KES from KADET – this being his third loan after paying the previous loans successfully. He intends to use the entire amount to purchase a motorbike for taxi services in the town and also to add more stock to his retail shop. His hopes and dreams are to own a wholesale shop and several motorbikes in town.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and business stock
